original: bsags pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa rnams so //

original: 'di ni 'dir srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir srid pa bar ma med pa'i khungs yin no //
translated: This is the source for the existence of the intermediate existence here.

original: 'di la khyod kyis thal ma thag tu srid pa bar ma yod par ji skad smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis thal ma thag tu srid pa bar ma yod par ji skad smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: You say that the existence of the intermediate being is stated in the passage just cited, but that passage is not intended to teach that.

original: srid pa bar ma med do zhes kho bo cag gis 'dod pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma med do zhes kho bo cag gis 'dod pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: We accept that the intermediate existence does not exist, and that passage is not intended to teach that.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that?

original: slob dpon gyis brtag pa 'di khyod la yang mtshungs te /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis brtag pa 'di khyod la yang mtshungs te / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Master says, “This objection is equally applicable to you.”

original: dri ba 'dri zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di la khyod kyis srid pa bar ma med do zhes de skad du smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi kho bo cag gis srid pa bar ma yod do //
analyzed: dri ba 'dri zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di la khyod kyis srid pa bar ma med do zhes de skad du smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa yin gyi kho bo cag gis srid pa bar ma yod do //
translated: The meaning of the passage is, “You ask this question.”🔽You say that the existence of the intermediate being is stated in the passage just cited, but that passage is not intended to teach that.🔽We accept that the intermediate existence does not exist, and that passage is not intended to teach that.

original: zhes ji skad smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go ga las /
analyzed: zhes ji skad smras pa 'di ni dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go ga las /
translated: How do you know that?

original: de lta bas na gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the Master says, “In both cases,” and so on.

original: srid pa bar ma yod do srid pa bar ma med do zhes bya ba gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang khyod dang yang ji skad bshad pa'i mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yod do srid pa bar ma med do zhes bya ba gnyis ka'i phyogs la yang khyod dang yang ji skad bshad pa'i mdo mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither of the two positions—that an intermediate existence exists or that it does not exist—contradicts the sutra that you have cited.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This is the meaning of the passage from the sutra.

original: shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khungs kyi don shes par byed pa gang la gzhan du shes par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes par byed pa gzhan du shes par mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khungs kyi don shes par byed pa gang la gzhan du shes par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the sutra passage is that a source that does not allow one to understand the meaning in any other way is a source.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te ;🔽tshigs su bcad pa'am mdo gang gi don rnam pa gzhan du bkri bar mi nus pa de ni khungs yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te ; tshigs su bcad pa'am mdo gang gi don rnam pa gzhan du bkri bar mi nus pa de ni khungs yin la /
translated: The sutra passage teaches the following.🔽A source is a verse or a sutra whose meaning cannot be interpreted in any other way.

original: gang gi don rnam pa gzhan du yang yin par mi 'gal ba des ni brjod mkhan nyid sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi don rnam pa gzhan du yang yin par mi 'gal ba des ni brjod mkhan nyid sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: A source that allows one to understand the meaning in other ways does not eliminate doubt.

original: yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi srid pa bar ma med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la kun tu rmongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i log bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi srid pa bar ma med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la kun tu rmongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i log bar lta ba'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika doctrine that there is no intermediate existence is a false view that is preceded by confusion about cause and effect.

original: 'di ni gang mdo de dang de las sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang mdo de dang de las sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the statement in a sūtra: “There are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally.”

original: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover, the doubt about the existence of an intermediate state that is stated in the passage, “If one goes to such and such a realm,” is also based on the same sūtra.

original: skye ba'i srid pa'i the tshom 'di yang gang las yin ;
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa'i the tshom 'di yang gang las yin ;
translated: How can this doubt about the existence of an intermediate state arise?

original: las kyi 'bras bu gcig dang du ma nyid las na mdo dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu gcig dang du ma nyid las na mdo dang 'gal lo //
translated: It arises from the fact that the effect of karma is both one and many.

original: gang la gang zag mngon par grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma spangs pa dang skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa dang skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa yod ces rgyas par te /
analyzed: gang la gang zag mngon par grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma spangs pa dang skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa dang skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa yod ces rgyas par te /
translated: The sūtra states: “There are those who have not abandoned the fetters that establish a person in a realm, but have abandoned the fetters of birth. There are those who have not abandoned the fetters of birth, but have abandoned the fetters that establish a person in a realm. There are those who have abandoned both the fetters that establish a person in a realm and the fetters of birth. There are those who have abandoned neither the fetters that establish a person in a realm nor the fetters of birth.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun slong du gyur pa'i @349a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun slong du gyur pa'i @349a * //
translated: The fetters that establish a person in a realm are the motivating factors of affliction.

original: las rnams nyon mongs pa bzhin te tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rnams nyon mongs pa bzhin te tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Action would be different from the defilements.

original: las tha dad pa'i phyir 'di mi 'dod de /
analyzed: las tha dad pa'i phyir 'di mi 'dod de /
translated: This is unacceptable, because action is not different from the defilements.

original: sngon dus srid pa'i sha tshugs zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon dus srid pa'i sha tshugs zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The Sūtra says: “The body of existence of the past time was of such a form.

original: yang 'di las gcig gi 'bras bu snga ma dang phyi ma de'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nges pa ci zhig byas /
analyzed: yang 'di las gcig gi 'bras bu snga ma dang phyi ma de'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nges pa ci zhig byas /
translated: ” Moreover, what is the certainty that the first action produces its effect first and that the last action produces its effect last?

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i las bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa'i las bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: The effect of action is experienced in the present life, etc.

original: 'di myong par nges pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di myong par nges pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the action is certain to be experienced.

original: nag po'i las byed pa'i mi la sogs pa rnams dbyibs tha dad pa la mi brten par mthong ngo //
analyzed: nag po'i las byed pa'i mi la sogs pa rnams dbyibs tha dad pa la mi brten par mthong ngo //
translated: We see that a person who has committed a black action, etc., does not necessarily manifest a body of a certain form.

original: de nas las kyi dbye ba las 'dir dpyad pa 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas las kyi dbye ba las 'dir dpyad pa 'di 'byung ste /
translated: This is why the following question is asked here:🔽Is the form of the intermediate being of all those who go to the realm of the

original: ci dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba thams cad kyi srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs gcig mngon par 'grub pa ma 'on te sha tshugs tha dad pa zhig 'byung zhes rnam par bcad pa ste /
analyzed: ci dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba thams cad kyi srid pa bar ma'i sha tshugs gcig mngon par 'grub pa ma 'on te sha tshugs tha dad pa zhig 'byung zhes rnam par bcad pa ste /
translated: hell-beings the same, or is it different?

original: de'i phyir de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because it is projected by a single action.🔽”

original: las ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Action is of two types:

original: 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: that which projects and that which actualizes.

original: da la de dag gi yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni du ma yin gyi /
analyzed: da la de dag gi yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni du ma yin gyi /
translated: Among them, that which actualizes is multiple,

original: 'phen bar byed pa ni gcig yin te de'i phyir de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir /🔽sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'phen bar byed pa ni gcig yin te de'i phyir de ni 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir / sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: but that which projects is single. Therefore, it is said, “because it is projected by a single action.🔽”🔽It is called “having the form of prior existence” because it has the form of prior existence that will arise.

original: 'di la dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sha tshugs lta bu yod pas na sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can te /
analyzed: 'di la dus snga ma'i srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sha tshugs lta bu yod pas na sngon dus srid 'byung sha tshugs can te /
translated: It is called “having the form of prior existence” because it has the form of prior existence that will arise.

original: rgya'i 'bur bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya'i 'bur bzhin no //
translated: It is like a raised seal.

original: sngon gyi dus smos pa ni 'chi ba'i srid pa dang skye ba'i srid pa las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus smos pa ni 'chi ba'i srid pa dang skye ba'i srid pa las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “prior” is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the prior existence of death and the prior existence of birth.

original: mngal na gnas pa rnams kho na 'chi na 'gro ba lnga ba'i srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa rnams kho na 'chi na 'gro ba lnga ba'i srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: When those who are in the womb die, the intermediate existence of the five destinies is actualized.

original: lhag pa dag na 'phin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag pa dag na 'phin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other hells are called “special” because they are created by special karma.

original: lhag pa ni me ma mur la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag pa ni me ma mur la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The “special” hells are the Kukūla, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni dmyal ba'i me ni nyes pa byas pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dmyal ba'i me ni nyes pa byas pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir skyon 'di med do //
translated: Others say that the hell guardians are not sentient beings, because the fire of the hells is created by karma.

original: ma bsags shing las kyi 'bras bu ma thob pa dmyal ba'i mes mi tshig go //
analyzed: ma bsags shing las kyi 'bras bu ma thob pa dmyal ba'i mes mi tshig go //
translated: They say that the fire of the hells does not burn those who have not accumulated the karma to be born there.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is a definite rule.

original: gang gi phyir gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir des dzambu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhon nu thor bu lta bu mtshan dang dpe byad dang bcas pa ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir des dzambu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya snang bar mdzad de /
translated: Because the Bodhisattva enters the womb of his mother in the form of a fully developed young boy, he illuminates a hundred million world systems with his radiance.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'od yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'od yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the light that accompanies him is fully developed.

original: bye ba phrag brgya zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong @349b chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: bye ba phrag brgya zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong @349b chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: A hundred million means a billion.

original: gzhan dag na re sngon dus kyi tshe srid pa thams cad kyang gzhon nu thor bu'i dbyibs dang bong tshod de nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sngon dus kyi tshe srid pa thams cad kyang gzhon nu thor bu'i dbyibs dang bong tshod de nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: According to another opinion, the intermediate being of the Bodhisattva is like the Bodhisattva in the Gandāyupāda stage.

original: de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma tsam du zad de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This is only a sign,

original: mtshan mkhan rnams lung ston pa dang rjes su mthun par zad so //
analyzed: mtshan mkhan rnams lung ston pa dang rjes su mthun par zad so //
translated: in conformity with the prediction of the fortune-tellers.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya lus pa nas log pa yin na //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas bzlog nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya lus pa nas log pa yin na //
translated: The Bodhisattva has long since turned away from the animal destiny.

original: dper na rgyal po kri k'i sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po kri k'i sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, King Kṛkī.

original: ji ltar rgyal po kri k'is 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi mtshan ma tsam du rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po kri k'is 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don gyi mtshan ma tsam du rmi lam bcu mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: As the story goes, King Kṛkī saw ten dreams which were omens of the future.

original: rgyal po kri k'is nub gcig la rmi lam bcu rmis par grag snya te /
analyzed: rgyal po kri k'is nub gcig la rmi lam bcu rmis par grag snya te /
translated: It is said that King Kṛkī had ten dreams in one night.

original: 'di lta ste glang po che skar khung nas byung nas mjug ma la 'thogs pa dang / khron pa chu shin tu dangs shing zhim la ma rnyog cing ma g-yogs pa zhig ma 'thungs pa kho nar skams pa dang / tsan dan go sh'irsha dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste glang po che skar khung nas byung nas mjug ma la 'thogs pa dang / khron pa chu shin tu dangs shing zhim la ma rnyog cing ma g-yogs pa zhig ma 'thungs pa kho nar skams pa dang / tsan dan go sh'irsha dang /
translated: It is like an elephant that has come through a window and is stuck with its rear end.🔽It is like a well with very clear, sweet, and unsullied water that has not been drunk and has dried up.🔽It is like sandalwood and gośīrṣa.

original: ae randa'i bud shing brje ba dang / mu tig bre gang phye bre gang du 'tshong ba dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen pos spre'u dbang bskur ba dang / skyes bu mi gtsang bas gos pa zhig gzhan dag la yang bsgo ba dang / glang po che'i phru gus glang po che chen po zil gyis gnon pa dang /
analyzed: ae randa'i bud shing brje ba dang / mu tig bre gang phye bre gang du 'tshong ba dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen pos spre'u dbang bskur ba dang / skyes bu mi gtsang bas gos pa zhig gzhan dag la yang bsgo ba dang / glang po che'i phru gus glang po che chen po zil gyis gnon pa dang /
translated: For example, an elephant stuck in a window, a well with very clear, sweet, and unpolluted water that dries up without being drunk, sandalwood and eranda wood being exchanged, selling a measure of pearls for a measure of barley, a great assembly of people consecrating a monkey, a person covered in filth ordering others, a young elephant overpowering a great elephant,

original: lha'i tshal nas me tog la sogs pa khyer ba dang / dga' ston chen po dor ba dang / skyes bu bco brgyad kyis ras yug gcig drangs kyang mi 'dral bar mthong la /
analyzed: lha'i tshal nas me tog la sogs pa khyer ba dang / dga' ston chen po dor ba dang / skyes bu bco brgyad kyis ras yug gcig drangs kyang mi 'dral bar mthong la /
translated: taking flowers and so on from a divine grove, abandoning a great festival, and seeing eighteen people pulling a single cloth without tearing it.

original: mthong nas kyang skrag ste /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang skrag ste /
translated: Having seen this, he was frightened.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das des dbugs 'byin par mdzad cing bka' stsal ba ;
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das des dbugs 'byin par mdzad cing bka' stsal ba ;
translated: He asked the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa, and that Blessed One consoled him and said,

original: rgyal po chen po ma 'jigs shig 'di dag khyod kyi 'chi ltas ston par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po ma 'jigs shig 'di dag khyod kyi 'chi ltas ston par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “Great King, do not be afraid. These are not omens of your death.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they then?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba zhig 'byung ste /
translated: In the future there will appear a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha called Śākyamuni.

original: de'i gsung rab nyams par 'gyur ba'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhig go //
analyzed: de'i gsung rab nyams par 'gyur ba'i mtshan mar gyur pa zhig go //
translated: These are signs of the decline of his teachings.

original: dper na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is an example of this?

original: de'i nyan thos chen po longs spyod spangs shing rab tu byung nas slong mo gzar bu gang byin pa tsam gyis rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa skyed de /
analyzed: de'i nyan thos chen po longs spyod spangs shing rab tu byung nas slong mo gzar bu gang byin pa tsam gyis rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa skyed de /
translated: One of his great hearers will give up his wealth, go forth, and beg for alms. He will be so concerned with gain and honor that

original: glang po che skar khung la mjug ma 'thog pa ltar tshul ma yin pas nyon mongs @350a * //
analyzed: glang po che skar khung la mjug ma 'thog pa ltar tshul ma yin pas nyon mongs @350a * //
translated: he will be like an elephant rubbing himself against a window, and in the wrong way he will be afflicted with

original: par 'gyur zhing legs pa'i don la mi rtsol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: par 'gyur zhing legs pa'i don la mi rtsol bar 'gyur /
translated: They will not strive for the meaning of the well-uttered teachings.

original: khron pa chu ma 'thungs par skams pa lhar chos smra ba chos ston pa la 'ga' yang nyan par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khron pa chu ma 'thungs par skams pa lhar chos smra ba chos ston pa la 'ga' yang nyan par mi 'gyur /
translated: Like a dry well that is no longer used for drinking, no one will listen to the Dharma teachings of the Dharma preachers.

original: go sh'irsha dang 'dra ba'i gtsug lag dang dam pa ma yin pa'i bstan bcos dag brje bar 'gyur /
analyzed: go sh'irsha dang 'dra ba'i gtsug lag dang dam pa ma yin pa'i bstan bcos dag brje bar 'gyur /
translated: Like the Goshīrṣa and other such sacred texts, the treatises of non-Dharma will be exchanged.

original: zang zing gi phyir mu tig bre gang lta bu'i chos ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: zang zing gi phyir mu tig bre gang lta bu'i chos ston par 'gyur /
translated: For the sake of material things, they will teach the Dharma like a measure of pearls.

original: spre'u lta bu'i tshul khrims 'chal pa mdun gyis bdar bar 'gyur /🔽tshul khrims 'chal pa la brtsad pa dang mi gtsang bas gos pa ltar bdag kho nar ma zad do //
analyzed: spre'u lta bu'i tshul khrims 'chal pa mdun gyis bdar bar 'gyur / tshul khrims 'chal pa la brtsad pa dang mi gtsang bas gos pa ltar bdag kho nar ma zad do //
translated: They will be like monkeys, with their immoral conduct.

original: zhes dad pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag la yang bskur bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes dad pa dang ldan pa gzhan dag la yang bskur bar 'gyur /
translated: Not only will they be like that, but they will also slander others who have faith.

original: glang po che'i phru gu 'dra ba'i gsar bus glang po che chen po dang 'dra ba'i rgan po rnams la spyo bar 'gyur /
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu 'dra ba'i gsar bus glang po che chen po dang 'dra ba'i rgan po rnams la spyo bar 'gyur /
translated: Like young elephants, they will insult the elders who are like great elephants.

original: dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa blangs te khyim pa dag la ster bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa blangs te khyim pa dag la ster bar 'gyur /
translated: They will take flowers, fruit, etc. from the Saṅgha or a stūpa and give them to householders.

original: dga' ston chen po dang 'dra ba'i so so thar pa'i mdo 'don pa la 'dus nas rtsod pa smra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dga' ston chen po dang 'dra ba'i so so thar pa'i mdo 'don pa la 'dus nas rtsod pa smra bar 'gyur /
translated: They will assemble to recite the Pratimokṣa Sūtra, which is like a great festival, and then they will engage in debate.

original: bstan pa rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyes par 'gyur /
analyzed: bstan pa rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyes par 'gyur /
translated: The teaching will split into eighteen sects.

original: de dag kyang ras yug lta bu'i rnam par grol ba'i ras yug 'dren cing /
analyzed: de dag kyang ras yug lta bu'i rnam par grol ba'i ras yug 'dren cing /
translated: They will also be like a cloth of liberation.

original: de gzhan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they will not be different from it.

original: srid pa bar ma ni lto brtol te 'jug pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni lto brtol te 'jug pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The intermediate existence does not enter the womb by splitting open the side, but

original: las kyis lto bar 'dzin pa'i phyir skye gnas kyi sgo nas 'jug go //
analyzed: las kyis lto bar 'dzin pa'i phyir skye gnas kyi sgo nas 'jug go //
translated: it enters through the opening of birth, because karma holds it in the womb.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: thogs pa med pa'i phyir gang 'dod pa nas 'jug go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phyir gang 'dod pa nas 'jug go zhes zer ro //
translated: It enters wherever it wishes, because it is unimpeded.

original: gzugs na spyod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The form realm

original: 'og min na lus kyi tshad dpag tshad khri drug stong pa rnams dzambu'i gling du mngon par 'grub pa'i go skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na nam mkha' yangs pa'i phyir dang / rten nor bu'i 'od la sogs pa'i snang ba dang 'dra bas 'gar yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og min na lus kyi tshad dpag tshad khri drug stong pa rnams dzambu'i gling du mngon par 'grub pa'i go skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na nam mkha' yangs pa'i phyir dang / rten nor bu'i 'od la sogs pa'i snang ba dang 'dra bas 'gar yang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space is vast and because they are like the light of a jewel, etc., their support, they are not obstructed anywhere.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re dge slong ma dkar mo kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge slong ma dkar mo kho na yin te /
translated: Others say that it is the nun Kāli,

original: dge 'dun la chos gos phul ba'i smon lam gyi dbang gis ji srid de'i gdud la bkur sti bya ba'i phyir mchod rten bzhengs pa yang gos kyis dkris pa'i bar du gyur to //
analyzed: dge 'dun la chos gos phul ba'i smon lam gyi dbang gis ji srid de'i gdud la bkur sti bya ba'i phyir mchod rten bzhengs pa yang gos kyis dkris pa'i bar du gyur to //
translated: because of the power of her aspiration to offer robes to the Saṅgha, and because the stūpa was wrapped in cloth until the time when her family would honor her.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa @350b thams cad byang chub kho nar bsdos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa @350b thams cad byang chub kho nar bsdos pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, because all the roots of virtue he has begun are dedicated to awakening alone,

original: de'i srid pa bar ma gos dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i srid pa bar ma gos dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: his intermediate existence is not clothed.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i yang gos dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say that the bodhisattva also possesses clothing,

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas tshe ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams kyi srid pa bar ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas tshe ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams kyi srid pa bar ma bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because he has a great deal of shame and embarrassment, like the intermediate existence of the form realm.

original: yang srid pa snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang srid pa snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The former existence and so on are mentioned.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad yin pas /
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad yin pas /
translated: Since existence is all contaminated things,

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag med par nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that existence is the five appropriated aggregates without distinction.

original: 'dir ni sems can zhes bya ba kho na gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems can zhes bya ba kho na gzung ngo //
translated: Here only sentient beings are referred to.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is classified in four types.

original: de ni gcig kho na yin mod kyi skye ba dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
analyzed: de ni gcig kho na yin mod kyi skye ba dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir dbye'o //
translated: Although it is only one, it is classified in four types by the distinctions of birth and state.

original: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye na zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni /
analyzed: gal te sems can gzugs can dag gi nang du skye na zhes bya ba la gzugs can smos pa ni /
translated: If one is born among the form realm gods,

original: gzugs med pa rnams su srid pa bar ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su srid pa bar ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For there is no intermediate existence in the formless realm.

original: ni tsi sh'am bh'a b'a nam srid pa bar ma nyid sngon zhes bya ba de nyid dus snga ma'i srid par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ni tsi sh'am bh'a b'a nam srid pa bar ma nyid sngon zhes bya ba de nyid dus snga ma'i srid par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that the intermediate existence itself is the prior existence, then it would be the prior existence of the prior existence.

original: srid pa bar ma med par skye ba la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma med par skye ba la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because birth without an intermediate existence is not the result of the prior existence.

original: de'i phyir gang gi gnas skabs las srid pa bar ma rnams srid pa bar ma la sogs pa rnams su skye ba 'byung ba de 'dir dus snga ma'i srid pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi gnas skabs las srid pa bar ma rnams srid pa bar ma la sogs pa rnams su skye ba 'byung ba de 'dir dus snga ma'i srid pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the prior existence is that existence from which the intermediate existence arises, and the intermediate existence arises from the intermediate existence and so on.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba gzhan la bltos pa de 'di'i gnas skabs la ste skye ba du ma'i gnas skabs gsum la bltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba gzhan la bltos pa de 'di'i gnas skabs la ste skye ba du ma'i gnas skabs gsum la bltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it depends on another birth, it is the prior existence of that state, but it does not depend on the three states of many births.

original: srid pa bar ma de yang lung dang rigs pa'i yul yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma de yang lung dang rigs pa'i yul yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: Not only is the intermediate existence the object of scripture and reasoning,

original: 'o na ci zhe na ris mthun lha mig dag pas mthong /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ris mthun lha mig dag pas mthong /
translated: but it is also seen by the divine eye of those of similar class.

original: ris mthun pas blta bar bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: ris mthun pas blta bar bya ba yin zhing /
translated: It is seen by those of similar type.

original: lha mig dag pas blta bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha mig dag pas blta bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is seen by the pure divine eye.🔽Those of similar type see it.

original: ris mthun pa'i srid pa bar ma dag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba la dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma ni dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma kho nas mthong gi / gzhan gyi srid pa bar ma dag gis ni ma yin te gzhan dag la yang de dang
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i srid pa bar ma dag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba la dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma ni dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma kho nas mthong gi / gzhan gyi srid pa bar ma dag gis ni ma yin te gzhan dag la yang de dang
translated: A being of the intermediate state of a hell being sees only a being of the intermediate state of a hell being, not the intermediate state of another type of being.

original: 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: gang dag la lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mngon par shes pa las byung ba yod pa de dag gis kyang 'di mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang dag la lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mngon par shes pa las byung ba yod pa de dag gis kyang 'di mthong ngo //
translated: Those who have the pure divine eye that arises from higher perception also see it.

original: lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa ni skyon bcu gcig dang bral @351a * //
analyzed: lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa ni skyon bcu gcig dang bral @351a * //
translated: The divine eye is extremely pure and free from eleven faults.

original: pa ste ; skyon de dag kyang the tshom dang yid la mi byed pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams drags pa dang / sems pa yo po dang / bag tsha ba dang /
analyzed: pa ste ; skyon de dag kyang the tshom dang yid la mi byed pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams drags pa dang / sems pa yo po dang / bag tsha ba dang /
translated: These faults are doubt, nonattention, physical indisposition, torpor, sleep, excitation, overexertion, mental depression, mental agitation,

original: 'du shes sna tshogs pa dang smra ba mangs pa dang / ha cang bsgom drags pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs pa dang smra ba mangs pa dang / ha cang bsgom drags pa rnams so //
translated: various discriminations, excessive speech, and excessive meditation.

original: gzugs rnams su mngon par shes pa las byung ba ni mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs rnams su mngon par shes pa las byung ba ni mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The superknowledge that arises from the form realm is of the nature of the superknowledge itself.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “the result of meditation.”

original: lha'i mig skyes nas thob pas ni mi mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig skyes nas thob pas ni mi mthong ste /
translated: One who obtains the divine eye at birth does not see.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pas mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pas mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that one sees with the divine eye that is extremely pure.

original: 'dir gang lha'i mig skyes nas thob pas mi mthong ba'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang lha'i mig skyes nas thob pas mi mthong ba'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the cause that one who obtains the divine eye at birth does not see?

original: shin tu dang ba'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu dang ba'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that it is because it is not extremely clear.

original: skyes nas thob pa'i mig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa'i mig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not the object of the eye sense faculty obtained through rebirth.

original: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid ba bar ma pas thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lha'i srid ba bar ma pas thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: According to others, the intermediate beings of the heavenly realm see everything.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i mig ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bar khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir te gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i mig ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bar khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir te gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The eye sense faculty of the intermediate beings is superior to the eye sense faculty of the realm of birth to which they are headed; the same for the other sense faculties.

original: dbang po kun tshang zhes bya ba la /🔽sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'i sha tshugs can yin yang /
analyzed: dbang po kun tshang zhes bya ba la / sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'i sha tshugs can yin yang /
translated: The intermediate beings possess all the faculties.

original: rnam par smin pa'i snying ngo dang po yin pa'i phyir dang / srid pa 'tshol ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i snying ngo dang po yin pa'i phyir dang / srid pa 'tshol ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba med pa yin no //
translated: Even though they have the form of the prior existence, they are not incomplete in their faculties, because their faculties are complete from the beginning, and because they seek existence.

original: 'gro ba gang dang / khams dang gnas gang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni de las rnam pa thams cad du zlog tu med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dang / khams dang gnas gang du skye bar 'gyur ba ni de las rnam pa thams cad du zlog tu med do //
translated: They cannot be turned away from the realm, the mode of birth, and the place where they will be reborn.

original: mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi'i srid pa bar ma med par gyur nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The intermediate beings of the human realm, having disappeared,

original: khams dang gnas dag la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams dang gnas dag la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the realms and the planes of existence.

original: nges pa 'dis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nges pa 'dis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the phrase “by this rule,”

original: ci'i phyir 'gro ba'i srid pa bar ma las kyi 'phen par gcig kho na zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gro ba'i srid pa bar ma las kyi 'phen par gcig kho na zhe na /
translated: why is it that the intermediate existence of beings who are going to a realm of rebirth is projected by a single action?

original: myong bar nges pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa de 'gro ba de dang phrad pa'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong bar nges pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa de 'gro ba de dang phrad pa'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is projected by the action that is determined to be experienced, and it is projected in order to go to that realm of rebirth.

original: rgyun tu zhugs ba la sogs pa rnams gnas dang sa 'phos pa las bar ma dor 'chi ba gang yin pa ni bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs ba la sogs pa rnams gnas dang sa 'phos pa las bar ma dor 'chi ba gang yin pa ni bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The opponent’s argument is that the intermediate existence of those who are stream-enterers and so on is averted by the transference of the basis and the plane.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i slob pa'i srid pa bar ma la ni sa 'pho ba med de lam las rgyal ba ma @351b yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khams las ni mngon du ma gyur pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i slob pa'i srid pa bar ma la ni sa 'pho ba med de lam las rgyal ba ma @351b yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i khams las ni mngon du ma gyur pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intermediate existence of a learner who is not free from passion does not transfer to another plane, because he has not conquered the path and because he has not transcended the suffering of the desire realm.

original: gang dag mngon du gyur par 'dod pa de dag kyang rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa dag sa 'pho bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang dag mngon du gyur par 'dod pa de dag kyang rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa dag sa 'pho bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Those who are born in the same family and those who have only one interruption are not considered to change their stage.

original: lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba so sor nges pa dag kyang lha dang mi dag tu skye ba la zhugs pa'i las mngon du gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan du skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba so sor nges pa dag kyang lha dang mi dag tu skye ba la zhugs pa'i las mngon du gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan du skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Those who are born in the same family of gods or humans, and who are destined to be born in the same family, are not born in another destiny, because the action that projects birth as a god or human is actualized.

original: de'i phyir mi bzlog ces bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi bzlog ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, they are not turned back.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa smod pa ni gzugs na spyod ba'i srid ba bar ma bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa smod pa ni gzugs na spyod ba'i srid ba bar ma bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The text mentions only the humans of the desire realm in order to exclude the intermediate existence of the form realm.

original: de ni kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: They are free from attachment to the pleasure of physical nutriment.

original: de'i zas ni rnam par shes pa dang yid la sems pa dang / reg pa zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo //🔽de nyid kyi phyir dri za zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i zas ni rnam par shes pa dang yid la sems pa dang / reg pa zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo // de nyid kyi phyir dri za zhes bya'o //
translated: Their nutriment is the three types of nutriment: contact, mental volition, and consciousness.🔽They are called gandharva, “smell-eaters,”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dri za yin pa de'i phyir dri za'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dri za yin pa de'i phyir dri za'o //
translated: because they eat smells.

original: 'gro ba ma yin yang 'di dri za zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin yang 'di dri za zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is not a going, it is called gandharva.

original: gal te 'di 'gro ba'i don yin yang za ba'i don du 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'gro ba'i don yin yang za ba'i don du 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
translated: Even though it means going, it also means eating.

original: sgra'i byings rnams don du ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgra'i byings rnams don du ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: Because the verbal roots have many meanings.

original: 'gro ba'i don can yang za ba'i don can du 'gyur bas skyon med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don can yang za ba'i don can du 'gyur bas skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault, because even though it means going, it also means eating.

original: de lta na gandha dri dang aarba za ba yin pas gandh'arba zhes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gandha dri dang aarba za ba yin pas gandh'arba zhes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, gandharva would mean the smell of eating, because gandha means smell and arva means eating.

original: de'i phyir thung du nyid ni karkandhu dang sha kandhu bzhin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thung du nyid ni karkandhu dang sha kandhu bzhin no zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said that the short vowel is like karkarandu and sakkarandu.

original: dper na shak'andhu zhes thob pa la sha kandhu zhes par gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shak'andhu zhes thob pa la sha kandhu zhes par gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the word sakkarandu, which is pronounced as sakkarandu.

original: dbang chung bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang chung bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste /
translated: It is said to be known as having little power, which is incorrect.

original: dman pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dman pa'i rigs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means having a low caste.

original: dbang chung ba ni dbang thang chung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang chung ba ni dbang thang chung ba'o //
translated: Little power means having little strength.

original: dbang chung par grags pa gang la yod pa de ni dbang chung bar grags pa yin no //🔽dbang che ba ni dbang thang che ba ste /
analyzed: dbang chung par grags pa gang la yod pa de ni dbang chung bar grags pa yin no // dbang che ba ni dbang thang che ba ste /
translated: Those who are known to have little power have little fame.🔽Those who have great power have great fame.

original: dbang che ba zhes bya bar grags pa gang la yod pa de ni dbang che bar grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang che ba zhes bya bar grags pa gang la yod pa de ni dbang che bar grags pa yin no //
translated: Those who are known to have great power have great fame.🔽The Bhadanta says that there is no certainty.

original: btsun pa na re nges pa med de zhes bya ba la btsun pa ni dpes ston pa'i sde pa chos skyob po //
analyzed: btsun pa na re nges pa med de zhes bya ba la btsun pa ni dpes ston pa'i sde pa chos skyob po //
translated: The Bhadanta is Dharmatrāta, an Ābhidhārmika of the Prajñaptivāda school.

original: ji skad du skye ba'i tshogs pa ma rnyed pa de srid kyi par du gnas so zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa ni de'i tshe'i 'phen pa logs shig na med de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du skye ba'i tshogs pa ma rnyed pa de srid kyi par du gnas so zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa ni de'i tshe'i 'phen pa logs shig na med de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says that the reason why it is said that “one remains as long as one has not obtained the conditions for birth” is that at that time there is no separate projection of life.

original: yang de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is that known?

original: de'i phyir ris mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos @352a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ris mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos @352a * //
translated: Therefore he says, “because they belong to the same type.”

original: so ; / dus snga ma'i srid pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa bar ma gang yin pa de dag thob pa byed pa'i ris mthun pa de ni gcig pa nyid do //🔽tshe'i las gang gis dus snga ma'i srid pa'i tshe 'phen pa de nyid kyis srid pa bar ma'i yang yin te /
analyzed: so ; / dus snga ma'i srid pa gang yin pa dang / srid pa bar ma gang yin pa de dag thob pa byed pa'i ris mthun pa de ni gcig pa nyid do // tshe'i las gang gis dus snga ma'i srid pa'i tshe 'phen pa de nyid kyis srid pa bar ma'i yang yin te /
translated: The life-stream of the prior-to-death existence and the life-stream of the intermediate existence are the same life-stream.🔽The action that projects the prior-to-death existence also projects the intermediate existence,

original: srid pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intermediate existence is sought by the prior-to-death existence.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te ris mthun pa tha dad pa'am tshe'i las kyis tshe logs shig tu 'phen par 'gyur na ni de lta yin dang srid pa bar ma do'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ris mthun pa tha dad pa'am tshe'i las kyis tshe logs shig tu 'phen par 'gyur na ni de lta yin dang srid pa bar ma do'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par yang 'gyur te /
translated: if the life-stream were different or if the intermediate existence were projected by a different action, then the intermediate existence would end in death, just as the prior-to-death existence does, because the life-span of the intermediate existence would be exhausted.

original: dper na dus snga ma'i srid pa'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par 'gyur ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na dus snga ma'i srid pa'i tshe zad pas 'chi ba'i srid par 'gyur ba bzhin no ;
translated: For example, the prior-to-death existence ends in death because the life-span of the prior-to-death existence is exhausted.

original: / de'i phyir nges pa med do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no certainty.🔽If the flesh of the body were as large as Mount Meru,

original: gal te sha'i phung po ri rab tsam du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nyid 'dri bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sha'i phung po ri rab tsam du zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nyid 'dri bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: this is a question posed by the Master himself.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di la rgyu med pa dang rgyu dang bcas par smra ba'i tshig gis glags yod pa de'i phyir des smras so zhe'o //🔽de dag dri de tshor zhing de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i ro myong ba dran nas de dag la chags pa skyed par byed pa de'i phyir dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di la rgyu med pa dang rgyu dang bcas par smra ba'i tshig gis glags yod pa de'i phyir des smras so zhe'o // de dag dri de tshor zhing de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i ro myong ba dran nas de dag la chags pa skyed par byed pa de'i phyir dri dang ro la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Others say: He spoke in this way because he was vulnerable to the words of those who say that this has no cause or that it has a cause.🔽Having smelled that smell and remembered the taste that accompanies it, they generate attachment to it. Therefore, it says, “They are attached to smell and taste.”

original: sad par byas nas srid pa des zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro'i sred pas rnam par smin pa la mngon par phyogs par byas te srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis srin bu'i nang dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sad par byas nas srid pa des zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro'i sred pas rnam par smin pa la mngon par phyogs par byas te srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis srin bu'i nang dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been awakened by that, they are born in the midst of worms through the continuum of the intermediate existence, by that existence.

original: de'i rkyen mang po zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i ngo bo'i rkyen mang ba'i tshe ste /
analyzed: de'i rkyen mang po zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i ngo bo'i rkyen mang ba'i tshe ste /
translated: When the conditions for that are many,

original: de 'chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'chags par 'gyur te /
translated: it is formed.

original: srin bu'i srid pa 'chags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srin bu'i srid pa 'chags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The existence of the worm is formed.

original: 'jug pa rnyed ces bya ba ni rnam par smin pa 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed ces bya ba ni rnam par smin pa 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It is said to be found” means that it is directed toward producing the result.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba ni de nyid la yul dang dus su rkyen nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba ni de nyid la yul dang dus su rkyen nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “The ripening of karma for sentient beings is inconceivable” means that the conditions for that ripening are definite or indefinite in terms of place and time.🔽The intermediate existence is seeking rebirth because it is the purpose of birth.

original: srid pa bar ma ni srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni skye ba'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir srid pa don du gnyer bar byed do //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni skye ba'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir srid pa don du gnyer bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / tshogs shing dus la bab pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshogs shing dus la bab pa na /
translated: When the collection and time are right,

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the result will ripen.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba de mang po ma yin pa'i dus so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba de mang po ma yin pa'i dus so //
translated: It is not otherwise means that it is not at a time when there are not many.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshe thung ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshe thung ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not otherwise means that it is not at a time when there is not a short life span.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba 'byung ba ni /
translated: The arising of a cakravartin is

original: stong phrag @352b brgyad cu las mi 'phyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong phrag @352b brgyad cu las mi 'phyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that they will not be delayed more than eighty thousand years.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na gang gi phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i las dag yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na gang gi phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i las dag yod du zin kyang /
translated: And for that reason, even though the karma that would produce a universal monarch, etc. exists,

original: res 'ga' zhig kho na rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba la 'jug pa rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig kho na rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par bya ba la 'jug pa rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is only sometimes that the opportunity to actualize its fruition is found.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma dor ro //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma dor ro //
translated: In that very state means in the intermediate state of existence.

original: srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la de ni skye ba'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir srid pa don du gnyer bar byed do //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la de ni skye ba'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir srid pa don du gnyer bar byed do //
translated: Because it seeks existence means that it seeks existence because it has the purpose of birth.

original: yang las las skye ba dang las kyi 'bras bu de rkyen tshogs pa las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang las las skye ba dang las kyi 'bras bu de rkyen tshogs pa las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How does birth from karma and the result of karma arise from the assembly of conditions?

original: tadh'arya katv'adzdza nma na:srid pa bar ma la ni de ltar brgal bar bya ba ma yin te 'di ni las kyi nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tadh'arya katv'adzdza nma na:srid pa bar ma la ni de ltar brgal bar bya ba ma yin te 'di ni las kyi nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: In the intermediate state of existence, this is not to be disputed, because the power of karma is inconceivable.

original: 'on te ma nges na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If it is not determined, then...

original: gang zhig dus dang skye ba nges pas yul ma nges par 'phen pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i lus dang skye ba der skye'o /
analyzed: gang zhig dus dang skye ba nges pas yul ma nges par 'phen pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i lus dang skye ba der skye'o /
translated: If the time and place of birth are determined, but the place of rebirth is not determined, then one is born in another body in that very place.

original: (/ de'i skye ba 'phags pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir ro//) gzhan dag na re 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: (/ de'i skye ba 'phags pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir ro//) gzhan dag na re 'dra bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: One is born in a similar place.

original: skye ba de dang yul der skye ba ma nges na ni de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i skye bar skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skye ba de dang yul der skye ba ma nges na ni de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i skye bar skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If the time and place of birth are not determined, then one is born in a similar place.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di'i rigs nyid nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di'i rigs nyid nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa la /
translated: Why is the type of rebirth determined or not determined?

original: dus su yang rigs nges pa dang ma nges pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: dus su yang rigs nges pa dang ma nges pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: It is not because the type of rebirth is determined or not determined in time,

original: dus su yang gnyi ga rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus su yang gnyi ga rig par bya'o //
translated: because both are known in time.

original: ji ltar ba lang dag ni dbyar rnams su 'khrig pa mngal zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa dang ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang dag ni dbyar rnams su 'khrig pa mngal zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa dang ma nges pa ste /
translated: Like cattle, which copulate in the summer, and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dus gzhan la ba lang rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ba men rnams kyi nang du skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //🔽las kyi 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la las gang gis ba lang la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa 'phen pa'i las de nyid kyis de'i srid pa bar ma 'phen pas ji ltar ris mthun pa gzhan gyi srid pa bar mas ris mthun pa gzhan skyed
analyzed: dus gzhan la ba lang rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ba men rnams kyi nang du skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo // las kyi 'phen pa gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la las gang gis ba lang la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa 'phen pa'i las de nyid kyis de'i srid pa bar ma 'phen pas ji ltar ris mthun pa gzhan gyi srid pa bar mas ris mthun pa gzhan skyed
translated: and those who would be born among cattle in another time are born among camels.

original: par nus te /
analyzed: par nus te /
translated: Because they are projected by the same action. The action that projects the life in the womb of cattle also projects the intermediate existence of cattle. How could the intermediate existence of one species give rise to a being of another species?

original: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not to be discussed.

original: gzhan dag na re ris mthun pa gzhan du skyes pa yang de'i ris mthun par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ris mthun pa gzhan du skyes pa yang de'i ris mthun par gtogs pa'o //
translated: Others say: The intermediate existence of another species is included in the same species.

original: 'o na srid pa bar ma dang tha mi dad pa'i ris mthun pa nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na srid pa bar ma dang tha mi dad pa'i ris mthun pa nyid ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the same species that is not different from the intermediate existence?

original: kalm'a sha p'a da la sogs pa bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: kalm'a sha p'a da la sogs pa bzhin zhes so //
translated: It is like the kalamucaka and so on.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba med de /
translated: This is not to be discussed.

original: 'dir ni ris @353a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni ris @353a * //
translated: Here, the same species is the same in terms of the body.

original: mthun pa gang du skye ba de'i rigs mthun par gtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa gang du skye ba de'i rigs mthun par gtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
translated: The other schools think that the intermediate beings of the same class are the homogeneous cause of the intermediate beings.

original: 'di de 'dra ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ci las yin /
analyzed: 'di de 'dra ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ci las yin /
translated: But why do you say that the intermediate beings are like the beings of the realm of desire?

original: rnam pa gzhan du na khyad par las byung ba'i don can de dgag pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //🔽srid pa bar ma ris gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na khyad par las byung ba'i don can de dgag pa'i phyir de skad bshad do // srid pa bar ma ris gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: In order to refute the idea that the intermediate beings are the homogeneous cause of the beings of another class.🔽The intermediate beings of the realm of desire are not the homogeneous cause of the intermediate beings of the realm of fine-materiality, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la ni ma yin no //
translated: The intermediate beings are not the homogeneous cause of the beings of the realm of desire, etc.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: de'i las rigs gcig pa'i phyir ris tha dad pa 'phen pa gcig pa nyid gtod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i las rigs gcig pa'i phyir ris tha dad pa 'phen pa gcig pa nyid gtod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The intermediate beings are not the homogeneous cause of the beings of another class, because their action is of the same type.

original: de lta na yang srid pa bar ma'i las gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de nyid lhag ma'i skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang srid pa bar ma'i las gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de nyid lhag ma'i skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the intermediate beings are of the same class as the beings of the realm of desire, then the action which should produce an intermediate being of the realm of desire will produce the rest of the existence of a being of the realm of desire.

original: ci ltar las kyi 'phen pa gcig nyid 'dor bar byed /🔽ci ste de nyid de yi 'bras bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar las kyi 'phen pa gcig nyid 'dor bar byed /🔽ci ste de nyid de yi 'bras bu'o zhe na /
translated: How can you avoid the fact that the projection of action would be abandoned?🔽If you say that the rest of the existence is the effect of the action which projects the intermediate existence,

original: de lta na yang skye ba gcig 'phen pa las gcig yin pas 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta na yang skye ba gcig 'phen pa las gcig yin pas 'gal te /
translated: But if that is so, then it would contradict the assertion that one impels one birth,

original: las gcig gis rigs mthun pa du ma 'phen pa nyid du khas blang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gcig gis rigs mthun pa du ma 'phen pa nyid du khas blang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that one action impels many of the same type.

original: gzhan dag na re ris gzhan gyis srid pa bar mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bzlogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar ston to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ris gzhan gyis srid pa bar mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bzlogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal bar ston to zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: This contradicts the statement, “It is not averted by an intermediate existence of a different type.”

original: gzhan dag ni 'gro ba gcig la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'gro ba gcig la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: There is no error, because it is stated intending one type of reincarnating being.

original: 'gro ba gcig tu ris mthun pa'i phyir gzhan nyid 'phen pa de la rigs gcig tu dgongs so zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig tu ris mthun pa'i phyir gzhan nyid 'phen pa de la rigs gcig tu dgongs so zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is stated intending one type of reincarnating being, because it is the same type within one reincarnating being.

original: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas /🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gis te 'di ltar mal 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu spyod pa'i phyir blo phyin ci log pa yin la /
analyzed: blo ni phyin ci log gyur pas / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag gis te 'di ltar mal 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun tu spyod pa'i phyir blo phyin ci log pa yin la /
translated: Because the mind is distorted🔽by attachment and aversion,🔽one engages in sexual union with one’s mother and one engages in sexual union with one’s father.🔽One engages in sexual union with one’s mother because the mind is distorted by attachment to sexual intercourse.

original: pha la zhe sdang kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: pha la zhe sdang kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: One engages in sexual union with one’s father because one engages in sexual union with aversion to one’s father.

original: / yang na ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Or else, the order is reversed.

original: pha ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “father and mother,”

original: pha dang ma ni pha ma ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma ni pha ma ste /
translated: the father and mother are the parents.

original: pha ma de gnyis so //
analyzed: pha ma de gnyis so //
translated: These two are the parents.

original: nyal po byed pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos lhag par spyod pa'o //🔽pho'i 'dod chags ni pho'i 'o //
analyzed: nyal po byed pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos lhag par spyod pa'o // pho'i 'dod chags ni pho'i 'o //
translated: To have sexual intercourse means to engage in the act of sexual union.🔽Male desire is the desire of a male.

original: mo'i yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mo'i yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Female desire is the desire of a female.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽bu ni lhag par ma'i phyogs 'dzin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / bu ni lhag par ma'i phyogs 'dzin la /
translated: For this reason,🔽a son is more like his mother,

original: bu mo ni pha'i 'o //
analyzed: bu mo ni pha'i 'o //
translated: and a daughter is more like her father.

original: gnas skabs der zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs der zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “at that time,”

original: pho'i nyal po la ni pha'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: pho'i nyal po la ni pha'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: at the time of the male sexual act, the son is in the father’s condition.

original: mo'i nyal po la ni ma'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: mo'i nyal po la ni ma'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: At the time of the female sexual act, the daughter is in the mother’s condition.

original: mi gtsang ba der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “in that impure substance,”

original: mi gtsang ba ni khu khrag go / mngal gyi gnas ni pho ba dang @353b long ka dang gnyis kyi bar ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni khu khrag go / mngal gyi gnas ni pho ba dang @353b long ka dang gnyis kyi bar ro //
translated: the impure substance is semen and blood. The womb is the space between the stomach and the intestines.

original: khu chu dang khrag 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam ste dga' ba skyes nas ma'i mngal du zhugs te khu chu dang khrag thigs pa gcig gnyis kyis nur nur por gnas te /
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam ste dga' ba skyes nas ma'i mngal du zhugs te khu chu dang khrag thigs pa gcig gnyis kyis nur nur por gnas te /
translated: The embryo is situated in the womb, and the semen and blood remain as a single cell, then as two cells, and so on.

original: 'dab chags su gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dab chags su gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “situated in the womb” is “situated in the womb.”

original: de nas 'dab chags su gnas pa de'i phung po 'khrang par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rags par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dab chags su gnas pa de'i phung po 'khrang par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rags par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Then, the embryo’s mass becomes solid, that is, it becomes gross,

original: nur nur po'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nur nur po'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the embryo’s body is soft.

original: srid pa bar ma pa'i shin tu dang ba dag ni 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma pa'i shin tu dang ba dag ni 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: The extremely clear form of the intermediate being ceases.

original: 'dir skye ba dang 'gag pa na sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir skye ba dang 'gag pa na sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should see that the arising and cessation of the embryo is like the arising and cessation of a seed and a sprout.

original: rgyab rol tu bltas te tsog tsog por zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la pha'i spyod lam lhag par mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyab rol tu bltas te tsog tsog por zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la pha'i spyod lam lhag par mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Facing backward, it sits with its knees drawn up to its chest, because it is intent on the father’s behavior.

original: de bzhin du lto rol du kha blta'o zhes bya ba yang bdag nyid la ma'i gnas skabs su lhag par mos pa'i phyir te de lta skye ste g-yon phyogs kyi ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir lto'i g-yon phyogs su bsnyes te gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lto rol du kha blta'o zhes bya ba yang bdag nyid la ma'i gnas skabs su lhag par mos pa'i phyir te de lta skye ste g-yon phyogs kyi ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir lto'i g-yon phyogs su bsnyes te gnas so //
translated: Likewise, it is said that the embryo faces the back because it is conceived as the mother's front.

original: phyis lus skye zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa dang 'phel zhing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis lus skye zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa dang 'phel zhing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that later, the body grows and develops, meaning that it increases and expands.

original: de dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba dag kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba dag kho na'o //
translated: The elements of semen and blood are the very same elements that were previously called semen and blood.

original: ji ltar zhe na khu chu dang khrag dbang po med pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na khu chu dang khrag dbang po med pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: How so? It is said that semen and blood without faculties🔽are the elements of semen and blood.

original: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang skye ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu 'gag pa dang skye ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a seed and a sprout, it is said that the seed ceases and the sprout arises.

original: skad cig ma gcig kho na las sa bon 'gag cing myu gu skye'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig kho na las sa bon 'gag cing myu gu skye'o //
translated: In just one moment, the seed ceases and the sprout arises.

original: nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa na zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag gi mjug thogs su dang por nur nur po yin no nur nur po las mer mer gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽dur khrod bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nur nur po zhes bya ba gang yin pa na zhes bya ba ni khu chu dang khrag gi mjug thogs su dang por nur nur po yin no nur nur po las mer mer gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro // dur khrod bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The embryo in the second stage is called arbuda, which is like a boil.🔽The embryo in the third stage is called peśin, which is like a lump of flesh.

original: dur khrod ni dur khrod de /
analyzed: dur khrod ni dur khrod de /
translated: The embryo in the fourth stage is called ghana, which is like a thick lump.🔽The embryo in the fifth stage is called praśākhā, which is like a branch.🔽The embryo in the sixth stage is called jāra, which is like a young animal.🔽The embryo in the seventh stage is called yauvan, which is like an adult.🔽The embryo in the eighth stage is called vṛddha, which is like an old person.

original: yang dang yang du shi bas 'phel bar byas pa'o //🔽srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyi rgyun las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i gzugs skye ba de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du shi bas 'phel bar byas pa'o // srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyi rgyun las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i gzugs skye ba de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: The embryo in the ninth stage is called mṛta, which is like a dead person.🔽The embryo in the tenth stage is called śmaśāna, which is like a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the eleventh stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the twelfth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the thirteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the fourteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.

original: sa bon dang myu gu'i tshul du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu'i tshul du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The embryo in the fifteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the sixteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the seventeenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the eighteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa sems can du ston pa'i sa bon du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa sems can du ston pa'i sa bon du 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The embryo in the nineteenth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.

original: rgyud kyi dbye ba las cig car yang sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i gzugs 'gag go //
analyzed: rgyud kyi dbye ba las cig car yang sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i gzugs 'gag go //
translated: The embryo in the twentieth stage is called śmaśānakāṣṭha, which is like a piece of wood in a cemetery.🔽The embryo in the twenty-first stage is called śmaśānakāṣ

original: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa las skyes pa yang ris @354a * //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa las skyes pa yang ris @354a * //
translated: and from that which is not sentient.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sems can du ston pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sems can du ston pa las ma yin no //
translated: But they are not different in kind from that which is sentient.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'byung ba gzhan dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are other primary elements.

original: srid pa bar ma'i 'byung ba nur nur po'i 'byung ba dang 'brel pa dag ni nur nur po dang lhan cig 'gags la /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i 'byung ba nur nur po'i 'byung ba dang 'brel pa dag ni nur nur po dang lhan cig 'gags la /
translated: The primary elements of the intermediate existence that are connected to the primary elements of the kalala are stopped together with the kalala.

original: de dag kyang 'gag pa na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan nur nur po la brten nas sngar gyi 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'byung ba gzhan dbang po dang bcas pa dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'gag pa na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan nur nur po la brten nas sngar gyi 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i 'byung ba gzhan dbang po dang bcas pa dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are stopped, other primary elements that are not similar to the former primary elements and that possess faculties arise as the cause of the former primary elements in dependence on the kalala as a cooperative condition.

original: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na lo ma'i srin bu lta bu yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the insect on a leaf.

original: lo ma'i 'byung ba dag la brten nas las rnams las byung ba dag skye ba de dag dbang po'i rten gyi ngo bor 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: lo ma'i 'byung ba dag la brten nas las rnams las byung ba dag skye ba de dag dbang po'i rten gyi ngo bor 'gyur gyi //
translated: In dependence on the primary elements of the leaf, the insect arises from karma. It becomes the basis of the sense faculties.

original: lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni srin bu'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: lo ma'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni srin bu'i rten ma yin no //
translated: The great elements of the leaf are not the basis of the worm.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: lo ma dum bu re re nas ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo ma dum bu re re nas ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the leaf is not observed as a collection of parts.🔽If that is so, then it contradicts the sutra that states:

original: de lta na 'o na pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las byung ba zhes bya ba'i mdo dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: The embryo arises from the parents’ impure substances.

original: de'i lan du mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du mi gtsang ba la brten nas skye ba la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: To respond to that, he says, “Because it is stated with the intention that it arises in dependence on impure substances,” and so on.🔽The great elements of the sense faculties arise in dependence on semen and blood.

original: khu chu dang khrag la brten nas de dag gi dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs shing bsams nas pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag la brten nas de dag gi dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs shing bsams nas pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po las 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: With this in mind, the Buddha stated, “The embryo arises from the parents’ impure substances,” and there is no contradiction with the sutra.

original: dper na lo ma la brten nas skyes pa'i srin bu ni mi'i srin bu yin pa de bzhin du pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba la brten nas skyes pa'i nur nur po yang pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po yin no //
analyzed: dper na lo ma la brten nas skyes pa'i srin bu ni mi'i srin bu yin pa de bzhin du pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba la brten nas skyes pa'i nur nur po yang pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba nur nur po yin no //
translated: Just as a worm is born in dependence on a leaf, so too the kalala is born in dependence on the impurity of the father and mother.

original: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams su sgo nga la skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams su sgo nga la skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas su 'jug pa ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is how entry into the womb occurs for those who are born from a womb or an egg in the realm of desire.🔽As for the others,

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni drod gsher las skye ba dang rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas dag la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni drod gsher las skye ba dang rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas dag la'o //
