translated: that is, those who are born from moisture and those who are miraculously born,

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni dri dang gnas la mngon 'dod gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni dri dang gnas la mngon 'dod gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the desire is for smell and place, as the case may be.

original: 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i yul du 'gro'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They go to the place of their destiny.

original: ji ltar na dmyal ba dag tu gnas 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dag 'jigs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na dmyal ba dag tu gnas 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dag 'jigs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: How can one desire to dwell in hell?

original: gnas skabs gang gis zhes bya ba ni shan pa la sogs pa'am lings pa la sogs pa dag gi tshe ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang gis zhes bya ba ni shan pa la sogs pa'am lings pa la sogs pa dag gi tshe ste /
translated: By what state? By the state of a butcher, etc., or a thief, etc.

original: ji skad du /🔽ji ltar @354b 'gyur bas de myong las /
analyzed: ji skad du / ji ltar @354b 'gyur bas de myong las /
translated: As it is said:🔽Due to the transformation of karma

original: sngar byas pa ni rmi lam ltar //
analyzed: sngar byas pa ni rmi lam ltar //
translated: that is experienced, one previously created

original: sems can de 'dra mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: sems can de 'dra mthong gyur nas //
translated: sees such a sentient being🔽and rushes to the hell.

original: dmyal bar rab tu rgyug par 'gyur zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: dmyal bar rab tu rgyug par 'gyur zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sngon gyi slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the Yogacaras and former masters.

original: yang srid pa bar ma gang zhig skye ba'i yul du ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa bar ma gang zhig skye ba'i yul du ji ltar 'gro zhe na /
translated: How does the intermediate existence of one who is to be born in a certain place go there?

original: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la lha'i srid pa bar ma ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The intermediate existence of a god goes to its place of birth, etc.

original: stan las ldang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnas gong mar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan las ldang ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnas gong mar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like rising from a seat means that it goes to a higher place.

original: mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The intermediate existence of humans, animals, and ghosts

original: mi'i srid pa bar ma ni mi bzhin no //
analyzed: mi'i srid pa bar ma ni mi bzhin no //
translated: The intermediate existence of a human is like a human.

original: dud 'gro'i srid pa bar ma ni dud 'gro bzhin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i srid pa bar ma ni dud 'gro bzhin no //
translated: The intermediate existence of an animal is like an animal.

original: yi dags kyi srid pa bar ma ni yi dags bzhin te /
analyzed: yi dags kyi srid pa bar ma ni yi dags bzhin te /
translated: The intermediate existence of a hungry ghost is like a hungry ghost.

original: rgyab kyi 'gro bas yi dags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyab kyi 'gro bas yi dags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called hungry ghost because it goes with its back bent.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams su srid pa bar ma med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams su srid pa bar ma med ce na /
translated: Why is there no intermediate existence in the formless realm?

original: las de'i 'phen pa de'i nus pa las de'i nus pa mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de'i 'phen pa de'i nus pa las de'i nus pa mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the projecting karma of that realm is abandoned through the power of the karma that projects the intermediate existence.

original: nyon mongs pas rgyas par byas pa'i las rnams 'bras bu 'phen nus pa las /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas rgyas par byas pa'i las rnams 'bras bu 'phen nus pa las /
translated: Karma that is nourished by affliction is capable of projecting a result.

original: nyon mongs pa med par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable to be nourished by affliction in the formless realm.

original: las yod kyang skye ba 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las yod kyang skye ba 'phen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though karma exists, it does not project birth.🔽The karma of the coarse and subtle levels is not capable of projecting a result that is the nature of that level, because it is not directly perceived by the body and because it is not a volition that is free from both aspects.

original: rags pa dang phra ba'i sa la de'i ngo bo'i las dang 'bras bu ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i sems pa can ma yin la 'jig rten pa'i bskal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems can yang ma yin no
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba'i sa la de'i ngo bo'i las dang 'bras bu ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i sems pa can ma yin la 'jig rten pa'i bskal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems can yang ma yin no
translated: The intermediate existence of a being of the formless realm is not a being of a different eon.

original: // srid pa bar ma'i dbang po 'chol ba med de /
analyzed: // srid pa bar ma'i dbang po 'chol ba med de /
translated: The intermediate existence of a formless realm being does not have a mixed set of faculties.

original: mthong ba'i rgyu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi spang bya phra rgyas rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyu 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi spang bya phra rgyas rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The cause of seeing is the abandonment of the objects of abandonment, the proclivities, of the desire realm.

original: ci srid pa bar ma thams cad blo phyin ci log tu gyur pas ma'i mngal du 'jug gam zhe na smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci srid pa bar ma thams cad blo phyin ci log tu gyur pas ma'i mngal du 'jug gam zhe na smras pa ma yin te /
translated: Do all intermediate beings enter the womb with a distorted mind?

original: 'on kyang mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngal du 'jug pa ni bzhi zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: No, but there are four ways of entering the womb.

original: mngal du 'jug pa 'di bzhi zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan med do snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽sems nyon mongs pa can yin yang 'du shes dang mos pa dag phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir shes bzhin du 'jug go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa 'di bzhi zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan med do snyam du bsams pa'o // sems nyon mongs pa can yin yang 'du shes dang mos pa dag phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir shes bzhin du 'jug go zhes brjod do //
translated: These four ways of entering the womb are not different in terms of abiding in the womb and emerging from the womb.

original: bzlog ste bstan to zhes bya ba @355a * //
analyzed: bzlog ste bstan to zhes bya ba @355a * //
translated: Even though the mind is afflicted, it is said that they enter with full awareness because their discernment and aspiration are undistorted.🔽The opposite of that is the second.

original: la mdo las ni thams cad shes bzhin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di thog mar bstan la gsum ni ji skad bstan pa kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: la mdo las ni thams cad shes bzhin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di thog mar bstan la gsum ni ji skad bstan pa kho na bzhin no //
translated: The Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra teaches that the first is the state of being always mindful, and the other three are as they are explained.

original: rmongs pa dang ma rmongs pa'i bye brag 'di ni mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang ma rmongs pa'i bye brag 'di ni mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la yin te /
translated: This distinction between the confused and the unconfused is in terms of birth from the womb.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa ni rtag tu thams cad rmongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa ni rtag tu thams cad rmongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born from eggs are always confused.

original: gang zhig skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sgra'i tshul gyis dus gsum la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sgra'i tshul gyis dus gsum la bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “that which will be born” is established in terms of the three times according to the rules of grammar.

original: yang na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kyang ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ming gis kyang ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, the phrase “that which will be born” is also taught by the name of that which is born.

original: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su 'dus byas su 'gyur gyi bskyed bzhin pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dus byas mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su 'dus byas su 'gyur gyi bskyed bzhin pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin la /
translated: The phrase “the conditioned is conditioned” refers to the state of being produced, not to the state of being produced.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya sgo nga las skyes pa yin pa de dag gis kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rtogs so zhes bya bar grags te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyal po lnga len gyi bu lnga brgya sgo nga las skyes pa yin pa de dag gis kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rtogs so zhes bya bar grags te /
translated: Others say: The five hundred sons of King Pañcaśarikha were born from eggs and they realized pratyekabuddha enlightenment.🔽Therefore it is uncertain that those born from eggs are always confused.

original: de'i phyir sgo nga las skyes pa ni rtag tu thams cad rmongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ma nges so zhe na rang sangs rgyas pa se ru lta bu la dgongs nas gsungs pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgo nga las skyes pa ni rtag tu thams cad rmongs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ma nges so zhe na rang sangs rgyas pa se ru lta bu la dgongs nas gsungs pas nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no error because this was stated intending pratyekabuddhas who are like partridges.🔽Why are entering and abiding not knowledge through mental scrutiny but emerging is?

original: yang ci'i phyir shes bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa shes bzhin du gnas pa dang 'byung ba dag tu mi 'gyur zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir shes bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa shes bzhin du gnas pa dang 'byung ba dag tu mi 'gyur zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not because it is impossible.

original: lus dang dbang po stobs dang ldan pa dang / tshang ba dang / ma nyams pa dang / gsal ba gang gis shes bzhin ma bzhag pa lus dang dbang po stobs dang mi ldan pa dang / nyams pa dang ma tshang ba dang / zhan pa de shes bzhin du gnas pa'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po stobs dang ldan pa dang / tshang ba dang / ma nyams pa dang / gsal ba gang gis shes bzhin ma bzhag pa lus dang dbang po stobs dang mi ldan pa dang / nyams pa dang ma tshang ba dang / zhan pa de shes bzhin du gnas pa'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The body and faculties are strong, complete, and clear, and it is impossible for them to remain or arise in a way that is not fully known, with a body and faculties that are weak, impaired, or incomplete.

original: shes bzhin du 'jug pa yod de rgyu'i shugs kyis 'phen pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du 'jug pa yod de rgyu'i shugs kyis 'phen pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: There is full engagement with full awareness, because of the power of the momentum of the cause.

original: shes bzhin du gnas par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bzhin du gnas par yang 'gyur te /
translated: There is full awareness of remaining in a state of concentration,

original: gnyis ka rgyu'i dbang las so //
analyzed: gnyis ka rgyu'i dbang las so //
translated: because of the power of both.

original: 'byung bar yang zhes bya ste 'di ni srid do //
analyzed: 'byung bar yang zhes bya ste 'di ni srid do //
translated: There is full awareness of arising, because of the power of the cause.

original: log pa'i 'du shes dang mos pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: log pa'i 'du shes dang mos pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: There is full awareness of the arising of distorted perception and attention.

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of signs.

original: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: Attention is the directing of the mind.

original: yang ji ltar log pa dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar log pa dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they distorted?

original: 'di snyam du rlung langs pa'am char 'bab pa'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rlung langs pa'am char 'bab pa'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: and so on.🔽But didn’t we already explain that one goes to the destination of sexual union?

original: gal te rtse dags 'gro pa'i yul du 'gro'o zhes sngar bstan zin ba ma yin nam rlung langs @355b pa'am char 'bab pa'am zhes rgyas par yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: gal te rtse dags 'gro pa'i yul du 'gro'o zhes sngar bstan zin ba ma yin nam rlung langs @355b pa'am char 'bab pa'am zhes rgyas par yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why does the Abhidharmakośa say, “If the wind blows or it rains, and so on”?

original: nges pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is stated to indicate that there is no certainty.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis kho nas blo phyin ci log tu gyur pas skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis kho nas blo phyin ci log tu gyur pas skye ba'i yul du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: One does not go to the destination of birth due to the error of attachment and aversion alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rnam pa gzhan du rtsva thibs po'am nags thibs por 'jug pa'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rtsva thibs po'am nags thibs por 'jug pa'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also the case that one enters a thicket of grass or a dense forest and so on.

original: de ltar bshad na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na /
translated: If this is explained,

original: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa nyon mongs can //
translated: the afflicted state of birth existence

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs kun //
translated: is due to all the afflictions of one’s level.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang tshang mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang tshang mar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is complete.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: skyed mos tshal du 'jug go snyam pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal du 'jug go snyam pas kyang ngo //
translated: and the thought “I will enter the garden” is the proximate occasion.

original: skye ba'i yul du blo phyin ci log gis 'jug gi snyam pa ni nye ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i yul du blo phyin ci log gis 'jug gi snyam pa ni nye ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: The thought “I will enter the country of my birth” is the proximate occasion.

original: 'di ni ring ba'i gnas skabs yin te 'di dag gi khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ring ba'i gnas skabs yin te 'di dag gi khyad par ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the distant occasion. This is the difference between them.

original: 'di yang ma yin te nye ba'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'dod pa der yang mngal gyi gnas mi gtsang ba dang sprad pa la dga' bas mngon par 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang ma yin te nye ba'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'dod pa der yang mngal gyi gnas mi gtsang ba dang sprad pa la dga' bas mngon par 'jug go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because it is said that even in the proximate occasion, the embryo is delighted to be united with the impure womb.

original: ci ltar na skye ba'i dus kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi sems shes bzhin du rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na skye ba'i dus kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi sems shes bzhin du rung zhe na /
translated: How can there be a defiled thought at the time of birth, and how can there be mindfulness?

original: shes rab thams cad dge bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab thams cad dge bar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Not all wisdom is considered to be wholesome.

original: des na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang shes bzhin du 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang shes bzhin du 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying that a defiled thought is mindful.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rdzun du smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rdzun du smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not lie with a defiled thought.

original: yang na 'dir rgyun gyi dbang du byas kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dir rgyun gyi dbang du byas kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, it is in terms of the stream that the Blessed One teaches this, and not in terms of the moment when the embryo is formed.

original: de la yang 'di phyir zhing nyon mongs pa'i sems kun tu spyod pas nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba chung ba'i phyir grangs su nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'di phyir zhing nyon mongs pa'i sems kun tu spyod pas nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba chung ba'i phyir grangs su nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: And this is not counted as afflicted because it is weak, since the afflicted thought does not function in this stage.

original: rta dkar po dang nas kyi phung po bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rta dkar po dang nas kyi phung po bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: It is like the example of a white horse and a heap of barley.

original: 'di ni bdag gi pha'o 'di ni bdag gi ma'o snyam pa las gzhan du mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ram gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir shes bzhin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi pha'o 'di ni bdag gi ma'o snyam pa las gzhan du mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ram gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir shes bzhin zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called vigilance because it is not confused, or because it produces respect, with the idea: This is my father, this is my mother.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu shes pa'i phyir 'di nyid 'dir shes bzhin du mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu shes pa'i phyir 'di nyid 'dir shes bzhin du mngon par 'dod do //
translated: It is called vigilance in the strict sense of the word, because it is the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: yang 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: And here, the Blessed One teaches the four kinds of entry into the womb:🔽1. those who know when they are entering,

original: shes bzhin la sogs pa mngal du 'jug pa rnam pa bzhin ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin la sogs pa mngal du 'jug pa rnam pa bzhin ro //
translated: 2. those who know when they have entered,🔽3. those who do not know when they are entering,🔽4. those who do not know when they have entered.

original: 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i ming gis bstan to zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de dag 'khor los sgyur @356a * //🔽pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i ming gis bstan to zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de dag 'khor los sgyur @356a * // pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the future name is used to refer to them.🔽At that time, they are not cakravartins, etc.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa de dag de ltar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa de dag de ltar 'jug snyam na /
translated: Why do they enter the state of composure without conception?

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa'i sgo nas de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa'i sgo nas de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the cause of that, he says,

original: las sam ye shes sam gnyis ka zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: las sam ye shes sam gnyis ka zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: “due to karma, knowledge, or both.”

original: rgya che'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rlabs che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽thos pa mang ba dang / rab tu 'byed pa byas pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni thos pa mang ba yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: rgya che'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rlabs che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // thos pa mang ba dang / rab tu 'byed pa byas pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni thos pa mang ba yang de dag yin la /
translated: “Because of its vastness” means because of its greatness.

original: rab tu 'byed pa byas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa byas pa yang yin no //
translated: Those who have much learning and have analyzed are those who have much learning and have analyzed.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes pa rdzogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes pa rdzogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: those whose knowledge of learning, reflection, and meditation is complete.

original: gal te shes bzhin dang shes bzhin ma yin par mngal du 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te shes bzhin dang shes bzhin ma yin par mngal du 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t there only two kinds of entry into the womb: with full awareness and without full awareness?

original: ji ltar rnam pa bzhin brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa bzhin brjod de /
translated: How can there be four kinds?

original: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'jug pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'jug pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no error, because entry is primary.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' yang shes bzhin ma yin par zhugs nas shes bzhin du gnas pa'am 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' yang shes bzhin ma yin par zhugs nas shes bzhin du gnas pa'am 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: For there is no one who enters without full awareness and then abides or leaves with full awareness.

original: de'i phyir gang 'di mngal gyi gnas nas 'byung ba bdag nyid kyis rab tu shes pa de ni 'jug pa khyad par du yang shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'di mngal gyi gnas nas 'byung ba bdag nyid kyis rab tu shes pa de ni 'jug pa khyad par du yang shes te /
translated: Therefore, one who is fully aware of leaving the womb is also fully aware of entering.

original: 'jug pa'i sgras gnas pa dang 'byung ba yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgras gnas pa dang 'byung ba yang brjod do //
translated: The term “entry” also includes abiding and leaving.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang 'byung ba dag shes bzhin dang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i dbye bas drug nyid du yang tham bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas pa dang 'byung ba dag shes bzhin dang shes bzhin ma yin pa'i dbye bas drug nyid du yang tham bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, abiding and leaving are not separately classified as with full awareness and without full awareness, and so there are not six kinds of entry into the womb.

original: 'jug pa gtso bo yin pas rigs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnams la yang 'jug pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ci las zhes te /
analyzed: 'jug pa gtso bo yin pas rigs tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa rnams la yang 'jug pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ci las zhes te /
translated: Since entry is primary, it is certain that entry is the same for those of different and undifferentiated lineages.

original: re zhig mngal gyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: re zhig mngal gyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
translated: Thus far, the section on the womb is complete.

original: // / de bzhin du rigs tha dad pa rnams dang 'di gnyis rigs tha mi dad pa rnams te /
analyzed: // / de bzhin du rigs tha dad pa rnams dang 'di gnyis rigs tha mi dad pa rnams te /
translated: Similarly, those of different lineages and those of the two undifferentiated lineages

original: gnyis zhes bya ba bzhi nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba bzhi nyid du rung ngo //
translated: are suitable as the four: two, three, four, and five.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: byang chub sems dpa' kho na sems dpa' zhes so //🔽tha ma la rigs mthun pa la ni gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho na sems dpa' zhes so // tha ma la rigs mthun pa la ni gsum pa dang gnyis pa dang gnyis pa la'o //
translated: Only bodhisattvas are called heroes.🔽In the final lifetime, the first, second, and third are in those of similar lineage.

original: gang nas shi 'phos nas dga' ldan du skyes pa ni dang po dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos nas dga' ldan du skyes pa ni dang po dang gsum pa'o //
translated: The first and third are those who die and are reborn in Tushita.

original: gang nas shi 'phos nas 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos nas 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la skyes pa'o //
translated: Those who die and are reborn in the teachings of Kashyapa.

original: de las gang du tha ma zhes bya ba ni grangs med pa gsum las dang po dang gnyis pa dang @356b gsum pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de las gang du tha ma zhes bya ba ni grangs med pa gsum las dang po dang gnyis pa dang @356b gsum pa rnams la'o //
translated: In which do they die and in which do they take their final existence? The first, second, and third are in the first, second, and third incalculable eons.

original: de las gong du bzhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gong du bzhi ba yin no //
translated: The fourth is higher than that.

original: de ni 'dir phyi rol can rnams zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir phyi rol can rnams zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase “those who are externalists” occurs here.

original: bdag tu smra ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are those who hold the view of self.

original: de med pa'i phyir bdag ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bdag ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since that does not exist, the self does not exist.

original: gal te bdag med na 'di srid pa bar ma'i sgo nas 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du 'pho zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na 'di srid pa bar ma'i sgo nas 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol du 'pho zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: If the self does not exist, how can one say that it passes from this world to the next by way of the intermediate existence?

original: 'di ma'i mngal du 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba zhes kyang ci ste brjod /
analyzed: 'di ma'i mngal du 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang 'byung ba zhes kyang ci ste brjod /
translated: How can one say that it enters the mother’s womb, dwells there, and emerges from it?

original: de'i phyir 'dir gang zhig 'pho ba dang nye bar 'pho ba zhes bya bar khas blang bar bya ba byed pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gang zhig 'pho ba dang nye bar 'pho ba zhes bya bar khas blang bar bya ba byed pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, here, one should accept that there is some person who is the agent of passing and transmigration.

original: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir bdag med ces bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir bdag med ces bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to refute that, the root text states, “There is no self.”

original: gsung rab las kyang phung po tsam la bdag go zhes bsnyad pa yod la de dgag pa'i phyir dang po'i phyogs dang 'gal lo zhes 'dri ba ni bdag ji lta bu zhig ce na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsung rab las kyang phung po tsam la bdag go zhes bsnyad pa yod la de dgag pa'i phyir dang po'i phyogs dang 'gal lo zhes 'dri ba ni bdag ji lta bu zhig ce na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What kind of self is it?

original: ci phung po tsam gyi bdag nyid can zhig gam /
analyzed: ci phung po tsam gyi bdag nyid can zhig gam /
translated: Is it the self that is the mere aggregates?

original: 'on te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Or is it an inner active being?

original: de'i phyir gang phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one does not abandon these aggregates,” and so on.

original: yang rgyu la dgag pa byed pa ci zhe na de med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de gal te mi 'dor na gnas skabs su nye bar 'joms pas 'dor ba'i gnas skabs bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: yang rgyu la dgag pa byed pa ci zhe na de med pa'i phyir ro // de gal te mi 'dor na gnas skabs su nye bar 'joms pas 'dor ba'i gnas skabs bskyed par byed do //
translated: Why is the cause denied? Because it does not exist.🔽If it does not abandon the aggregates, it produces the state of abandoning them by destroying them in the present moment.

original: nying mtshams mi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su nye bar 'joms pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i gnas skabs mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nying mtshams mi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su nye bar 'joms pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i gnas skabs mi bskyed do //
translated: It does not produce the state of rebirth by destroying them in the state of not linking up.

original: des na gzhan nyid 'dor bar byed pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan nyid 'dor bar byed pas nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the absurd consequence follows that it is the one who links to the next existence because it abandons that very self.

original: gnas skabs su 'gog pa skyed pa dag gis gnas skabs su 'gog pa mi bskyed pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs su 'gog pa skyed pa dag gis gnas skabs su 'gog pa mi bskyed pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that those who generate a temporary cessation generate a temporary cessation because they are not different.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid las gzhan nyid snga phyi med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid las gzhan nyid snga phyi med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference between them in terms of the absence of difference and the absence of prior or subsequent difference.

original: 'di'i 'dor ba nyid nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa po nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i 'dor ba nyid nying mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa po nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that this very abandonment is the agent that links to the next existence.

original: phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dag go //
analyzed: phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dag go //
translated: The phrase “these aggregates are abandoned” refers to those of the present.

original: gzhan dag tu nyid mtshams sbyor zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma pa dag gam skye ba'i char gtogs pa dag so //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu nyid mtshams sbyor zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma pa dag gam skye ba'i char gtogs pa dag so //
translated: The phrase “it links to others” refers to those of the intermediate existence or those that belong to the phase of birth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya bas lung las kyang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med par bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya bas lung las kyang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the Bhagavān said” indicates that the scriptures also teach that an internal creator is nonexistent.

original: rigs pa las da med par ni dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
analyzed: rigs pa las da med par ni dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
translated: The reason “because it is not a creator” has already been explained in the line “because of order, etc.”

original: byed @357a * //
analyzed: byed @357a * //
translated: The creator is not perceived.

original: pa po mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar rang gi ngo bos sam /
analyzed: pa po mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa ltar rang gi ngo bos sam /
translated: This means that the creator is not perceived either by way of its own nature, like form, feeling, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa ltar bya ba'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltar bya ba'i sgo nas te /
translated: or by way of its activity, like the eyes, etc.

original: de'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar med do zhes bya bar nges so //🔽yang na byed pa po rtag pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar med do zhes bya bar nges so // yang na byed pa po rtag pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that it does not exist, like the horn of a donkey.

original: mi rtag pa zhig phung po las tha dad pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhig phung po las tha dad pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Moreover, a permanent or impermanent creator that is different from the aggregates is not perceived.🔽Thus, a permanent creator is not tenable because it is empty of any difference before and after.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa snga phyir rnam par 'gyur bas stong pa ni las rnams kyi byed pa po dang 'bras bu rnams kyi za ba por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa snga phyir rnam par 'gyur bas stong pa ni las rnams kyi byed pa po dang 'bras bu rnams kyi za ba por mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that a permanent creator is the agent of actions and the experiencer of the effects of actions.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, a permanent creator is not tenable.

original: 'ga' yang gzugs can ma yin pa dang lus can ma yin pa dang / bde ba can ma yin pa dang sdug bsngal can ma yin pa dang 'du shes can ma yin pa dang sems pa med pa dang rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang gzugs can ma yin pa dang lus can ma yin pa dang / bde ba can ma yin pa dang sdug bsngal can ma yin pa dang 'du shes can ma yin pa dang sems pa med pa dang rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med par yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would follow that nothing is material, embodied, happy, or unhappy, or has any sensation, volition, or consciousness,

original: de dag dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be related to them and would not change.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs dag khyad par med pa'i phyir dang de'i rgyu'i 'jug pa don med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs dag khyad par med pa'i phyir dang de'i rgyu'i 'jug pa don med pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, there would be no agent, because there would be no difference between the states of cyclic existence and nirvana, and because the activity of its cause would be pointless.

original: mi rtag pa yang med de byas pa chung zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes pa las so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang med de byas pa chung zos pa dang ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes pa las so //
translated: Nor would there be impermanence, because of the faults of the destruction of what has been done and the encounter with what has not been done.

original: gal te yang phyi rol pa rnams phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag tu rtog par byed pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang phyi rol pa rnams phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag tu rtog par byed pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if the non-Buddhists imagine a self that is different from the aggregates,

original: de sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po tsam kho na'i yul la de ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po tsam kho na'i yul la de ltar gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha spoke in this way with reference to the object of the aggregates of the Buddhas.

original: 'di na dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag dang bdag gi zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ste zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di na dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag dang bdag gi zhes yang dag par rjes su lta zhing yang dag par rjes su mthong ste zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, some śramaṇas and brahmans view and see the five appropriated aggregates as the self and what belongs to the self.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin nam 'bras bu la bdag tu bsnyad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin nam 'bras bu la bdag tu bsnyad pa ste /
translated: They are called the self in terms of its nature or its result.

original: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de la 'dir de dag gis bdag ces bya bar mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de la 'dir de dag gis bdag ces bya bar mthong ngo zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Here, they see that which is a phenomenon that is either by nature or the result of the self as the self.

original: gal te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dgag na /
analyzed: gal te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dgag na /
translated: If the internal creator is refuted,

original: 'o na bdag ji lta bu mi dgag ce na phung po tsam nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na bdag ji lta bu mi dgag ce na phung po tsam nyid do //
translated: then how is the self not refuted? The mere aggregates.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don du ste /
translated: The word “mere” has the meaning of exclusion.

original: gsung rab las phung po tsam nyid la tha dad du bdag ces nye bar btags so //
analyzed: gsung rab las phung po tsam nyid la tha dad du bdag ces nye bar btags so //
translated: The scriptures designate the mere aggregates as the self in a different way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de kho na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //🔽de lta na 'o na phung po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung @357b ste ;
analyzed: de kho na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro // de lta na 'o na phung po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung @357b ste ;
translated: because it is the reality of defilement and purification.🔽If that is so, then the aggregates would not be the self, because they are the basis of the view of the self, like the aggregates of another person.

original: de lta yin na mthong ba dang 'gal zhing khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na de dag ni mi 'pho ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na mthong ba dang 'gal zhing khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na de dag ni mi 'pho ste /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the sutra that states, “The self and the world are impermanent,” and it contradicts your assertion.🔽They do not change,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are momentary.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /🔽phung po tsam ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis mngon par 'du byas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na / phung po tsam ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis mngon par 'du byas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then how do you interpret the sutra that states,🔽The aggregates are created by affliction and karma.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa gzhag pa'i phyir yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sutra states that the aggregates are created by affliction and karma because the seeds of the maturation of affliction and karma and the seeds of the result that accords with the cause are deposited in the foundation consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang las rnams zhes gnyi ga smos pa ni gang yang rung ba zhig gis yongs su bsnyos pas ma tshang na skye ba 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang las rnams zhes gnyi ga smos pa ni gang yang rung ba zhig gis yongs su bsnyos pas ma tshang na skye ba 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both afflictions and karma are mentioned because it is impossible for birth to occur if either is incomplete.

original: phung po tsam zhes tsam gyi sgra ni bdag dang bdag gi rdzas stong pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po tsam zhes tsam gyi sgra ni bdag dang bdag gi rdzas stong pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “mere” in “mere aggregates” is used to indicate that they are empty of self and being mine.

original: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba'i rgyun gyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma zhes bya ba'i rgyun gyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The intermediate existence is the continuum🔽that connects the death existence to the birth existence.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bar mtshams med par 'brel ba ni 'gro ba dang skye ba dang rgyun te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bar mtshams med par 'brel ba ni 'gro ba dang skye ba dang rgyun te /
translated: The continuum of the intermediate existence connects the death existence and the birth existence without interruption, like a path or a road.

original: sngar gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i tshe nyams su myong nas /
analyzed: sngar gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i tshe nyams su myong nas /
translated: Having experienced the life projected by previous karma and affliction,🔽the projecting of its karmic maturation is exhausted and the final consciousness of death ceases together with its support.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'phen pa zad pas mthar 'chi ba'i mtha'i rnam par shes pa'i rten dang lhan cig 'gag cing srid pa par ma pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'phen pa zad pas mthar 'chi ba'i mtha'i rnam par shes pa'i rten dang lhan cig 'gag cing srid pa par ma pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: The support of the consciousness of the intermediate existence arises as the cause of birth.

original: srid pa bar ma dag kyang de kho na ltar rgyun chags su sngar gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phen pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i yul du phyin nas ma'i mngal du 'gag pa na skye ba'i phung po rnams bskyed par bya ba la rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dag kyang de kho na ltar rgyun chags su sngar gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phen pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i yul du phyin nas ma'i mngal du 'gag pa na skye ba'i phung po rnams bskyed par bya ba la rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, intermediate beings proceed to the place of their birth in the same way, and when they cease in the mother’s womb, they become the condition generating the aggregates of birth.

original: dper na mar me skad cig ma yin yang snga ma dang phyi mar rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa bar med pas rang gi rgyun gyi yul gzhan du 'gro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me skad cig ma yin yang snga ma dang phyi mar rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa bar med pas rang gi rgyun gyi yul gzhan du 'gro ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though a flame is momentary, it is uninterruptedly related to prior and subsequent causes and effects and thus goes to another place in its continuum.🔽As stated in the following:

original: ji ltar 'phangs bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phangs bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As projected, so it is born.

original: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa las 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur la /
translated: From different causes, different effects arise.

original: sems can so so'i tshe'i las kyang tha dad de /
analyzed: sems can so so'i tshe'i las kyang tha dad de /
translated: The karma of individual sentient beings is different.

original: de tha dad pa las tshe'i 'phen pa yang tha dad de /🔽kha cig ni thung la /
analyzed: de tha dad pa las tshe'i 'phen pa yang tha dad de / kha cig ni thung la /
translated: From that difference, the projection of lifespan is different.🔽Some lifespans are short.

original: gzhan gyi ni ring ngo ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ring ngo ;
translated: Others are long.

original: / de'i phyir gang zhig ji srid du 'phangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / de'i phyir gang zhig ji srid du 'phangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “For as long as the impetus lasts, etc.

original: mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de dag mtshon par byed pas mig la sogs pa'i rten rnams so //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de dag mtshon par byed pas mig la sogs pa'i rten rnams so //
translated: The signs are the supports of the eye, etc., because they are characterized by them.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis skyes ba ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis skyes ba ste /
translated: “Arisen from the evolution of action” means arisen by the power of action.
Here,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bshad do //
translated: it is explained that the evolution of action is the cause of the sense faculties.

original: gal te na res 'ga' ma'i za sa dang gnas pa'i bya ba mi mthun par spyod pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te na res 'ga' ma'i za sa dang gnas pa'i bya ba mi mthun par spyod pa'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sometimes, the mother’s food and activities are incompatible.🔽Food is incompatible when the mother eats sharp or hot things.

original: zas ni rno ba dang tsha ba zos pa dang // gnas pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa ni mchong ba dang rkyal lo //
analyzed: zas ni rno ba dang tsha ba zos pa dang // gnas pa'i bya ba mi mthun pa ni mchong ba dang rkyal lo //
translated: Activities are incompatible when the mother jumps or swims.

original: mngal kho nar 'chi ba ni 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //🔽rkyag dong zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mngal kho nar 'chi ba ni 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //🔽rkyag dong zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Death in the womb is called “destruction.”🔽The womb is like a cesspool, etc.

original: dri nga ba dang / mun khung dang / btsog pa'i 'dam rdza ba ni dring pa mu na khung btsog pa'i 'dam rdzab ste /
analyzed: dri nga ba dang / mun khung dang / btsog pa'i 'dam rdza ba ni dring pa mu na khung btsog pa'i 'dam rdzab ste /
translated: Muddy means the womb is muddy with blood and impurities.

original: lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der zhes phyis 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rma 'khyims pa chen po der zhes phyis 'chad pa'o //
translated: The great wound of the body is the womb.🔽The many thousands of types of worms are the many thousands of types of worms that live in the womb.

original: srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag ni srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag go //🔽de dag gi gnas ni srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag gi gnas te de'o //
analyzed: srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag ni srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag go // de dag gi gnas ni srin bu'i rigs shin tu mang po stong phrag gi gnas te de'o //
translated: The abode of those worms is the abode of the many thousands of types of worms.

original: khu chu dang khrag dang / chu ser dang / dri ma ni khu chu dang khrag dang chu ser dang dri ma ste /
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag dang / chu ser dang / dri ma ni khu chu dang khrag dang chu ser dang dri ma ste /
translated: Semen, blood, lymph, and impurities: semen, blood, lymph, and impurities are the four things that are the cause of the body.🔽Those things completely fill the womb, and the body is born from them.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.

original: khu chu dang khrag dang chu ser dang dri ma de dag gis kun nas khyad par du myags shing kun tu myags ba /🔽rnam par myags pa /🔽rul pa / rnag pa 'dred pa'o //
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag dang chu ser dang dri ma de dag gis kun nas khyad par du myags shing kun tu myags ba / rnam par myags pa / rul pa / rnag pa 'dred pa'o //
translated: The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.

original: de skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The body is born from the womb, and it is born from the womb that is completely filled with those things.🔽The body is

original: 'phen pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rjes su 'gro ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it follows the projecting.

original: yang nyon mongs pa can rnams kun tu spyod cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa can rnams kun tu spyod cing zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Moreover, those that are afflicted are engaged in, etc.

original: nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid pa byed pa de dag gis rkyen tshogs pa la bltos pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams kun tu spyod cing /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid pa byed pa de dag gis rkyen tshogs pa la bltos pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams kun tu spyod cing /
translated: Those that are afflicted, which depend on the convergence of conditions, are engaged in the internal and external sense bases and in incorrect mental activity.

original: las sna tshogs rnams kyang sog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las sna tshogs rnams kyang sog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they also accumulate various actions.

original: de nyon mongs pa dang las bsags pa de dag gis lus zhig nas yang snga ma bzhin du yang srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis las ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa dang las bsags pa de dag gis lus zhig nas yang snga ma bzhin du yang srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis las ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through the accumulation of those afflictions and actions, when the body disintegrates, he again goes to another world in accordance with his actions, by the continuum of the intermediate existence, as before.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: Thus,

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thog ma'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thog ma'i skye ba'o //
translated: the wheel of existence would be without beginning, and it would follow that it has no cause. This is the objection to origination at the beginning.

original: de'i phyir dang po'i skye ba ltar thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po'i skye ba ltar thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like the first arising, all would arise without a cause.

original: skyes dang po kho na rgyu med pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rgyu yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes dang po kho na rgyu med pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rgyu yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so, therefore, the cause of the first arising is not the cause of all.

original: de'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi tshe thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur te skye ba'i @358b rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyi tshe thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur te skye ba'i @358b rgyu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all would arise at all times, because there is no restriction on the cause of arising.

original: myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa mthong ba yang ma yin te de yod na yod pa'i phyir la de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa mthong ba yang ma yin te de yod na yod pa'i phyir la de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the power of seeds, etc., in sprouts, etc., seen, because they exist when it exists and do not exist when it does not exist.

original: yang 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: de'i phyir yul dang dus so sor nges pa las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang dus so sor nges pa las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “from the restriction of place and time.”

original: yul so sor nges pa ni sa bon gyi yul kho nar myu gu skye'i gzhan du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa ni sa bon gyi yul kho nar myu gu skye'i gzhan du ma yin pa'o //
translated: The restriction of place is that a sprout arises only in the place of the seed, not elsewhere.

original: dus nges pa ni sa bon bangs pa'i mjug thogs kho nar myu gu skye'i gzhan gyi tshe ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus nges pa ni sa bon bangs pa'i mjug thogs kho nar myu gu skye'i gzhan gyi tshe ma yin pa'o //
translated: The time is definite because the sprout is produced immediately after the seed, not at another time.

original: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las tshos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yul dang dus so sor nges pa las tshos pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa'i nus pa yang mthong bas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Since the power of fire, etc. with regard to cooking, etc. is seen to be definite with regard to place and time, the phrase “because of the definite time” should be applied.

original: 'di ltar tshos pa ni me dang 'brel ba'i yul kho nar skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin la me dang 'brel pa'i phyir mjug thogs kho nar 'byung gi thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshos pa ni me dang 'brel ba'i yul kho nar skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin la me dang 'brel pa'i phyir mjug thogs kho nar 'byung gi thams cad kyi tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, cooking is produced only in the place that is connected with fire, not elsewhere. And it occurs immediately after the connection with fire, not at all times.

original: yo pi ma n+ya te /
analyzed: yo pi ma n+ya te /
translated: The Sanskrit is yopi manyate.

original: ni tya ka da n'a padmu pa ga m'a d'a di sa tve pi pam s'a ra sya n'a yam do sha:/🔽ta sy'a nu tpam tti satv'a du tpitti ma ta shtsa p'urba k'a ra n'a sti tv'a phyu pa ga m'a ta /
analyzed: ni tya ka da n'a padmu pa ga m'a d'a di sa tve pi pam s'a ra sya n'a yam do sha:/ ta sy'a nu tpam tti satv'a du tpitti ma ta shtsa p'urba k'a ra n'a sti tv'a phyu pa ga m'a ta /
translated: nityakādanapadamupagamādī satve’pi pāṃsasya nāyamadoṣaḥ.🔽tasya anutpādanāt satvānāmutpāditatvaśca pūrvaṃ kāraṇāsti tvāpyupagamāt.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu rtag pa yod pa smra ba ni sngar nyid du bsal zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu rtag pa yod pa smra ba ni sngar nyid du bsal zin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the assertion of the existence of a permanent cause has already been refuted.

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir zhes bya ba der sa bon zad pas myu gu bzhin no (gang dag sems par byed pa rtag pa'i byed pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang por yod kyang 'di 'khor ba'i skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir zhes bya ba der sa bon zad pas myu gu bzhin no (gang dag sems par byed pa rtag pa'i byed pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang por yod kyang 'di 'khor ba'i skyon ma yin no //
translated: It is not the Lord, etc., because of the order, etc., like the sprout from the exhausted seed.🔽Since the cause of the world is not the Lord, etc., the world is not beginningless, because the cause is not permanent, like the potter, etc.🔽The world is not beginningless, because the cause is not permanent, like the potter, etc.

original: de'i mi skyed pa yod pa las skyed la de'i phyir sngon gyi rgyu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir/) zhes bya ba ni sa bon tshogs pa'am rul bar gyur ba'am phye mar gyur pa las myu gu skye ba med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa
analyzed: de'i mi skyed pa yod pa las skyed la de'i phyir sngon gyi rgyu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir/) zhes bya ba ni sa bon tshogs pa'am rul bar gyur ba'am phye mar gyur pa las myu gu skye ba med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa

original: la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba las skye ba 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar na skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tha ma ni mi 'gal te rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba las skye ba 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar na skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tha ma ni mi 'gal te rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is not beginningless, because the cause is not permanent, like the potter, etc.🔽The world is not beginningless, because the cause is not permanent

original: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'di dang yang 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po'i rgyun skye ba'i gnas skabs gsum bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'di dang yang 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: This is the world from the other world and the other world from this world.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: srid pa'i yan lag grangs du ma dbye ba tha dad pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa dang po la sogs pa bar med pa skye pa gsum dang 'brel pa'i gnas skabs ni sems can gyi rgyud du nye bar bstan te de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag grangs du ma dbye ba tha dad pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa dang po la sogs pa bar med pa skye pa gsum dang 'brel pa'i gnas skabs ni sems can gyi rgyud du nye bar bstan te de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba
translated: The continuum of sentient beings is taught as dependent origination, which is divided into many limbs, without interruption, connected with the three births beginning with the first.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum pa ste gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis cha gsum pa ste gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Dependent origination has twelve limbs, divided into three parts, and not otherwise.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang 'dir sems can du ston pa la mngon par 'dod kyi sems can du ston @359a * //🔽ba ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang 'dir sems can du ston pa la mngon par 'dod kyi sems can du ston @359a * // ba ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Dependent origination is asserted here as the teaching of sentient beings, not as the teaching of non-sentient beings.

original: de 'jig rten pha rol nas 'pho bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'jig rten pha rol nas 'pho bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that non-sentient beings transmigrate from the other world.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni rgyu mi mthun pa dang rgyu med pa dgag pa'i phyir yin la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i don yin no ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni rgyu mi mthun pa dang rgyu med pa dgag pa'i phyir yin la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i don yin no ;
translated: The teaching of dependent origination is for the purpose of refuting non-concordant causes and causelessness, and the meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of engagement in cyclic existence.

original: / yang ci'i phyir bstan bcos las sems can dang sems can du mi ston pa yang bstan la mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan ce na /
analyzed: / yang ci'i phyir bstan bcos las sems can dang sems can du mi ston pa yang bstan la mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan ce na /
translated: Why is it that the treatise teaches both sentient beings and non-sentient beings, but the sūtras teach only sentient beings?

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba dag la bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba dag la bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: That is also taught for the purpose of training disciples,

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni de'i don kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni de'i don kho nar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearance of buddhas is for that purpose alone.

original: des na don chen po yin pa'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan to //🔽bstan bcos las ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: des na don chen po yin pa'i phyir mdo las sems can du ston pa kho na bstan to // bstan bcos las ni chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Therefore, because it has great meaning, the sūtras teach only sentient beings.

original: sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yang bstan to //
translated: But the treatise follows reality and teaches both sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba rgyu bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba rgyu bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve links are the twelve causes.

original: cha gsum zhes bya ba ni dum bur yongs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: cha gsum zhes bya ba ni dum bur yongs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: The three parts are the three sections of the womb.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni bar du'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dag go //
translated: The remaining eight are in the middle. The eight are consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, and existence.

original: yang na ci thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par mngal du 'jug pa tsam la brten pa rnams kyi 'am /
analyzed: yang na ci thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par med par mngal du 'jug pa tsam la brten pa rnams kyi 'am /
translated: Or, does it refer to all sentient beings, without distinction, who enter the womb?

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: Or, does it refer to sentient beings of the three realms?

original: skye ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i skye ba la'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i skye ba la'o //
translated: In this life means in the life of entering the womb.

original: gang bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la gang zhig srid pa'i gnas skabs ma thob par 'chi ba de la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bar ma dor 'chi ba yang ma yin la zhes bya ba la gang zhig srid pa'i gnas skabs ma thob par 'chi ba de la ni bar ma dor 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not one who dies in the intermediate state. One who dies without attaining the state of existence is called one who dies in the intermediate state.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not one who is in the form or formless realms.

original: de na nur nur po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na nur nur po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the embryonic states such as kalala do not exist there.

original: gzugs na spyod pa la rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug mi srid do //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa la rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug mi srid do //
translated: Name and form and the six sense bases that are distinct from consciousness do not exist in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i phyir de dag med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i phyir de dag med do //
translated: The formless realm is so called because those states do not exist there.

original: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs med de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa la ni rnam par shes pa dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs med de /
translated: In the form realm, the state of name and form does not exist separately from the state of consciousness and the six sense bases.

original: 'di ltar / ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad //
translated: Name and form exist

original: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do //
analyzed: skye mched drug dod tshun chad do //
translated: from then until the six sense bases arise.

original: zhes @359b 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes @359b 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na yan lag bcu gnyis med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi khams na yan lag bcu gnyis med do //
translated: Therefore the twelve factors do not exist in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs dang skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The states of name and form and the six sense bases do not exist in the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pas de dag med de de'i phyir yan lag bcu yod ngo ;
analyzed: gzugs med pas de dag med de de'i phyir yan lag bcu yod ngo ;
translated: The formless realm is so called because those states do not exist there. Therefore ten factors exist there.

original: /'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: /'di ltar gleng gzhi chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, in the great basis sutra, the Dharma teaching, it says:🔽“Ananda, if consciousness did not enter the mother’s womb, would that consciousness increase, grow, and expand?”

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na rnam par shes pa de 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur ram zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las ma gtogs par ma'i mngal du 'jug pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs par ma gyur na rnam par shes pa de 'phel ba dang / rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur ram zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las ma gtogs par ma'i mngal du 'jug pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to enter the mother’s womb except from the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig 'das pa'i ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gis rgyas par byas te da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig 'das pa'i ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gis rgyas par byas te da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba rnams 'jug go //
translated: Thus, through the increase of past ignorance and karmic formation, present consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling occur.

original: yang de ltar byung ba'i sred pa dang len pa dang srid pas rgyas par byas te /
analyzed: yang de ltar byung ba'i sred pa dang len pa dang srid pas rgyas par byas te /
translated: Again, through the increase of craving, grasping, and becoming that occur in that way,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi dag 'jug ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi dag 'jug ste /
translated: future birth and aging and death occur.

original: rgyun gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the case for the stream.

original: de ltar na gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas na srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa 'khrugs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du byas na srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag pa 'khrugs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, if one considers all persons, the presentation of the members of existence becomes confused.🔽Because the prior end and the subsequent end are mentioned along with their results and causes.

original: / sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'bras bu dang rgyu dang bcas pa dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sngon gyi mtha' 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' rgyu dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir /
translated: The prior end is mentioned along with its result, and the subsequent end is mentioned along with its cause.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis dang cha gsum pa de nyid sngon gyi mtha' ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' ba dang rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis dang cha gsum pa de nyid sngon gyi mtha' ba dang phyi ma'i mtha' ba dang rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: Thus, the twelve members of dependent origination, which are divided into three parts, are described as twofold: those that pertain to the prior end and those that pertain to the subsequent end.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: Among them, those that pertain to the prior end are ignorance and the conditioning factors.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba'i yan lag rnams te /
translated: Its result is the members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling.

original: de ltar na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag bdun ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'o //
translated: Thus, seven members are related to the prior limit.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ba gang zhe na /
translated: Which are related to the later limit?

original: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: Birth and aging-death.

original: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i yan lag rnams te /
translated: The causes of these are the members of craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: de ltar na yan lag lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag lnga ni phyi ma'i mtha' ba'o //
translated: Thus, five members are related to the later limit.

original: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di gang zhig ce na zhes @360a * //🔽bya ba ni ci ma rig pa ni mi shes pa zhig kho na'am /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa la sogs pa 'di gang zhig ce na zhes @360a * // bya ba ni ci ma rig pa ni mi shes pa zhig kho na'am /
translated: Again, what is ignorance, etc.?

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa can thams cad yin snyam nas 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa can thams cad yin snyam nas 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is asked because one wonders whether ignorance is just non-knowledge or whether it is all the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //🔽de'i phyir / ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o // de'i phyir / ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: The same should be said of the others.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Ignorance is the state of affliction in the past.

original: sngon zhes bya ba smos pa ni da ltar ba sred pa dang len pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba smos pa ni da ltar ba sred pa dang len pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “past” is mentioned because the present is included in craving and grasping.

original: yang ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras brjod ce na /
translated: Again, why are all the afflictions expressed by the word “ignorance”?

original: yang srid 'phen pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid 'phen pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu'i ngo bor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the formative forces that impel rebirth.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pas rab tu bsgyur ba'i las ni yang srid 'phen pa la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pas rab tu bsgyur ba'i las ni yang srid 'phen pa la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Because karma that is activated by the defilements is capable of impelling rebirth,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams la las yod kyang yang srid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams la las yod kyang yang srid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for those who are without defilements, there is no rebirth, even though they have karma.

original: thams cad yang srid can ma yin te 'du byed kyi 'jug pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams thams cad kho na byed pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yang srid can ma yin te 'du byed kyi 'jug pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams thams cad kho na byed pa can ma yin no //
translated: Not all karma is capable of impelling rebirth, because the defilements are not the cause of all the activities of formative forces, such as the will to go, etc.

original: ma rig pa ni gdon mi tha ba ste ;
analyzed: ma rig pa ni gdon mi tha ba ste ;
translated: However, ignorance is certainly the cause of all the defilements,

original: de'i phyir de'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad brjod do //
translated: therefore, it is said that the word ‘defilement’ refers to all the defilements.

original: 'di dag ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di dag ga las she na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang de dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ignorance is the principal one and because it is concomitant with them.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says: because of their concomitance.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan gyi phan tshun ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan gyi phan tshun ni ma yin te /
translated: All the defilements are associated with ignorance, but not with each other.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be “associated with ignorance.”

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: “By the power of that” means by the power of ignorance.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: These are the defilements.

original: kun tu 'byung ba ni skye pa ste ma rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa gzhan skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba ni skye pa ste ma rmongs pa la nyon mongs pa gzhan skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: “Arising” means birth. When one is not deluded, the other defilements do not arise.

original: de nyid la dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dper na rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is like the expression, “The king is coming.”

original: zha ma 'bring pa ni rgyal po dang lhan cig spyod pa rnams te /
analyzed: zha ma 'bring pa ni rgyal po dang lhan cig spyod pa rnams te /
translated: The middling weavers are those who accompany the king.

original: de'i dbang mi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir rgyal po gtso bo yin no //
