analyzed: de'i dbang mi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir rgyal po gtso bo yin no //
translated: The king is the principal one because he controls them and they do not function when he is absent.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: gal te ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyon mongs pa thams cad de bzhin du yod pa de la nyon mongs pa gzhan nyid gtso bo yin pas ma rig pa gtso bo'i yang gtso bo la lhan cig ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa nyon mongs pa thams cad de bzhin du yod pa de la nyon mongs pa gzhan nyid gtso bo yin pas ma rig pa gtso bo'i yang gtso bo la lhan cig ces bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: If all the defilements are associated with ignorance in this way, then it is not tenable to say that ignorance is the principal one among the principal ones, because another defilement is the principal one.

original: ci ste nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig spyod pa'i rig pa nyid ma rig pa yin pa de lta na yang re zhig gi sgra thob ste /
analyzed: ci ste nyon mongs pa thams cad dang lhan cig spyod pa'i rig pa nyid ma rig pa yin pa de lta na yang re zhig gi sgra thob ste /
translated: But if ignorance is that which is associated with all the defilements, then the word “also” is not appropriate.

original: @360b 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @360b 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with attachment and so on.

original: phan tshun lhan cig spyod pa med kyang khyad par med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig spyod pa med kyang khyad par med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no difference between them, even though they are not mutually associated.

original: gal te yang rab tu 'jug byed ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
analyzed: gal te yang rab tu 'jug byed ma rig pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
translated: Moreover, if it is said that ignorance is the instigator of the process,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: then attachment and so on are the instigators.

original: kun tu spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ma rig pa rab tu 'jug byed nyid kyi phyir bi par++ya y'a patti /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ma rig pa rab tu 'jug byed nyid kyi phyir bi par++ya y'a patti /
translated: Because attachment and so on are the instigators of the process of ignorance.

original: ci ste rab tu 'jug byed ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste rab tu 'jug byed ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it is not the instigator, it is still associated with the others.

original: dbang ma yin pas de gtso bor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dbang ma yin pas de gtso bor mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not the dominant one because it is not the sovereign.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in either case.

original: 'dir ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras smos pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i sgras smos pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Here, there is no contradiction in stating that all the defilements are ignorance because they are associated with ignorance and they occur together with ignorance.

original: yang gzhan gyi sgra nyon mongs pa'i sgras ma yin te phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi sgra nyon mongs pa'i sgras ma yin te phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not that the words of another are defilements because they are not mutually associated.

original: 'di la mi rung ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la mi rung ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir der ma rig pa gtso bor 'dod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir der ma rig pa gtso bor 'dod do //
translated: It is accepted that ignorance is the dominant one there because it is associated with all the defilements.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gsal ba nyid de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa der yang ma rig pa gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gsal ba nyid de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa der yang ma rig pa gtso bo nyid do //
translated: It is the dominant one there because it is associated with the other defilements, which are distinct from it and are characterized by clarity.

original: rmongs pa nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye'i ma rmongs pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa skye'i ma rmongs pa las ma yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on arise from delusion, not from non-delusion.

original: yang chags pa nyid las rmongs pa dang nyon mongs pa gzhan yang 'jug go //
analyzed: yang chags pa nyid las rmongs pa dang nyon mongs pa gzhan yang 'jug go //
translated: And from attachment itself, delusion and other afflictions arise.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu'i dbang nyid las nyon mongs pa dang kun tu spyod par gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu'i dbang nyid las nyon mongs pa dang kun tu spyod par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, all afflictions are said to arise from the power of the cause, and from the power of the cause of the cause.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ma rig pa'i rgyu can nyid yin yang skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa nyid du gang bshad pa zhig pa'i 'bras bu 'phen pa nus pa 'byin pa nyid kyi phyir dang mi gsal bsam rig pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ma rig
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ma rig pa'i rgyu can nyid yin yang skye ba snga ma'i nyon mongs pa nyid du gang bshad pa zhig pa'i 'bras bu 'phen pa nus pa 'byin pa nyid kyi phyir dang mi gsal bsam rig pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ma rig
translated: Even though attachment and so on have ignorance as their cause, the afflictions of the previous birth are explained as the cause of the afflictions of this birth, because the result of the destruction of the potential to project is produced, and because of the similarity of the unclear ignorance.

original: pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The word ignorance is used.

original: da ltar ba yang ma zhig pa rang gi nus pa'i shugs gsal bsam rig pa'i sgras mi brjod do //
analyzed: da ltar ba yang ma zhig pa rang gi nus pa'i shugs gsal bsam rig pa'i sgras mi brjod do //
translated: Even in the present, the unclear potential of the destruction of its own power is not expressed by the word clear ignorance.

original: de lta na 'o na da ltar ba'i tshe rabs lam rig pas nye bar ma bcom pa'i rang gis nus pa'i shugs las ma rig pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de kun tu rgyu ba'i phyir ro //🔽sam (kun tu rig pa'i phyir/) be dyatv'atv'a pya dvi dy'a bady'a tva nn'a ti ba rta te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na da ltar ba'i tshe rabs lam rig pas nye bar ma bcom pa'i rang gis nus pa'i shugs las ma rig pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de kun tu rgyu ba'i phyir ro // sam (kun tu rig pa'i phyir/) be dyatv'atv'a pya dvi dy'a bady'a tva nn'a ti ba rta te /
translated: If that is so, then since the present life is not destroyed by the path of seeing, it would be the cause of ignorance because it is the cause of the present life.

original: de lta na 'o na myong ba nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa'i phyogs brten no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na myong ba nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa'i phyogs brten no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then since it is experienced, it would be the basis of the side of ignorance.

original: zhig pa'i nus pa'i shugs nyid las ni ma yin te /🔽dus kyi @361a * //
analyzed: zhig pa'i nus pa'i shugs nyid las ni ma yin te / dus kyi @361a * //
translated: It is not the power of the disintegration of the cause,🔽because the past does not exist.

original: rang bzhin dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin pas 'das pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo nyid ni ci ltar ma rig pa'i phyogs la brten par byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rnam par 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin pas 'das pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa myong ba'i ngo bo nyid ni ci ltar ma rig pa'i phyogs la brten par byed de /
translated: Since the past does not exist, the nature of time, its characteristics and its transformation do not exist. Therefore how could the nature of the experience of past attachment and so on be the basis of the side of ignorance?

original: de'i phyir mdo mdzad pas gsungs pa'i rgyu gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo mdzad pas gsungs pa'i rgyu gnyis nyid do //
translated: Therefore the two causes stated by the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning are correct.

original: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: “Conditioned by the karma of former times” is supplied.

original: 'dir ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'bras bu byung zin pa rnams kho na yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'bras bu byung zin pa rnams kho na yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here, ignorance and the karmic forces are posited as members because they are the results of former times.

original: 'bras bu ma byung ba rnams la ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma byung ba rnams la ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The results that are not yet arisen are called craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi sa chod pa rnams kyi yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa mang po myong ba de lta na yang de rnams yan lag nyid du rnam par ma bzhag ste de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi sa chod pa rnams kyi yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa mang po myong ba de lta na yang de rnams yan lag nyid du rnam par ma bzhag ste de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yod
translated: Even though many past and future karmas and afflictions are experienced in the other lives that are separated by other lives, they are not posited as members because they are not members that are directly related to the karma and afflictions of the present life.

original: pas bar ma chad pa kho nar der skye bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pas bar ma chad pa kho nar der skye bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be understood that the past and future are included in the present members because they are related to them as cause and effect.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i las kyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of meritorious action, etc. means the state of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable action.

original: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aggregates at the time of linking are consciousness.

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa smos pas bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma rnams rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa smos pas bsdus so //
translated: At that time, consciousness is primary, and the remaining aggregates are included in the term consciousness because they are concomitant with consciousness.

original: ma'i mngal du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid na ste /
analyzed: ma'i mngal du zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid na ste /
translated: In the mother’s womb refers to the linking of consciousness in the intermediate existence at the time of birth.

original: srid pa bar ma dor nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dor nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated to indicate that the linking of the intermediate existence is the first moment of birth.

original: de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, it is mental consciousness alone,

original: de'i tshe lnga po rnams la skye ba'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lnga po rnams la skye ba'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five sense consciousnesses do not exist at that time.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa dang skye ba'i yan lag gnyis ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa dang skye ba'i yan lag gnyis ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: Here, the two members of consciousness and name-and-form are moments,

original: gzhan dag ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma mang po dag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma mang po dag yin no //
translated: but the others are many moments because they are continuous.

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad zhes bya ba la /
translated: Name-and-form after that

original: 'di ni gnas skabs la bzhag pa yin gyi chos nyid la bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs la bzhag pa yin gyi chos nyid la bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is posited in terms of the period of time, but not in terms of reality.

original: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi dod tshun chad do //
translated: The four bases exist from the moment of conception.

original: zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ba yin pa las zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The text should read “from the moment of conception,”

original: ci'i phyir de skad du brjod par bya ba yin zhe na lus dang yid kyi skye mched ni skye ba'i srid pa kho nar dod @361b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad du brjod par bya ba yin zhe na lus dang yid kyi skye mched ni skye ba'i srid pa kho nar dod @361b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bases of the body and mind exist from the moment of conception.

original: de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The text should read “because they are posited there at that time,”

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dag ni des rab tu ma phye ba'i phyir gnas skabs gang zhig skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba de kho na tshang na de'i ming gis bsnyad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dag ni des rab tu ma phye ba'i phyir gnas skabs gang zhig skye mched kyis rab tu phye ba de kho na tshang na de'i ming gis bsnyad do //
translated: because the consciousness base and the form and name bases are not distinguished in the intermediate existence.

original: yang na de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang na de'i tshe der rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Or the text should read “because they are posited there at that time,”🔽because the bases of eye, etc., are complete at the time of the intermediate existence.

original: / zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi tshe rten dang brten pa yongs su tshang ba'i sgo nas yin la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi tshe rten dang brten pa yongs su tshang ba'i sgo nas yin la /
translated: The bases of eye, etc., are complete at the time of the intermediate existence, because the supported and the support are complete.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang lus kyi skye mched kyang yongs su tshang ba rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang lus kyi skye mched kyang yongs su tshang ba rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The mental faculty and the body faculty are also complete.

original: de'i phyir skye mched drug nyid du brjod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched drug nyid du brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, they are called the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched bzhir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched bzhir ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not called the four sense spheres.

original: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three come together up to the moment of contact.

original: ji srid du dbang po la sogs pa gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po'i tshul gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni skye mched drug ces brjod do //
analyzed: ji srid du dbang po la sogs pa gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po'i tshul gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni skye mched drug ces brjod do //
translated: The three faculties, etc., come together for a certain period of time, and that period is called the six sense spheres.

original: de srid kyi gnas skabs de ni skye mched drug gtso bo yin no ;
analyzed: de srid kyi gnas skabs de ni skye mched drug gtso bo yin no ;
translated: That period is the principal factor of the six sense spheres.

original: / gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te gnas skabs kyi tha dad pas gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i yid ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te gnas skabs kyi tha dad pas gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i yid ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: That is not so, because the mental faculty is different, since it is different in terms of its state.

original: lus kyi skye mched de'i gnas skabs can sngar ma thob pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched de'i gnas skabs can sngar ma thob pa thob par byed do //
translated: The body sense sphere is in that state, and it causes the attainment of what was not previously attained.

original: gal te de'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gang yin pa ni skye mched bzhi las mi skye ba ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gang yin pa ni skye mched bzhi las mi skye ba ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: If you say that the four bases other than name-and-form are not the condition of name-and-form, that is not so.

original: gzhan dag na re rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs kho nar bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po dag thob pas rnam par shes pa dang lus kyi kun tu spyod pa thams cad srid pas lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag de'i tshe nyid mtha' dag thob pas
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs kho nar bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po dag thob pas rnam par shes pa dang lus kyi kun tu spyod pa thams cad srid pas lus dang yid kyi skye mched dag de'i tshe nyid mtha' dag thob pas
translated: Others say that the male and female faculties are obtained in the state of having hands and feet, and all bodily and mental activities are possible, so the body and mind bases are obtained at that time.

original: kun tu spyod pa srid pas ;
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa srid pas ;
translated: Because all bodily and mental activities are possible,

original: sngar skye mched drug skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid legs so //
analyzed: sngar skye mched drug skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid legs so //
translated: it is better to say that the six bases arise first.

original: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gsum 'dus tshun chad do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is up to the three coming together.

original: ji srid du dbang po la sogs pa gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs su chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i tshul gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni skye mched drug ces brjod do ;
analyzed: ji srid du dbang po la sogs pa gsum ma 'dus pa de srid kyi gnas skabs su chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i tshul gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni skye mched drug ces brjod do ;
translated: Up to the time when the three, the faculty and so on, come together, that state is complete in the manner of small, medium and great, and that is called the six bases.

original: / yang 'di'i gnas skabs su rnam par shes pa nyid mi skye ba ci zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir 'dir gsum 'dus par gyur pa las /
analyzed: / yang 'di'i gnas skabs su rnam par shes pa nyid mi skye ba ci zhe na / gang gi phyir 'dir gsum 'dus par gyur pa las /
translated: Also, why is consciousness not produced in this stage?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas skabs 'gar yang mi skye ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas skabs 'gar yang mi skye ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Because the mental consciousness is not produced in any situation when the three conditions come together.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs su yang @362a * //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs su yang @362a * //
translated: The body consciousness is also accepted as being in the stage of name and form.

original: 'dod do ; / rnam par shes pa'i tshegs lhag ma rnams kyang skye ba srid kyi thams cad kyi tshe ma yin pas skye mched drug gi gnas skabs gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod do ; / rnam par shes pa'i tshegs lhag ma rnams kyang skye ba srid kyi thams cad kyi tshe ma yin pas skye mched drug gi gnas skabs gtso bo nyid do //
translated: The remaining consciousnesses are also possible, but not at all times. Therefore, the stage of the six sense spheres is primary.

original: 'o na gal te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ming dang gzugs kyi mjug thogs kho nar mi 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ming dang gzugs kyi mjug thogs kho nar mi 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
translated: If the six sense spheres are the condition of name and form, then the six sense spheres would not immediately follow name and form.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su ming dang gzugs la bltos pa'i phyir chung du dang 'bring gis kyang gzugs kyi gnas skabs su skye mched drug skyes pa'i nus pa med pas rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su ming dang gzugs la bltos pa'i phyir chung du dang 'bring gis kyang gzugs kyi gnas skabs su skye mched drug skyes pa'i nus pa med pas rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the small and medium faculties, which are subsequent to consciousness, are not conditions for the arising of the six sense spheres in the stage of form, because they are dependent on name and form.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs gang gis ming dang gzugs skye mched drug skyed pa la rkyen du gyur pa de la bltos nas skye mched drug skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs gang gis ming dang gzugs skye mched drug skyed pa la rkyen du gyur pa de la bltos nas skye mched drug skye ste /
translated: Therefore, the six sense spheres arise in dependence on name and form in the stage in which name and form become conditions for the arising of the six sense spheres.

original: sa bon yongs su gyur pa las myu gu skye ba bzhin nam /
analyzed: sa bon yongs su gyur pa las myu gu skye ba bzhin nam /
translated: This is like a sprout arising from a transformed seed.

original: mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir sprin las char bzhin no //
analyzed: mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir sprin las char bzhin no //
translated: Or, it is like rain from a cloud, because it arises immediately after.

original: 'o na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyis skye mched drug la ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen kyis skye mched drug la ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the six sense spheres in relation to the condition of name and form?

original: 'ga' zhig tu skye mched ci yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu skye mched ci yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: In some cases, the six sense spheres do not function at all.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni rkyen thams cad la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni rkyen thams cad la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Because this is the same for all conditions.

original: a'a kshipta sy'a bi p'urba ka karma bee kalbe n'a nutpatti:/
analyzed: a'a kshipta sy'a bi p'urba ka karma bee kalbe n'a nutpatti:/
translated: The non-arising of karma due to the absence of eyes, etc.

original: gang gi tshe sngon gyi las rnams kyi nges par byas pa de'i tshe ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las skye ste de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon gyi las rnams kyi nges par byas pa de'i tshe ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las skye ste de'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the prior karma has been determined, name-and-form arises with name-and-form as a condition, because it belongs to that continuum.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang ming gi rkyen no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang ming gi rkyen no //
translated: And form, etc., are the condition for name.

original: de dag ni dang po'i rnam par shes pa ni she ka ('phen pa'i rkyen sngon du 'gro ba las kyi rnam par rtog pas mi skyed do/) / skad cig nyid la skye bas de dag ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du mi brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni dang po'i rnam par shes pa ni she ka ('phen pa'i rkyen sngon du 'gro ba las kyi rnam par rtog pas mi skyed do/) / skad cig nyid la skye bas de dag ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du mi brjod do //
translated: But since they arise in the very moment, they are not called the condition for name-and-form.

original: de dag kyang sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa ste 'dir ni sems can du ston pa kho na'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa ste 'dir ni sems can du ston pa kho na'i dbang du byas so //
translated: And they are either indicative of sentient beings or non-indicative of sentient beings. Here, only those indicative of sentient beings are considered.

original: reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi //🔽rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
analyzed: reg pa bde sdug la sogs kyi // rgyu shes nus pa tshun chad do //
translated: Contact is the cause of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: up to the point of the ability to cognize.

original: reg pa ni skye mched drug gi 'og rol tu rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni skye mched drug gi 'og rol tu rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Contact is established after the six sense bases.

original: de'i tshe reg pa'i rten yongs su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe reg pa'i rten yongs su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the basis of contact is fully understood.

original: de'i phyir reg pa sngar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa sngar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, contact does not exist prior to that.

original: tshor 'khrig tshun chad zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshor 'khrig tshun chad zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to the point of feeling and sexual intercourse.

original: tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par nus pa yin pas /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum gyi rgyu yongs su gcod par nus pa yin pas /
translated: The cause of the three feelings is able to be determined.

original: zas la sogs pa'i srid pa kun tu spyad kyang /
analyzed: zas la sogs pa'i srid pa kun tu spyad kyang /
translated: Even though one engages in the existence of food, etc.,

original: ji srid 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs de ni tshor ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags mi 'byung ba'i gnas skabs de ni tshor ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: as long as the state of sexual passion does not arise, that is not called feeling.

original: reg pa'i bya ba ma lus pa ni tshor ba la yod pa'i phyir snga rol @362b du ni ma yin te tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i bya ba ma lus pa ni tshor ba la yod pa'i phyir snga rol @362b du ni ma yin te tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of contact is entirely in feeling, it is not prior to that, because feeling does not exist.

original: longs spyod smos pas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod smos pas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning enjoyment, the objects of desire such as form, etc., are included.

original: de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de srid 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to the point of the arising of the result.

original: de zhes bya bas ni yongs su rgyug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de zhes bya bas ni yongs su rgyug pa bstan to //
translated: By the word “that,” the complete running is indicated.

original: las gang la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa 'bras bur yod pa ni de'i srid pa'o //🔽tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
analyzed: las gang la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa 'bras bur yod pa ni de'i srid pa'o // tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
translated: The existence that is the result of the karma that will arise is that existence.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to the point of feeling and old age and death.

original: yang der sred pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa ci gang gi phyir yan lag nyid du rnam par ma bzhag ce na skye ba gsum pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang der sred pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa ci gang gi phyir yan lag nyid du rnam par ma bzhag ce na skye ba gsum pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Why are craving, etc. not posited as members? Because a third birth does not exist.

original: de dag nyid 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are the members in the context of dependent origination.

original: bzhi pa'i rgyu ni 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i rgyu ni 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: The cause of the fourth is not taught here.

original: de dag kyang gang skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa de so so'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa de so so'i yan lag gi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Those which are the cause of birth are posited as individual members.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni skad cig la srid pas skad cig ma ste rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig spyod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni skad cig la srid pas skad cig ma ste rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig spyod ces pa'i don to //
translated: The word “moment” means “existing in a moment,” i.e., cause and effect occur simultaneously.

original: rgyun zhes bshad pa ni rgyun dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun zhes bshad pa ni rgyun dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The word “continuum” means “having a continuum.”

original: rang gi don la 'phel ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la 'phel ba bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: It is a series in order to accomplish the increase of one’s own purpose.

original: skye ba gsum gyi gnas skabs ni gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba gsum gyi gnas skabs ni gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: The state of the three births is the state.

original: rgyun chags pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called a continuum.

original: gal te gnas skabs pa nyid rgyun chags pa yin na ji ltar rnam pa bzhir brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs pa nyid rgyun chags pa yin na ji ltar rnam pa bzhir brjod ce na /
translated: If the state is a continuum, how can it be described in four ways?

original: rnam pa gzhan du rgyun chags pa dang / rnam pa gzhan du gnas skabs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur bas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rgyun chags pa dang / rnam pa gzhan du gnas skabs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur bas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is described in four ways because it is a continuum in one way and a state in another way.

original: de rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa las gnas skabs par brjod la /
analyzed: de rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa las gnas skabs par brjod la /
translated: It is described as a state because it is related to cause and effect.

original: de yang skal pa mnyam pa dang skal pa mnyam pa ma yin pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa las 'brel pa can du brjod do ;🔽/ gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i yan lag rgyun dang ldan pa las ma rig pa'i yan lag kho na 'byung ba de ni skal pa mnyam pa'i 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: de yang skal pa mnyam pa dang skal pa mnyam pa ma yin pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa las 'brel pa can du brjod do ; / gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i yan lag rgyun dang ldan pa las ma rig pa'i yan lag kho na 'byung ba de ni skal pa mnyam pa'i 'brel pa can no //
translated: It is described as related because it is related to homogeneous and heterogeneous parts.🔽When the member ignorance arises from the continuum of the member ignorance, it is related to homogeneous states.

original: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i yan lag las 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba de'i tshe skal pa mnyam pa ma yin pa'i 'brel pa can te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i yan lag las 'du byed kyi yan lag 'byung ba de'i tshe skal pa mnyam pa ma yin pa'i 'brel pa can te /
translated: When the member formations arises from the member ignorance, it is related to heterogeneous states.

original: 'dir ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i 'brel ba can la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni skal pa mi mnyam pa'i 'brel ba can la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the Abhidharmasamuccaya states that it is related to heterogeneous states.

original: gnas skabs la yod pa ni gnas skabs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs la yod pa ni gnas skabs pa'o //
translated: The state is the state of being.🔽

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phung po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The four aggregates that are simultaneous with consciousness are the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of conception, the aggregate of formations, and the aggregate of consciousness.

original: 'di la rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang @363a * //🔽gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang @363a * // gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of form is the four primary elements and the form derived from the four primary elements.🔽The four primary elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: ye na bra h'a re na dz'i bi t'at bya ba ro ba yo ti /
analyzed: ye na bra h'a re na dz'i bi t'at bya ba ro ba yo ti /
translated: The form derived from the four primary elements is the eye sense faculty, the ear sense faculty, the nose sense faculty, the tongue sense faculty, the body sense faculty, visible form, sound, odor, taste, the part of the element of form that is not derivative, and the form that is the object of the meditative concentration of the masters of the supernatural powers.🔽The form that is the object of the meditative concentration of the masters of the supernatural powers is the form that is created by the masters of the supernatural powers.

original: gang du rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de skad cig pa'am rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di dngos gzhi ste las kyi lam zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du rnam par rig byed gang yin pa de skad cig pa'am rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di dngos gzhi ste las kyi lam zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The masters of the supernatural powers are those who have attained the meditative concentration of the masters of the supernatural powers.🔽The form that is created by them is the form that is created by the masters of the supernatural powers.

original: rnam par bshad pa 'dir ni srid pa dang khyad par med par 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir nges par dbang po dang lhan cig skye ba kho na la ni gzugs su gzung ngo zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'dir ni srid pa dang khyad par med par 'gyur te / de'i phyir nges par dbang po dang lhan cig skye ba kho na la ni gzugs su gzung ngo zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The form that is not derivative is the form that is not derived from the primary elements.🔽The form that is the object of the meditative concentration of the masters of the supernatural powers is the form that is created by the masters of the supernatural powers.🔽The masters of the supernatural powers are those who have attained the meditative concentration of the masters of the supernatural powers.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par gnas pa'i dbang po rnams ni zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The form that is created by them is the form that is created by the masters of the supernatural powers.🔽The form that is not derivative is the form that is not derived from the primary elements.

original: ji ltar ming la dbang po rnams gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ming la dbang po rnams gnas she na /
translated: How are the faculties based on name?

original: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they function in dependence on it.

original: 'di ltar ming gi dbang gis de'i rten 'byung ba chen po gnas shing de btang bas de mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming gi dbang gis de'i rten 'byung ba chen po gnas shing de btang bas de mi gnas so //
translated: For, due to the power of name, the great elements that are its support arise and, when it is abandoned, they do not continue to exist.

original: yang na dbang po rnams la brten nas ming 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams rten gyi ngo bos ming la rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnams la brten nas ming 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams rten gyi ngo bos ming la rnam par gnas so //
translated: Or, because name arises in dependence on the faculties, they are based on name in the sense that they are its support.🔽The meeting of the six sense spheres is contact.

original: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dir mig la sogs pa rnams rang gi yul la 'jug cing 'dus pa ni reg pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dus pa ni reg pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dir mig la sogs pa rnams rang gi yul la 'jug cing 'dus pa ni reg pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the meeting of the eye, etc., with their objects is called contact.

original: cig car skye mched drug 'dus pa mi srid pas reg pa ni ji ltar srid pa'i sgo nas yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: cig car skye mched drug 'dus pa mi srid pas reg pa ni ji ltar srid pa'i sgo nas yin par rig par bya'o // de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Since the simultaneous meeting of the six sense spheres is impossible, contact should be understood in terms of what is possible.🔽That which is associated with that is craving.

original: chags pa de'am /
analyzed: chags pa de'am /
translated: That is to say, craving is associated with contact.

original: sred pa'am / ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa rnams ni len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'am / ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa rnams ni len pa'o //
translated: The grasping is the entanglements such as shamelessness, absence of abashment, etc., which are associated with craving or ignorance.

original: de nas kun nas bslang ba'i zhes bya ba ni chags pas kun nas bslang ba ste de ni skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas kun nas bslang ba'i zhes bya ba ni chags pas kun nas bslang ba ste de ni skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The instigation is the instigation by craving, because that is the present topic.

original: gzhan dag na re ni ma rig pa'i yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni ma rig pa'i yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is instigation by ignorance.

original: gzhan dag ni sems pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sems pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is instigation by intention.

original: lus dang ngag gi las zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: The action is the action of body and speech, i.e., the manifest and unmanifest.

original: skye ba ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni reg pa'o //
translated: The birth is the contact.

original: yongs su smin pa ni skad cig ma snga ma la ltos te gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni skad cig ma snga ma la ltos te gzhan du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The maturation is the transformation of the previous moment.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni skad cig gcig la yongs su smin pa 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni skad cig gcig la yongs su smin pa 'dod de /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas maintain that the maturation is in one moment.

original: 'jig pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The conformity is the conformity with the disintegration.

original: zhig pa ni shi ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhig pa ni shi ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The disintegration is the death.

original: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Destruction is the state of being directed toward destruction.

original: kha cig na re srog gcod pa ni zhe sdang gis mthar phyin par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re srog gcod pa ni zhe sdang gis mthar phyin par byas pa yin la /
translated: Some say: Killing is completed by hatred.

original: zhe sdang dang 'dod chags @363b pa gnyis kyang skad cig gcig la sred pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang 'dod chags @363b pa gnyis kyang skad cig gcig la sred pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But hatred and attachment do not exist simultaneously in a single continuum.

original: de'i phyir nor 'phrog pa'i zhes brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nor 'phrog pa'i zhes brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, one should say that killing is completed by attachment.

original: nges pa de ni sems gzhan med pa la de yongs su rdzogs pa ni yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa de ni sems gzhan med pa la de yongs su rdzogs pa ni yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: But this is not so, because it should be understood that when there is no other mind, the completion of the action is understood.

original: de ltar bshad na mi dge ba gzugs can thams cad la skad cig pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na mi dge ba gzugs can thams cad la skad cig pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is explained in this way, then all physical nonvirtuous actions are the twelve members of dependent origination in a single moment.

original: yang 'dir ci'i phyir dus kyi kun slong sems kho na yongs su gzung zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'dir ci'i phyir dus kyi kun slong sems kho na yongs su gzung zhe na /
translated: Why is only the mental state that is the motivating factor of the time of action taken as the motivating factor?

original: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba yang ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba yang ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the motivating factor of the cause, because that is mistaken.

original: gdon mi za bar chags pa dang sdang ba dang / rmongs pa rnams la las rnams rab tu 'jug pa ma yin gyi sred pa kho na rjes su 'jug byed yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar chags pa dang sdang ba dang / rmongs pa rnams la las rnams rab tu 'jug pa ma yin gyi sred pa kho na rjes su 'jug byed yin no //
translated: It is not that actions necessarily function in relation to attachment, hatred, and delusion, but rather that craving alone is the instigator.

original: ji ltar rab tu byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it says in the treatise,

original: de las ji skad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de las ji skad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is all conditioned phenomena.

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad rnams skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad rnams skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na /
translated: In this regard, all conditioned phenomena are momentary because they possess arising and cessation.

original: skad cig pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is momentary dependent origination.

original: 'brel pa can ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig gnyis ka 'brel pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig gnyis ka 'brel pa las yin no //
translated: It is also related dependent origination because the two moments of cause and effect are related.

original: tshe gsum par chad med par 'brel pa las yin te /
analyzed: tshe gsum par chad med par 'brel pa las yin te /
translated: It is also uninterrupted dependent origination because it is related to the three times.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i tshe gsum dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i tshe gsum dang 'brel pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is also the dependent origination of the three times because it is related to the past, present, and future.

original: de nyid gnas skabs pa dang / rgyun chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnas skabs pa dang / rgyun chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “momentary” and “continuous. ”

original: bar chad med pa smos pa ni tshe gsum 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa smos pa ni tshe gsum 'grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “without interval” is used because it is accomplished in three lives.

original: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pas 'brel pa can te /
analyzed: 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pas 'brel pa can te /
translated: It is “related” because it is related to similar and dissimilar effects.

original: ji skad du ma rig pa'i rgyu las kun tu 'dod chags pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du ma rig pa'i rgyu las kun tu 'dod chags pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “because of the cause of ignorance, there is desire. ”

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'am lung ma bstan gyi sems skye pa'am bzlog pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'am lung ma bstan gyi sems skye pa'am bzlog pas so //
translated: In the same way, after a wholesome thought, a defiled or neutral thought arises, or vice versa.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: skad cig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig spyod pa ste ;
analyzed: skad cig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig spyod pa ste ;
translated: The momentary is the simultaneous functioning of cause and effect.

original: dper na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: rgyun chags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes rgya cher 'byung ste chos kyi nus pa gsal byed de /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes rgya cher 'byung ste chos kyi nus pa gsal byed de /
translated: The continuous is the cause and effect that are not simultaneous, as is the case for the other sense consciousnesses.

original: gzhan dag ni lnga pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lnga pa zhes zer ro //
translated: The other is the fifth.

original: dishta he tu ra ti nirbritte (mthong rgyu shin tu mya ngan las 'das/) //
analyzed: dishta he tu ra ti nirbritte (mthong rgyu shin tu mya ngan las 'das/) //
translated: Distha hetu ratini rvita (the seen is utterly nirvana).

original: las kyi rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @364a * //
analyzed: las kyi rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @364a * //
translated: Because it is generated by the cause of karma.

original: da lta la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da lta la sogs pa'o //
translated: The present, etc.

original: 'di ni gnas skabs par 'dod lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs par 'dod lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is asserted to be temporary.

original: lo'i sgra ni 'di ni 'di ltar ma yin nam zhes mdo sde pa'i bsam pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni 'di ni 'di ltar ma yin nam zhes mdo sde pa'i bsam pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word “lo” clarifies the Sautrantika’s thought, “Is it not like this?”

original: gtso bo'i phyir na yan lag bsgrags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtso bo'i phyir na yan lag bsgrags zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is primary, it is proclaimed as a link.

original: snga ma'i phung po lnga po thams cad ci rigs par phyi ma thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa de'i phyir 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir yan lag bsgrags par shes par bya'i 'di dag nyid rkyen dang rkyen can du gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i phung po lnga po thams cad ci rigs par phyi ma thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa de'i phyir 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir yan lag bsgrags par shes par bya'i 'di dag nyid rkyen dang rkyen can du gyur pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the five aggregates of the former life are the conditions of all the latter ones, it is understood that it is proclaimed as a link because it is primary, but not because they are the conditions and the conditioned.🔽It occurs elsewhere in the treatise.

original: rab tu byed pa dag las gzhan tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni mdo las gsungs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis las gzhan du ste /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dag las gzhan tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni mdo las gsungs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis las gzhan du ste /
translated: The twelve links taught in the sutras occur elsewhere in the treatise.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes 'byung bas yan lag bcu gnyis las tha dad pa rkyen dang rkyen can du ma nges par gyur pa rnams kyang gsungs so //🔽mdo las ni bzlog pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes 'byung bas yan lag bcu gnyis las tha dad pa rkyen dang rkyen can du ma nges par gyur pa rnams kyang gsungs so // mdo las ni bzlog pas so //
translated: Thus, all conditioned things are so called, and those not definitely ascertained as conditions or things having conditions, distinct from the twelve members, are also mentioned.🔽But the sutra has the opposite meaning.

original: dgongs pa las byung ba ni dgongs pa can yin la ;
analyzed: dgongs pa las byung ba ni dgongs pa can yin la ;
translated: That which is based on the sutra is interpretable in meaning.

original: mtshan nyid la rnam par gnas pa ni mtshan nyid pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la rnam par gnas pa ni mtshan nyid pa ste /
translated: That which is based on the characteristics is definitive in meaning.

original: chos mngon pa las gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is stated in the Abhidharma is definitive in meaning because it is related to the characteristics.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin dang zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin dang zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Just so means otherwise.

original: gnas skabs pa dang rgyun chags pa dang / sems can du ston pa ni mdo las gsungs pa dgongs pa can no //
analyzed: gnas skabs pa dang rgyun chags pa dang / sems can du ston pa ni mdo las gsungs pa dgongs pa can no //
translated: That which is stated in the sutra is interpretable in meaning because it is based on the state, the continuum, and the sentient being.

original: skad cig pa dang 'brel pa can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las gsungs pa mtshan nyid pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang 'brel pa can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa las gsungs pa mtshan nyid pa'o //
translated: That which is stated in the Abhidharma is definitive in meaning because it is based on the moment, the continuum, and the non sentient.

original: de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir cha gsum pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is threefold.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is taught in order to stop confusion about the prior limit, the later limit, and the middle.

original: cha ni cha shas so //
analyzed: cha ni cha shas so //
translated: Part means portion.

original: ci bdag ci zhig tu ni byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni lha'am 'on te mi zhig snyam pa'o //
analyzed: ci bdag ci zhig tu ni byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni lha'am 'on te mi zhig snyam pa'o //
translated: What was I in the past? means was I a god or a human?

original: bdag ji ltar byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis tshul gang gis so //
analyzed: bdag ji ltar byung bar gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis tshul gang gis so //
translated: How did I come to be? means by what mode and in what manner.

original: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'on te 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: What will I become in the future? means will I exist in the future or not?

original: ci zhig tu ni 'byung bar 'gyur ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig tu ni 'byung bar 'gyur ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What will I become? means what will I become?

original: 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rdzas 'tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rdzas 'tshol ba'o //
translated: What is this? means seeking the substance of the body.

original: 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang @364b gis tshul gang zhig tu yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang @364b gis tshul gang zhig tu yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this? means by what mode and in what manner.

original: lus kyi rjes nges par ma zin pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi rjes nges par ma zin pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the body is not ascertained” means

original: yod pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “what is it that exists?”

original: bdag cag da ltar yod pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: bdag cag da ltar yod pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: “What is it that exists for us now?”

original: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin zhes de ltar mi nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni ci zhig yin zhes de ltar mi nges pa'o //
translated: “What is it that will be?”

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
translated: “What is ignorance and what are the formative forces?”

original: sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is said in order to counteract confusion about the prior limit.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'i 'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'i 'o //
translated: Birth and aging-and-death are mentioned in order to counteract confusion about the future limit.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness up to becoming are mentioned in order to counteract confusion about the present.

original: 'di ltar mdo nyid las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo nyid las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste ;
translated: The Sūtra itself says:

original: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las so //
translated: Because the Sūtra itself says:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: Dependent origination is this: because this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: from the arising of this, that arises. This is the characteristic of the twelve members.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa dag go / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /🔽'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa dag go / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: One sees them as they are in reality with right wisdom.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni phung po lnga'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The twelve members such as ignorance are the five aggregates.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / chos tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la 'brang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel bar khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / chos tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not follow the past, and so on, because one understands the connection between cause and effect and because one understands that there are only phenomena.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming, and so on.

original: sred pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni bar gyi srid pa yin yang phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir yin te de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag gis ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni bar gyi srid pa yin yang phyi ma'i mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir yin te de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag gis ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
translated: Although craving and so on are intermediate existence, they are stated to be the latter end because they are the cause of the latter end.🔽Vaibhasikas say: They are stated to be the latter end because consciousness and so on up to feeling are its result.

original: tshor ba la thug pa rnams kyang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la thug pa rnams kyang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yin pa'o //
translated: They are stated to be the former end because they stop delusion about the former end.

original: yang na ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bar la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: yang na ma rig pa dang 'du byed rnams kyang de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bar la rmongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: Or else, since ignorance and formation are its cause, they are stated to be the intermediate existence because they stop delusion about the intermediate existence.

original: de ltar na 'ang 'das pa'am bar gyi cha yod pa ma yin pas mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'ang 'das pa'am bar gyi cha yod pa ma yin pas mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: But if that is so, then since the past and intermediate existences do not exist, they contradict the sutras.

original: de lta bas na snga ma nying kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma nying kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: Therefore the former position is free of fault.

original: nyon mongs pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three afflictions

original: ma rig @365a * //
analyzed: ma rig @365a * //
translated: Ignorance

original: pa ni da ltar gyi skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: pa ni da ltar gyi skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Birth is the cause of the present existence.

original: sred pa dang len pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Craving and grasping are the cause of future birth.

original: las gnyis so zhes bya ba ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu 'du byed dang srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las gnyis so zhes bya ba ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu 'du byed dang srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The two actions are the cause of present and future birth.

original: de yan lag bdun po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yan lag bdun po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seven members are the cause of the present existence.

original: da ltar ba'i skye ba la ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa lnga'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i skye ba la ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa lnga'o //
translated: The five members, from consciousness to feeling, are the cause of the present birth.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi gnyis so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang rga shi gnyis so //
translated: The two members, birth and old-age-and-death, are the cause of the future birth.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag gzhi zhes bya zhe na /🔽las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag gzhi zhes bya zhe na / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Why are these members called “bases”?🔽Because they are the support of action and the defilements.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The seven members are the support of action and the defilements, because they are the cause of action and the defilements.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the same way, they are the effect.

original: yan lag bdun kho na 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: yan lag bdun kho na 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The seven members are the effect of the two actions.🔽The five members, from consciousness to feeling, are the effect of the action which matures.🔽The two members, birth and old-age-and-death, are the effect of the action which projects.

original: sngon gyi mtha' ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga dang / phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga dang / phyi ma'i mtha' pa'i skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: The five beginning with consciousness in the prior limit and birth and old age and death in the subsequent limit.

original: lhag ma lnga ni zhe ba bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma lnga ni zhe ba bya ba la /
translated: The remaining five are the basis.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of karma and moral defilement, they project the result in the form of rebirth.

original: gzhi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: The five bases are consciousness, name/form, the six sense bases, contact and feeling.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / de'i rkyen gyis len pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / de'i rkyen gyis len pa ste /
translated: The two kinds of moral defilement are craving and the clinging which is conditioned by the former.

original: de ltar na bar du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bar du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid rgyas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause and result in the middle are extensive.

original: yang ji ltar sred pa 'di len pa yin bzhin du logs shig tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sred pa 'di len pa yin bzhin du logs shig tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: But how can craving be clinging?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sred pa'i skad cig ma dang po ni sred pa'i sgras brjod la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sred pa'i skad cig ma dang po ni sred pa'i sgras brjod la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: The first moment of craving is called craving.

original: rgya che ba ni len pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: rgya che ba ni len pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: The extensive one is called grasping,

original: rgyun gyi sgo nas yul ches dam por 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyi sgo nas yul ches dam por 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds the object very tightly from the perspective of its continuum.

original: de ltar yod pas skad cig ma la sogs pa rnams yan lag gsum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yod pas skad cig ma la sogs pa rnams yan lag gsum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it exists in that way, then it follows that the moments and so on would have three parts.

original: gnyis su yang 'dod pas thal bar 'gyur ba 'di med do //
analyzed: gnyis su yang 'dod pas thal bar 'gyur ba 'di med do //
translated: Since they assert two parts, this consequence does not apply.

original: yul so so'i skad cig las skad cig ma mang po nyid kyi phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba yin pas de nyid skad cig ma gcig go //
analyzed: yul so so'i skad cig las skad cig ma mang po nyid kyi phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i skye ba yin pas de nyid skad cig ma gcig go //
translated: Since there are many moments of each object, the moment of linking is the birth of consciousness and that is one moment.

original: yang ci'i phyir sred pa kho na de ltar bstan gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sred pa kho na de ltar bstan gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is craving alone taught in that way and not other afflictions?

original: skad cig ma dang rgyun gyi dbye bas bstan te /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang rgyun gyi dbye bas bstan te /
translated: It is taught from the perspective of the division of moments and continua.

original: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa @365b la sred pa kho na gtso bo'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa @365b la sred pa kho na gtso bo'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Craving alone is the principal cause for the actualization of existence.

original: de la dang po dgu mthong ba las de'i gnyen po tshol ba la ka tha yanta banta:syu ri ti /
analyzed: de la dang po dgu mthong ba las de'i gnyen po tshol ba la ka tha yanta banta:syu ri ti /
translated: In the first nine members, one seeks the antidote to craving.

original: gzhan dag na re sred pa kho na bstan gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ma yin pa ni yul rnams dang dang por phrad pa ni sred pa'i sgras bstan la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sred pa kho na bstan gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ma yin pa ni yul rnams dang dang por phrad pa ni sred pa'i sgras bstan la /
translated: Others say: “Craving alone is taught, not other defilements. The initial contact with objects is taught by the word craving.

original: rgyas par phrad pa la nye bar len pa'i sgras bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyas par phrad pa la nye bar len pa'i sgras bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: The subsequent expansion of contact is taught by the word grasping.”

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa'i rgyu can gyi las gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis srid pa'i rgyu can gyi las gsungs te /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān taught karma that has existence as its cause.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad las kyi rgyu yin pa de'i phyir 'dir srid pa'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad gzung ba de'i skyon bstan pa bskyed pa'i phyir de ltar shes so ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad las kyi rgyu yin pa de'i phyir 'dir srid pa'i sgras nyon mongs pa thams cad gzung ba de'i skyon bstan pa bskyed pa'i phyir de ltar shes so ;
translated: Since all defilements are the cause of karma, here the word existence is understood to include all defilements in order to teach the fault of generating that.

original: /'dir ni brgal ba'i lan du mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: /'dir ni brgal ba'i lan du mi sbyor ro //
translated: Here, this is not applied as a response to an objection.

original: tshe gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi yan lag tha dad pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi yan lag tha dad pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the different limbs in the three times will be explained.

original: de lta ma yin na yan lag bcu gnyis phung po lnga'i gnas skabs kyis gnas skabs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yan lag bcu gnyis phung po lnga'i gnas skabs kyis gnas skabs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gal lo //
translated: If it were not so, it would contradict the statement that the twelve limbs are the dependent origination in the five aggregates.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang de'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skye ba dang de'i rkyen gyis rga shi ste /
translated: In the future time, etc. means that birth and aging-death have ignorance and the karmic forces as their conditions.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the result is summarized.

original: nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sgo gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to teach the afflictions as a single door means

original: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: that ignorance is the state of affliction in the past.

original: zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Thus,

original: ma rig pa'i sgo gcig pus nyon mongs pa thams cad bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo gcig pus nyon mongs pa thams cad bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: all the afflictions are taught by the single door of ignorance.

original: rgyu mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: rgyu mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: Thus, the cause is summarized.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba yang skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba yang skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Again, why? is also relevant, and so it should be applied to all.

original: las ni sngon gyi mtha' dang bar du yang mdor bsdus pa nyid du bstan pas rnam par ma dpyad do //
analyzed: las ni sngon gyi mtha' dang bar du yang mdor bsdus pa nyid du bstan pas rnam par ma dpyad do //
translated: Action is not analyzed in the middle, since it is taught in brief at the beginning and end.

original: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ma byas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang don med pa'i 'bad pa ma byas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is not necessary to make an effort to explain what is meaningless.

original: bar du rgyu rgyas par bstan pas sngon gyi mthar yang rgyu rgyas pa dang / 'bras bu rgyas par bstan pas phyi ma'i mthar yang 'bras bu rgyas par rtogs par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bar du rgyu rgyas par bstan pas sngon gyi mthar yang rgyu rgyas pa dang / 'bras bu rgyas par bstan pas phyi ma'i mthar yang 'bras bu rgyas par rtogs par nus pa nyid do //
translated: Since the cause is taught in detail in the middle, the cause is understood in detail at the beginning and since the result is taught in detail at the end, the result is understood in detail at the end.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba thams cad bltos pa'i bye brag las sngon dang bar dang phyi ma yin te /🔽de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis su 'bras bu rgyas par brjod pa don med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba thams cad bltos pa'i bye brag las sngon dang bar dang phyi ma yin te / de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis su 'bras bu rgyas par brjod pa don med par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since all births are prior, middle, or posterior in dependence on specific circumstances,🔽it is meaningless to explain the result in detail at the beginning and end.

original: yang brjod pa'i 'bad pa don med do //
analyzed: yang brjod pa'i 'bad pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to make an effort to explain it again.

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kho na yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras @366a * //
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kho na yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras @366a * //
translated: If dependent origination has only twelve members,

original: pa la ; yan lag lnga ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: pa la ; yan lag lnga ni rgyu yin la /
translated: five members are causes and

original: bdun 'bras bu yin pas de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdun 'bras bu yin pas de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the seventh is the result, there are only twelve members.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other cause or result.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, since ignorance has no cause, it follows that samsara would have a beginning.

original: rga shi la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rga shi la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: And since aging and death have no result, it follows that samsara would have an end.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po med pa kho na srid pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po med pa kho na srid pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that samsara would be without a remedy.

original: ma rig pa dang rga shi gnyis kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu khas len na yang yan lag lhag pas bstan pa ma tshang ba nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag thug pa med par thal lo zhe na ;
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rga shi gnyis kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu khas len na yang yan lag lhag pas bstan pa ma tshang ba nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag thug pa med par thal lo zhe na ;
translated: If you accept that ignorance and aging and death are cause and result, then the teaching that there are twelve members would be incomplete because there would be additional members, and it follows that cause and result would be infinite.🔽From affliction, affliction and action

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: arise.

original: gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las zhes bya ba la tshe 'di'i srid pa dang len pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'i dus na ma rig pa yin par bshad de /
analyzed: gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las zhes bya ba la tshe 'di'i srid pa dang len pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'i dus na ma rig pa yin par bshad de /
translated: “From the basis or the afflictions” means that the craving and grasping of this life are explained as ignorance in the past.

original: des na ma rig pa gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'grub po //🔽gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na ma rig pa gzhi 'am nyon mongs pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'grub po // gzhi las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is established that ignorance arises from the basis or the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste 'di ltar tshor ba'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin par bshad la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste 'di ltar tshor ba'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin par bshad la /
translated: “From the basis, the afflictions arise” means craving. Thus it is said that craving has the condition of feeling.

original: rga shi yang tshor ba la thug pa yin te /🔽tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
analyzed: rga shi yang tshor ba la thug pa yin te / tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin //
translated: And aging and death culminate in feeling.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Up to feeling is aging and death.”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang / bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang / bya ba nyid do de las gzhi //
translated: Thus, as it is said, “From the afflictions, the afflictions and action arise; from that, the basis.

original: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
analyzed: de las gzhi dang nyon mongs skye //
translated: From that, the basis and the afflictions arise.”🔽This is the system of the links of existence.

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs //🔽zhes ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag lugs // zhes ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the system of the links of existence.

original: de lta ma yin na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ste /
translated: If it were not so,
