original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa mi bzhed par gyur na ni gang gis na de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di zhes gsungs bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs dang // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa mi bzhed par gyur na ni gang gis na de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di zhes gsungs bar 'gyur la /
translated: If you do not accept the explanation of the sutra that says, “From the afflictions arise the afflictions and actions,” then how can you accept the statement, “From the great mass of suffering”?

original: 'di ni nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni nus pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur //
translated: What is the point of this statement?

original: de'i phyir yan lag gzhan kha skong mi dgos la thug pa med par mi 'gyur zhing bstan pa ma tshang ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag gzhan kha skong mi dgos la thug pa med par mi 'gyur zhing bstan pa ma tshang ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no need to add other members, and there is no infinite regress.

original: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Others say: In another sutra, it says, “Conditioned by ignorance, the karmic predispositions are brought together.”

original: mdo gzhan gang las she na /
analyzed: mdo gzhan gang las she na /
translated: In what other sutra does it say this?

original: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las te /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las te /
translated: It is said in the sutra that explains the cause, the condition, and the basis.

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas /
translated: The sutra says, “Monks, ignorance has a cause,

original: rkyen dang bcas /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas /
translated: it has a condition,

original: gzhi dang bcas so //
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas so //
translated: it has a basis.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu gang yin /🔽rkyen gang yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu gang yin / rkyen gang yin /
translated: What is the cause of ignorance?🔽What is the condition?

original: @366b gzhi gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: @366b gzhi gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It should be said that it is due to incorrect mental attention.

original: de lta na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rkyen ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rkyen ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Even so, since the condition of incorrect mental attention is not mentioned, cyclic existence would have a beginning and an end,

original: yan lag gzhan kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yan lag gzhan kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur bas /
translated: or another link would have to be added.🔽Thus the error would still occur.

original: nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: But incorrect mental attention arises from the cause of ignorance.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore this is not an error.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las 'di ltar ming dang gzugs dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las 'di ltar ming dang gzugs dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas gti mug las skyes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Name and form give rise to the six sense bases, which give rise to contact, which gives rise to feeling, which gives rise to craving, which gives rise to grasping, which gives rise to existence, which gives rise to birth, which gives rise to aging and death.

original: ci'i phyir de 'dir ma bshad cing yan lag gzhan du yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'dir ma bshad cing yan lag gzhan du yang ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is this not explained here? Why is it not another link?

original: de'i phyir de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'du ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'dir yang len pa'i nang du 'du ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is explained here that it is included in grasping.

original: de zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to improper mental attention.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
translated: “ Here” refers to the Sūtra on Dependent Origination.

original: len pa rnams nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: len pa rnams nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because grasping is the nature of all the afflictions,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang sems kyi gzo ba nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir len pa'i nang du 'du ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang sems kyi gzo ba nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir len pa'i nang du 'du ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and because improper mental attention is an afflicted mental factor, it is included in grasping.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus ignorance is not causeless,

original: yan lag gzhan kha bskang bar bya dgos pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yan lag gzhan kha bskang bar bya dgos pa yang ma yin la /
translated: and it is not necessary to add another link.

original: thug pa med pa thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Nor does the error of infinite regress ensue.

original: slob dpon gyis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Master says, “How are incorrect mental processes included in grasping?”

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that they are included in grasping just as the aggregates of form, etc., are included in the truth of origination, but not as the essence of affliction.

original: len pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kho na yin gyi chos gzhan dag ni ma yin te /🔽ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //🔽nyer len rnams te lta rnam gnyis //🔽phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kho na yin gyi chos gzhan dag ni ma yin te / ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas // nyer len rnams te lta rnam gnyis // phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Grasping is only the afflictions, not other dharmas,

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “The view is the only grasping, and the other afflictions are grasping because they are associated with the view.”🔽The other afflictions are grasping because they are associated with the view.

original: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa las yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that they are included in grasping because they are concomitant with it,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: then they are not included in grasping because they are not the essence of affliction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na len pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na len pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir de'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: If you say that they are included in grasping because they are concomitant with grasping,🔽then the other afflictions are included in grasping because they are concomitant with grasping.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: To clarify the intention of others, he says,

original: sred pa dang ma rig pa dag gi nang du yang zhes bya ba ste /🔽rten cing 'brel @367a * //
analyzed: sred pa dang ma rig pa dag gi nang du yang zhes bya ba ste /🔽rten cing 'brel @367a * //
translated: “They are also included in craving and ignorance.”🔽The other afflictions are included in craving and ignorance because they are concomitant with them.

original: par 'byung ba'i yan lag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: par 'byung ba'i yan lag gi nang du'o //
translated: It is included among the branches that are mentioned in the sutra.

original: des na 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it follows that it is included in grasping.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is improper mental activity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni len pa ltar sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni len pa ltar sred pa dang ma rig pa gnyis dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is concomitant with both craving and ignorance, like grasping.

original: des na len pa'i nang du 'du ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sred pa dang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir na 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na len pa'i nang du 'du ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sred pa dang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir na 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not only included in grasping, but since it is included in craving and grasping, it should be explained in this way.

original: khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no specific reason.

original: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if it is included, it is not mentioned separately.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa tsam gyis ni nang du 'du bar mi rtogs te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa tsam gyis ni nang du 'du bar mi rtogs te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not understood that it is included merely through being concomitant because that is mistaken.

original: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang ji ltar 'di las 'di zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa yin du chug na yang ji ltar 'di las 'di zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if it is included, how is it mentioned separately from this?

original: mdo de las ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir len pa ma lus pa dang 'dra bar srid pa'i rgyu nyid du rtog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mdo de las ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa len pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir len pa ma lus pa dang 'dra bar srid pa'i rgyu nyid du rtog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because improper mental attention is included in grasping, it is considered to be the cause of existence, like grasping in its entirety.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not considered to be the cause of ignorance.

original: gang las len pa'i nang du 'du bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par ma rig pa'i rkyen nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba mdo 'di las len pa ma rig pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: gang las len pa'i nang du 'du bas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par ma rig pa'i rkyen nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba mdo 'di las len pa ma rig pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma bstan to //
translated: This sutra does not teach that grasping is the cause of ignorance because it does not teach that improper mental attention is the condition of ignorance, since it is included in grasping.

original: gal te mdo las ma bstan yang nang du 'du ba kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur ro zhe na 'o na ni srid pa dang ma rig pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te mdo las ma bstan yang nang du 'du ba kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur ro zhe na 'o na ni srid pa dang ma rig pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If you say that although it is not taught in the sutra, it is known to be the cause and effect of ignorance because it is included in it, then existence and ignorance would also be the cause and effect of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis ltar ma bstan yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho nas sred pa dang len pa dag dang / ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis ltar ma bstan yang len pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho nas sred pa dang len pa dag dang / ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Although ignorance and incorrect mental activity are not taught as links, they are included in grasping. Thus craving and grasping, and ignorance and compositional activity, are known to be causal entities.

original: de'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ltar srid pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyang yan lag gzhan nyid du mi bya bar nus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ltar srid pa dang ma rig pa gnyis kyang yan lag gzhan nyid du mi bya bar nus na /
translated: Therefore, if it is possible that craving and ignorance are not made into separate links, like incorrect mental activity,

original: byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: byed pa yang yin te /
translated: then they are made into separate links.

original: de'i phyir len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yan lag gzhan nyid du mi brjod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yan lag gzhan nyid du mi brjod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason that they are not mentioned as separate links is not because they are included in grasping.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len no //
translated: Others say that the master Haribhadra

original: mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i mdo las so //
translated: in another sutra, that is, in the sutra that teaches the cause, the condition, and the basis,

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: that also refers to incorrect mental activity.

original: reg pa'i dus su bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: reg pa'i dus su bstan pa yin la /
translated: It is taught at the time of contact.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i @367b dus gang yin pa de nyid reg pa'i dus so //🔽gti mug gis skyed par byed pa can nam /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i @367b dus gang yin pa de nyid reg pa'i dus so // gti mug gis skyed par byed pa can nam /
translated: The time when visual consciousness arises is the time of contact.

original: gti mug las skyes pa ni gti mug las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ni gti mug las skyes pa'o //
translated: It is produced by delusion, or it arises from delusion.

original: nyon mongs pas brnyogs pa'i phyir na rnyog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas brnyogs pa'i phyir na rnyog pa'o //
translated: It is turbid because it is disturbed by the afflictions.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The sutra states: “Feeling that arises from contact accompanied by ignorance.”

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba yin la /
translated: Feeling that arises from contact associated with ignorance is feeling that arises from contact accompanied by ignorance.

original: de yang gdon mi za par ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gdon mi za par ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: And that is certainly associated with ignorance,

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: because feeling that is not associated with ignorance is not a condition for craving.

original: de lta bas na reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na reg pa'i dus na yod pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “incorrect mental activity that exists at the time of contact.”

original: ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ma rig pa rgyu med pa nyid kyang ma yin zhing /
translated: Ignorance is not causeless,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir bcu gnyis las gzhan pa'i yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir bcu gnyis las gzhan pa'i yan lag gzhan gyis kha bskang bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: and since it arises from the cause of incorrect mental activity, it is not supplemented by another factor that is different from the twelve.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa reg pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir na thug pa med par thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa reg pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir na thug pa med par thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Since incorrect mental activity is included in contact, it is not the case that there is an infinite regress.

original: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis phan tshun gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis phan tshun gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because ignorance and incorrect mental activity arise from each other.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gti mug las skyes pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gti mug las skyes pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “mental activity that arises from delusion.”

original: 'o na ni de ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed ba las skyed ba nyid dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gti mug las skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni de ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed ba las skyed ba nyid dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa gti mug las skyes pa nyid do //
translated: But then, “that” refers to ignorance, which is produced from improper mental attention, and improper mental attention is produced from delusion.

original: gzhan du gsungs pas zhes bya ba mdo gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gsungs pas zhes bya ba mdo gzhan du'o //
translated: Because it is stated elsewhere, in another sūtra.

original: 'dir brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdor ro //
translated: Here, it should be stated, in the Sūtra on Dependent Origination.

original: ma bshad pa de'i phyir dgongs pa 'dis ma rig pa'i rkyen ma brjod do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: ma bshad pa de'i phyir dgongs pa 'dis ma rig pa'i rkyen ma brjod do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Since it is not explained, by this intention, the condition of ignorance is not mentioned.

original: slob dpon dpal len gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon dpal len gyis smras pa /
translated: Master Śrīlāta says:

original: brjod par bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: brjod par bya mi dgos so //
translated: It need not be stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir yang go ba zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang go ba zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood here.

original: 'dir yang go pa zhes bya ba ni mi srid do snyam nas 'dri ba ni /🔽ma brjod bzhin du ji ltar go //
analyzed: 'dir yang go pa zhes bya ba ni mi srid do snyam nas 'dri ba ni / ma brjod bzhin du ji ltar go //
translated: Here, understanding is not possible, so the question is asked:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it understood without being stated?

original: rig pa las so zhes bya ba la ma smras pa kho na go ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rig pa las so zhes bya ba la ma smras pa kho na go ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it understood without being stated,

original: gang zhig rig pa las go ba de yang go ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rig pa las go ba de yang go ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: but also that which is understood from knowledge is not understood.

original: rig pa gang gis zhes bya ba la /🔽'dir ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin @368a * //
analyzed: rig pa gang gis zhes bya ba la / 'dir ma rig pa dang tshul bzhin @368a * //
translated: By what knowledge?

original: ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis phan tshun gyi rgyu las byung bar go bar 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa yid la byed pa gnyis phan tshun gyi rgyu las byung bar go bar 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro // dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa med pa ni zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Here, ignorance and incorrect mental attention are understood to arise from each other.🔽The feeling of arhats, which is free from ignorance, is not a condition for craving.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te ;
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi tshor ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa ni sred pa'i rkyen ma yin te ;
translated: The feeling of arhats, which is not associated with ignorance, is not a condition for craving.

original: 'dis ni tshor ba'i dus na ma rig pa yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshor ba'i dus na ma rig pa yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that ignorance exists at the time of feeling.

original: phyin ci log med pa'i reg pa yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa'i reg pa yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Contact that is free from error, which is unafflicted, is not a condition for feeling.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: and it is not the condition of the afflicted feeling of the arhats.

original: de ltar na reg pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na reg pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yod do //
translated: Thus, at the time of contact, the condition of afflicted feeling is incorrect mental attention.

original: zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdor yang sred pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid du bshad /
analyzed: 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdor yang sred pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid du bshad /
translated: In the Pratītyasamutpāda Sūtra, craving is explained as the condition of feeling,

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang reg pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang reg pa'o //
translated: and its condition is contact.

original: ma rig pa med par tshor pa nyon mongs pa can med la /
analyzed: ma rig pa med par tshor pa nyon mongs pa can med la /
translated: Without ignorance, there is no afflicted feeling,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med par phyin ci log gi reg pa med pa de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i rig pas 'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med par phyin ci log gi reg pa med pa de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i rig pas 'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: and without incorrect mental attention, there is no contact that is distorted. Therefore, by the reasoning explained above, it is established that incorrect mental attention is the condition of ignorance here.

original: ma rig pa med par phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin zhing yid la byed pa de yang gti mug las skyes pa nyid du grub po /
analyzed: ma rig pa med par phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa yod pa ma yin zhing yid la byed pa de yang gti mug las skyes pa nyid du grub po /
translated: Without ignorance, mistaken attention does not exist, and it is established that attention arises from delusion.

original: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyes so zhes bstan la /
analyzed: de lta na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / mdo gzhan las ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyes so zhes bstan la /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that🔽feeling would be the condition of craving

original: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba yang sred pa'i rkyen ma tshang zhing /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa'i tshor ba yang sred pa'i rkyen ma tshang zhing /
translated: even for arhats,

original: phyin ci log med pa'i rig pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa'i rig pa yang nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: and that nonmistaken cognition would be the condition of affliction.

original: yan lag gnyis po 'di yang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba 'dir nus pa mi byed do //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis po 'di yang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba 'dir nus pa mi byed do //
translated: These two factors, contact and feeling, are not the conditions of craving.

original: ma brjod kyang gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir 'di go'o zhe na /
analyzed: ma brjod kyang gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir 'di go'o zhe na /
translated: Even though they are not mentioned, they are taught elsewhere, so they are understood.

original: mdo gzhan las de bsod nams mngon par 'du byed na bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs la /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las de bsod nams mngon par 'du byed na bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs la /
translated: If he creates merit, his consciousness will approach merit.

original: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa la ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa la ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But for arhats who lack ignorance, consciousness does not approach merit.

original: de ltar na 'dir yang ma rig pa'i rkyen @368b can gyis 'du byed yod bzhin du rig pas 'dir 'du byed kyi yan lag tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir yang ma rig pa'i rkyen @368b can gyis 'du byed yod bzhin du rig pas 'dir 'du byed kyi yan lag tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, here too, since formations exist due to ignorance as a condition, they should not be mentioned as a separate link.

original: yang na ma rig pa ni dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa la 'du byed med pas 'du byed smos pa kho nas ma rig pa bshad do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na ma rig pa ni dgra bcom pa ma rig pa med pa la 'du byed med pas 'du byed smos pa kho nas ma rig pa bshad do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, since formations do not exist for arhats who lack ignorance, ignorance is explained by merely mentioning formations.

original: yan lag thams cad la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o ;
translated: This should be stated for all the links.

original: / de ltar na rga shi'i yan lag bstan pa tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de ltar na rga shi'i yan lag bstan pa tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that the link of aging and death would be taught alone.

original: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni mdo mdzad pa'i gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni klan kar mi rung ba kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni mdo mdzad pa'i gzhung lugs so //
translated: This is not a fault at all, according to the system of the Sutra Expounder.

original: mtshang ba bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshang ba bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor is it a fault to teach the meaning of the sutra.

original: 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma ldan pa nyid du mi 'dod kyang /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma ldan pa nyid du mi 'dod kyang /
translated: Although we do not accept that cyclic existence has a beginning or end,

original: 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir la /
translated: here we are speaking of two types of reentry into cyclic existence,

original: de yang de tsam gyis bstan pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de tsam gyis bstan pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: and we are teaching just that much.

original: bsam pa ma gtogs pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa ma gtogs pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The questioner, not understanding this, asks,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten pha rol nas zhes bya bas ni rgyas par bsam pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten pha rol nas zhes bya bas ni rgyas par bsam pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase from another world indicates that the questioner is not clear about the meaning of the sutra.

original: yang tshul gang gis she na /
analyzed: yang tshul gang gis she na /
translated: In what way?

original: 'di ni sngon dang phyi ma thal bar dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon dang phyi ma thal bar dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in the passage beginning “The error of beginninglessness is entailed for you.”

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gis ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa 'jig rten 'di sbrel bar byed la /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag gis ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa 'jig rten 'di sbrel bar byed la /
translated: Ignorance and the karmic forces bind the world to consciousness, etc., up to feeling.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis ni skye ba dang rga shi'i bdag nyid can 'jig rten pha rol sbrel bar byed do //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis ni skye ba dang rga shi'i bdag nyid can 'jig rten pha rol sbrel bar byed do //
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming bind the world to rebirth and aging-death.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu dang rga shi'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten 'di yang ma yin zhing ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu dang rga shi'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten 'di yang ma yin zhing ngo //
translated: Ignorance is not the cause of the world, nor is aging-death the result of the world.🔽Nor is ignorance the cause of aging-death, nor is aging-death the result of ignorance.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la yang ma yin la de gnyis kyi rgyu yang ma yin pas 'dir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la yang ma yin la de gnyis kyi rgyu yang ma yin pas 'dir ma gsungs so //
translated: Since they are not mentioned in the verse, they are not the cause of the world, nor is the world their result.

original: skabs su ma bab par bstan pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs su ma bab par bstan pa'i skyon spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason they are not mentioned is that it would be a fault to teach what is not relevant.

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Both means both dependent origination and the factors of dependent origination.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba ni dus gsum pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba ni dus gsum pa rnams so //
translated: All conditioned factors means those of the three times.

original: da ni ji ltar ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //🔽'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams su bstan bcos las bshad ces slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo // 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams su bstan bcos las bshad ces slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Now, how can the future be said to be non-arisen?

original: bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
translated: The master Samghabhadra says that only the past and present are dependent origination, because the treatise indicates:

original: skyes pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /🔽'das pa dang da ltar @369a * //
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na / 'das pa dang da ltar @369a * //
translated: What are the dharmas that are produced?

original: byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: They are the past and present dharmas.

original: de dang brten pa dang brten pa ma yin pas ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang skye ba'i rigs pa rim gyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang brten pa dang brten pa ma yin pas ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang skye ba'i rigs pa rim gyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasonings for the non-arisen, arisen, and the type that will arise are mutually contradictory.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar ni mi 'gal te de'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar ni mi 'gal te de'i chos nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But it is not contradictory to say that the future is dependent origination, because it is the reality of that.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is like dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyang chos thams cad de zhes khyad par med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams kyang chos thams cad de zhes khyad par med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and dependent origination is all phenomena.🔽The response that the error does not arise because all conditioned phenomena are included in the aggregates and they are past and present is also not a response

original: gang yang 'dir lan du brjod pa phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang de dag kyang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba 'di yang phyed par dka' bas lan ma yin pa
analyzed: gang yang 'dir lan du brjod pa phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang de dag kyang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba 'di yang phyed par dka' bas lan ma yin pa
translated: because it is difficult to understand.

original: nyid de gzhan du na rnam par dpyad par bya dgos par 'gyur te spros pas chog go //
analyzed: nyid de gzhan du na rnam par dpyad par bya dgos par 'gyur te spros pas chog go //
translated: Otherwise, it would have to be analyzed, but enough with the elaboration.

original: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ma byas pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The future is not produced

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs nas byas pas na 'dus byas yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs nas byas pas na 'dus byas yin la /
translated: because it does not have the nature of a cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni byas pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'dus byas su brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni byas pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'dus byas su brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: The future is not produced because it does not have the nature of a cause.🔽The future is not produced because it does not have the nature of a cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And future unarisen things are also called “dependently arisen.”

original: yang de dag ma byas na ji ltar 'dus byas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag ma byas na ji ltar 'dus byas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But if they are not produced, how can they be called “conditioned?”

original: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “because of the activity of volition.”

original: 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur gyur cig snam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bo can 'bras bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i sems pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur gyur cig snam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bo can 'bras bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i sems pas so //
translated: They are called “conditioned” because they are the objects of the volition that produces the effect, the volition that is the nature of the activity of producing such and such an effect.

original: bsam pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ltar 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ltar 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: “Because of the activity of intention” means “because of the activity of the intention to become.”

original: mir 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mir 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention to become this or that, such as “I will become a human being.”

original: mngon par 'du byed pa pas zhes bya ba'i don du zhe na de'i byed pa nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa pas zhes bya ba'i don du zhe na de'i byed pa nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
translated: If one asks what is the meaning of “the activity of volition,” it is the meaning of the teaching of its activity.

original: de lta ma yin na slar brjod pa la sems pas bsam pa'i phyir dang / bka' las 'byung ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas nyid mngon par mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na slar brjod pa la sems pas bsam pa'i phyir dang / bka' las 'byung ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas nyid mngon par mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because of the activity of the intention to become, and because of the statement in the scriptures, future conditioned things would not be clearly taught.

original: byed pa mngon par mi gsal ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'du byed pa rnams mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: byed pa mngon par mi gsal ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'du byed pa rnams mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: because the action is not manifest.

original: de dag ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir dang bsam pa'i phyir @369b 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir dang bsam pa'i phyir @369b 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they are not actualized, they would be the homogeneous and dominant results of those actions, and thus they would be unconditioned.

original: thams cad 'tshogs bcas dang bcas pa'i lus 'dod pa'i yul rnams kyang de la bsams pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad 'tshogs bcas dang bcas pa'i lus 'dod pa'i yul rnams kyang de la bsams pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And if you claim that they are actualized by the desire for the body that is the collection of all the parts, then the objects of desire would be actualized by that desire,

original: de'i phyir yul rnams kyang 'dus byas nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro //🔽srid pa'i gzhi ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul rnams kyang 'dus byas nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro // srid pa'i gzhi ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: and thus it is not contradictory for the objects to be conditioned.🔽The question, “How can uncontaminated states be actualized?”

original: zag pa med pa rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is asked because they are not the foundation of existence and because they are incompatible with engagement.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not actualized because they are not karmic maturation.

original: thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gis zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob par gyur cig snyam du'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gis zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob par gyur cig snyam du'o //
translated: “For the sake of attainment” means “May I attain the uncontaminated states.”

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid du zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: And nirvana would also be a product.

original: de yang dge ba nyid kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pas bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dge ba nyid kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sems pas bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is a virtuous object that is attained by the mind.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas lan smras pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas lan smras pa'o //
translated: Because it is similar to that, means that the response is made in terms of the future being a product and being dependently arisen.

original: 'dus byas dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang ma byung ba rnams la yang 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes de ltar mthun par bsgres pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma byas pa dang ma byung ba rnams la yang 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes de ltar mthun par bsgres pa yin no //
translated: Because it is similar to a product and because it is similar to that which is dependently arisen, the future is called a product and dependently arisen, respectively, even though it is not yet arisen.

original: 'dir 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la ni 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i dngos kyi sgra yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag la ni 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i dngos kyi sgra yin la /
translated: Here, the terms product and dependently arisen are actual terms for the past and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni brtags pa yin no zhes shes par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni brtags pa yin no zhes shes par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is to be understood that the future is to be examined in the same way.

original: 'di nyid la dpe ni dper na re zhig gzugs su mi rung yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe ni dper na re zhig gzugs su mi rung yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The example is given in the following: “For example, even though it is not yet suitable to be form, etc.”

original: gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can 'di de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rgyu mtshan med pa la yang mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'dir yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can 'di de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rgyu mtshan med pa la yang mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'dir yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The term “suitable to be form” indicates that, since it is of the same type as that, it is not contradictory for future form to be without a causal condition. In the same way, it is not contradictory here.

original: de la 'ga' zhig dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa'i phyir 'di lan du mi rigs so snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa'i phyir 'di lan du mi rigs so snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If someone thinks that this is not a proper response because the example and the meaning are not similar, that is not so.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang rab tu grags pas rab tu ma grags pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang rab tu grags pas rab tu ma grags pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because dependent origination is well known, it is not established as not well known.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa gzugs can du ma gyur pa nyid rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes brjod pa de bzhin du ma byas pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyang ma @370a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa gzugs can du ma gyur pa nyid rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs zhes brjod pa de bzhin du ma byas pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyang ma @370a * //
translated: Just as future form that has not yet become form is called form because it is of a similar type, so too that which is not yet created and that which is not yet arisen are called form.🔽

original: 'ongs pa dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams su brjod de /
analyzed: 'ongs pa dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir 'dus byas dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams su brjod de /
translated: Just as future form that has not yet become form is called form because it is of the same type as form, so too that which is not yet produced and that which has not yet arisen are called conditioned and dependently arisen because they are of the same type as that which is conditioned and dependently arisen.

original: de ltar na 'dir rgol ba'i skabs med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir rgol ba'i skabs med do //
translated: Thus there is no opportunity for dispute here.🔽Like a cause and its result and like a father and his son

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag pa dang bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la ji ltar sa bon de nyid rgyu la bltos te /🔽'bras bu yin zhing ;
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag pa dang bu bzhin no zhes bya ba la ji ltar sa bon de nyid rgyu la bltos te / 'bras bu yin zhing ;
translated: Just as a seed is a result in dependence on its cause

original: 'bras bu la bltos na rgyu zhes bya bar brjod pa dang / de nyid bu la bltos nas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu la bltos na rgyu zhes bya bar brjod pa dang / de nyid bu la bltos nas pa yin la /
translated: and is called a cause in dependence on its result,🔽and just as that seed is a father in dependence on its son🔽and is called a son in dependence on its father,

original: pha la bltos nas bur brjod pa de bzhin du yan lag de nyid 'bras bu la bltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: pha la bltos nas bur brjod pa de bzhin du yan lag de nyid 'bras bu la bltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: so too that factor is a dependently arisen result in dependence on its cause

original: rgyu la bltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: rgyu la bltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste ;
translated: and is called a dependently arisen cause in dependence on its result.

original: de ltan rnam par gzhag pa 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: de ltan rnam par gzhag pa 'jig pa med do //
translated: Thus, the system is not destroyed.

original: gnas brtan bsam rdzogs na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /🔽gnas brtan bsam rdzogs kyi bsam pa ni ji ltar rgyu las grub pa de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams yin la /
analyzed: gnas brtan bsam rdzogs na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / gnas brtan bsam rdzogs kyi bsam pa ni ji ltar rgyu las grub pa de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams yin la /
translated: The elder Samghabhadra says:🔽The elder Samghabhadra’s opinion is that dependent origination is that which is established from causes, and that which is a cause for others is dependent origination.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par snang ngo //
translated: This is the way it appears.

original: de ltar bshad na mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams te ma skyes pa'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na mu dang po ni chos ma 'ongs pa rnams te ma skyes pa'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: If this is explained in that way, the first possibility is future dharmas, because they are dependent origination since they are not yet arisen,

original: gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'o //🔽gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma rnams te skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'o // gnyis pa ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma rnams te skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but they are not dependent origination since they are not a cause for others.

original: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa'i tha ma 'das pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa'i tha ma 'das pa'am /
translated: The second possibility is the final moments of an arhat, because they are dependent origination since they are already arisen,

original: da ltar bdag las chos gzhan 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar bdag las chos gzhan 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not dependent origination since they are not a cause for others.🔽In this way, the final moments of an arhat are not a cause for other dharmas,🔽because other dharmas do not arise from the final moments of an arhat that have already passed or that exist now.

original: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma dag las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i tha ma dag las gzhan pa'i chos 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te /
translated: The third is those other than those, that is, those other than the final states of arhats.

original: de dag ni skyes pa'i phyir dang gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gnyis ka ltar yin no //🔽bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes bya ba la de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni skyes pa'i phyir dang gzhan dag gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gnyis ka ltar yin no // bzhi pa ni chos 'dus ma byas rnams so zhes bya ba la de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are both because they are produced and they are the cause of other states.🔽The fourth is unconditioned phenomena.🔽They are neither because they are not produced and they are not a cause.🔽That which is neither is unconditioned phenomena.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyang rgyu med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyang rgyu med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not dependent origination because they are not a cause.

original: de la rgyu'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of a cause are incomplete in them.

original: yang rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are the characteristics of a cause?

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung /
translated: If this exists, that occurs.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye /
translated: Because this is produced, that is produced.

original: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung /
analyzed: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung /
translated: If this does not exist, that does not occur.

original: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ces pa'o //
translated: Because this ceases, that ceases.

original: de la 'dus ma byas yod @370b na dngos po rnams 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas yod @370b na dngos po rnams 'byung mod kyi /
translated: If the unconditioned exists, then things would arise.

original: de ni skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni skye ba ma yin la /
translated: But that is not their arising.

original: de med na de med pa dang / de 'gags pas 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de med na de med pa dang / de 'gags pas 'gag pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: And if it does not exist, then it is not tenable that it ceases due to the cessation of that,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from arising and cessation.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid do //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid do //
translated: The word “only” is not possible.

original: de bzhin 'chad par ci ltar 'os zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin 'chad par ci ltar 'os zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How could it be appropriate to explain it that way?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i ngo bo sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos 'dus byas rnams kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i ngo bo sgrib pa med pa'i ngo bos 'dus byas rnams kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu'o //
translated: Since its nature is permanent, the unconditioned is the active cause of conditioned things by the nature of its nonobstructiveness, which is the nature of its observation.

original: 'du byed kyi skye ba'i rgyun ni ma yin te rgyu'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skye ba'i rgyun ni ma yin te rgyu'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the cause of the continuum of the arising of formations, because the characteristic of a cause is incomplete.

original: zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: This is stated by Master Samghabhadra.

original: de ltar na 'o na mi skye ba'i chos kyi byed rgyu la yang rgyu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas bzhin rnam pa gnyis ka med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mu bzhi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na mi skye ba'i chos kyi byed rgyu la yang rgyu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas bzhin rnam pa gnyis ka med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mu bzhi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, since the cause of a nonarising dharma does not have the nature of a cause, it follows that it is not both, like an unconditioned state.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: ma rig pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang 'du byed rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nas ji srid rga shi dang ma rig pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar nges par 'du byed kyi gnas skabs nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rga shi rten cing 'brel
analyzed: ma rig pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang 'du byed rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nas ji srid rga shi dang ma rig pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar nges par 'du byed kyi gnas skabs nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rga shi rten cing 'brel
translated: From ignorance that is a link in dependent origination and the formations that are a link in dependent origination, up to and including aging and death that are a link in dependent origination, since the state of formations definitely links with the state of ignorance, aging and death are a link in dependent origination.

original: par 'byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: par 'byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes zer ro //
translated: The remaining links are both.

original: gzhan dag na re nges par rga shi'i gnas skabs nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nges par rga shi'i gnas skabs nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Others say: The state of aging and death definitely does not generate the state of affliction.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The remaining links are neither.

original: kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag dang po ni rgyu'i ngo bos 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: kha cig ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag dang po ni rgyu'i ngo bos 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir la /
translated: Some believe that the first member of dependent origination is explained by the nature of its cause,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga ltar yang yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga ltar yang yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: and that the remaining members of dependent origination are both.

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di rnams dang mdo ni 'gal bar mi gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di rnams dang mdo ni 'gal bar mi gzung ste /
translated: These explanations should not be regarded as contradictory to the sūtra,

original: gang gi phyir mdo las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na ma rig pa nas rga shi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na ma rig pa nas rga shi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: because the sūtra states: “What are the dharmas that are dependently arisen? They are ignorance, up to old age and death.”

original: 'di ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnas skabs pa yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ci 'di dag gang zhig gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnas skabs pa yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: What is this? What is it that some assert? It is that which is dependent origination in terms of states, and that which is dependent origination in terms of the causal process.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: There are also dharmas that are dependently arisen, but are not dependent origination.

original: mdo las ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the sūtra, it is said:

original: mdo las ni ma rig pa gang zhes dri ba byas nas phung po lnga'o zhes de skad du ma bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las ni ma rig pa gang zhes dri ba byas nas phung po lnga'o zhes de skad du ma bstan to //
translated: But the sutra does not answer the question, “What is ignorance?” by saying, “The five aggregates.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽gzhan du'o // @371a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / gzhan du'o // @371a * //
translated: What does it say?

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It says, “It is the unknowing of the past and future.”

original: nges pa'i don gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the sutra’s definitive meaning?

original: gang zhig gi don bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rma ba mdzad nas rnam par phye ba de'i don ni de nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas de ni yang drang pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gi don bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi rma ba mdzad nas rnam par phye ba de'i don ni de nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas de ni yang drang pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of a sutra that the Bhagavat himself explained and divided is just that, it is not otherwise.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: lhag ma dang bcas par bstan par 'gyur te dper na las gsum po 'di rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang zhes mdor bstan pas gsum po kho na bstan par byas te /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas par bstan par 'gyur te dper na las gsum po 'di rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang zhes mdor bstan pas gsum po kho na bstan par byas te /
translated: It is taught with remainder, for example, the three karmas are taught by the brief teaching, “They are the cause and origin of suffering.”

original: chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chags pa dang sdang ba dang rmongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: nga rgyal la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyu dang kun tu 'byung ba chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyu dang kun tu 'byung ba chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: Pride, etc., are not because they are not concomitant with attachment, etc., which are the cause and origin of karma.

original: de bzhin du chos gnyis po 'di dag bsgom par bya ste zhes bya bar yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos gnyis po 'di dag bsgom par bya ste zhes bya bar yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: Similarly, these two dharmas should be cultivated means that calm abiding and insight are taught.

original: de bstan pa kun tu rtogs pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pa kun tu rtogs pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the realization of that teaching, etc., is not.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs gang yin pa de gtso bor bstan pas ji skad bshad pa kho na bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs gang yin pa de gtso bor bstan pas ji skad bshad pa kho na bstan te /
translated: Similarly, here also, since whatever state is primary is taught, only what has been explained is taught.

original: bya ba 'gal ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: bya ba 'gal ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the performance of actions.

original: ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'du byed kyi rkyen du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'du byed kyi rkyen du mi 'dod de /
translated: Apart from ignorance, no other is accepted as a condition of the formative forces.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mdo gzhan du ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams nyid du 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen du bzhed do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan du ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams nyid du 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen du bzhed do zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: In another sutra, ignorance, etc., are accepted as the condition of the formative forces, etc.

original: ji ltar gzhan las bshad pa'i mdo gnyis po de la yang las kyi rgyu dang kun 'byung ba gzhan du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan las bshad pa'i mdo gnyis po de la yang las kyi rgyu dang kun 'byung ba gzhan du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Also, the two sutras explained by others should be cultivated as the cause and origin of karma in another way.

original: gang kho na bstan pa de kho na bstan par 'dod kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so ;
analyzed: gang kho na bstan pa de kho na bstan par 'dod kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so ;
translated: One should understand that the teaching is just the teaching of that, not something else.

original: / de bzhin du 'dir yang 'di shes byed ma yin te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'dir yang 'di shes byed ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, here also, this is not the means of knowledge.

original: mdo gnyis ni bye brag tu smra ba'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gnyis ni bye brag tu smra ba'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The two sutras contradict the meaning of the Vaibhasikas.

original: bstan pa'i sgo nas thams cad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan pa'i sgo nas thams cad ces bya ba la /
translated: Everything is taught in the sutras.

original: bstan pa ni rnam par phye ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni rnam par phye ba'o //
translated: Teaching is analysis.

original: gtso bo ji lta bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo ji lta bar ston pa ste /
translated: It is teaching in accordance with the principal meaning.

original: rnam par dbye bar yang mdzad pas bstan pa ni nges pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar yang mdzad pas bstan pa ni nges pa'i don du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is also analyzed, the teaching is not definitive.

original: de nyid la dpe ni dper na glang po che'i rjes lta bu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni dper na glang po che'i rjes lta bu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The example for that is, for example, from the elephant’s footprint, etc.

original: de dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: They are not, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa de dag la ni sa'i khams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa de dag la ni sa'i khams 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only the earth element exists in sound, etc.

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa tha mi dad par @371b 'jug pa gzhan dag kyang yang de /
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro la sogs pa 'byung ba las gyur pa tha mi dad par @371b 'jug pa gzhan dag kyang yang de /
translated: Other primary and secondary elements, such as form, smell, taste, etc., also exist in sound, etc., but they are not distinguished.

original: de la 'jug pa shas che bas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir skra la sogs pa dag gis sa'i khams bstan to /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa shas che bas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir skra la sogs pa dag gis sa'i khams bstan to /
translated: Since the earth element is predominant in hair, etc., the earth element is taught by hair, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, here also, etc.

original: bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga po'i gnas skabs dag tu yang gtso bo gang yin ba de bstan to //🔽de ltar na gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan dag yod kyang /
analyzed: bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga po'i gnas skabs dag tu yang gtso bo gang yin ba de bstan to // de ltar na gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos gzhan dag yod kyang /
translated: The predominant factor is taught in the context of the twelvefold five aggregates.

original: ma rig pa gtso bor gyur ba'i gnas skabs su ma rig pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa gtso bor gyur ba'i gnas skabs su ma rig pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, although other phenomena such as form and feeling exist, ignorance is taught in the context of ignorance being predominant.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of formations, etc.

original: 'di ni dpe ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni dpe ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is not an example, etc.

original: dpe ma yin pa ni dpe dang don mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ma yin pa ni dpe dang don mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The example is not similar to the meaning.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the example is not similar to the meaning, he says:

original: glang po che'i rjes lta bu'i mdo de las ni /
analyzed: glang po che'i rjes lta bu'i mdo de las ni /
translated: In that sutra, the example of the elephant,

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas gang gis na skra la sogs pa de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ba skra la sogs pa dag gang zhe na sa'i khams so zhes de skad ma brjod kyi /🔽'on kyang de las sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas gang gis na skra la sogs pa de dag ma rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ba skra la sogs pa dag gang zhe na sa'i khams so zhes de skad ma brjod kyi / 'on kyang de las sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: it is not said that the earth element is only hair and so on, since other things such as form also exist there.

original: skra dang sbu zhes rgyas par skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams bstan to //
analyzed: skra dang sbu zhes rgyas par skra la sogs pa dag kho nas sa'i khams bstan to //
translated: Rather, it is said that the earth element is hair and so on, since the earth element is taught by hair and so on alone.🔽If the five aggregates were not included in the beginningless and endless end, then the five aggregates could be taught in the present.

original: gal te sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dag la mi gtogs pa phung po lnga'i gnas skabs la bstan par nus pa dang / gal te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs lam rig pa med mod kyang /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dag la mi gtogs pa phung po lnga'i gnas skabs la bstan par nus pa dang / gal te phung po lnga'i gnas skabs lam rig pa med mod kyang /
translated: If the present state of the five aggregates is not known, then the present state of the five aggregates is not known.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that form and so on exist,

original: de'i phyir rigs tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: then why does the root text say, “because there is no difference in type”?

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni ma rig pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni ma rig pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that form, feeling, and so on are ignorance.

original: shes byed kyi dngos po rtog pas mdo mdzad pas rig pa ma brjod pas de nyid 'dir smos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes byed kyi dngos po rtog pas mdo mdzad pas rig pa ma brjod pas de nyid 'dir smos par shes par bya'o //
translated: The root text does not mention the term “ignorance” because the author of the sutra condenses the term to its abbreviated form.

original: skra la sogs pa chos du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid de rnams dang chos du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyis sa la sogs pa'i khams nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzhan bsal nas de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: skra la sogs pa chos du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid de rnams dang chos du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyis sa la sogs pa'i khams nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gzhan bsal nas de nyid bstan to //
translated: The earth element and so on are taught to be the collection of many dharmas, such as hair and so on, and the collection of many dharmas, such as the earth element and so on. The earth element and so on are taught because they are the most important.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po lnga po rnams kyi gnas skabs gang du gang zhig gtso bor gyur pa de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po lnga po rnams kyi gnas skabs gang du gang zhig gtso bor gyur pa de nyid bstan te /
translated: In the same way, in this context, the most important of the five aggregates is taught in a particular situation.

original: de ltar na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: yang de dag der gtso bo yin na gnas skabs phyi ma'i rgyu nyid ji ltar zhe na /🔽gal te de lta yang 'gal ba'i shes byed nye bar @372a * //
analyzed: yang de dag der gtso bo yin na gnas skabs phyi ma'i rgyu nyid ji ltar zhe na / gal te de lta yang 'gal ba'i shes byed nye bar @372a * //
translated: If they are primary in that state, how can they be the cause of the subsequent state?

original: bkod pa don med do //
analyzed: bkod pa don med do //
translated: Even if that is so, it is pointless to adduce a contradictory cognition.

original: 'dir de dag gi gnas skabs la bsams nas gnas skabs gzhan la bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir de dag gi gnas skabs la bsams nas gnas skabs gzhan la bstan te /
translated: Here, they are taught in a subsequent state, thinking of their state in the past.

original: dper na skra la sogs pa rnams kyis sa'i khams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skra la sogs pa rnams kyis sa'i khams bzhin no //
translated: For example, the earth element is taught by the hairs, etc.

original: gnas skabs de sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la sogs pa rnams su yod kyang ma bstan no ;
analyzed: gnas skabs de sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la sogs pa rnams su yod kyang ma bstan no ;
translated: Even though it exists in the past and future, etc., it is not taught.

original: / ji ltar skra la sogs pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: / ji ltar skra la sogs pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba lta bu ste /
translated: Just as form, etc. is apprehended by the hairs, etc.,

original: rdzas dang btags par yod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang btags par yod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference between substantial and nominal existence.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs ma smos par gzugs la dang tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gnas skabs ma smos par gzugs la dang tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: In the same way, here also, form, etc. is apprehended by feeling, etc., without mentioning the state,

original: rdzas dang btags par yod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang btags par yod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the difference between substantial and nominal existence.

original: de'i phyir rnam par mi g-yeng ba tsam nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi g-yeng ba tsam nyid brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is merely non-distraction that is expressed.

original: gang zhig 'dir mi rigs pa de yang don gyi sgo nas bkag go zhes bya ste dngos su bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir mi rigs pa de yang don gyi sgo nas bkag go zhes bya ste dngos su bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: And if something is not reasonable here, it is refuted by the meaning, not by the explicit statement.

original: gang zhig yod dam med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yod dam med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If ignorance exists or does not exist, then formations exist or do not exist.

original: ma rig pa nyid yod dam med na 'du byed rnams yod pa dang med par nges kyi phung po gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de nyid yan lag yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid yod dam med na 'du byed rnams yod pa dang med par nges kyi phung po gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de nyid yan lag yin no //
translated: Ignorance itself is a link because formations exist or do not exist depending on whether ignorance exists or does not exist, but the other aggregates are not.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of formations and so on.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga yod kyang ma rig pa dang bcas pa rnams kho na la 'du byed yod kyi ma rig pa med pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga yod kyang ma rig pa dang bcas pa rnams kho na la 'du byed yod kyi ma rig pa med pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, although the five aggregates exist, formations exist only for those with ignorance, not for those without ignorance.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa rnams la phung po lnga yod kyang /
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa rnams la phung po lnga yod kyang /
translated: For example, although the five aggregates exist for arhats,

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
translated: the consciousness that goes to merit, demerit, or stable states does not exist.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no consciousness that links.

original: skye bar nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skye bar nye bar 'gro bas na nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Approaching birth is approaching.

original: bsod nams kyis ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Approaching through merit is approaching through merit.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa nye bar 'gro ba dang // mi g-yo bar 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa nye bar 'gro ba dang // mi g-yo bar 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Approaching through non-merit and approaching through the immovable should be seen in the same way.

original: sred pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la //
translated: Also craving, etc.
