original: ma rig pa med pa rnams la phung po lnga yod kyang tshor ba nyon mongs pa can med pas sred pa med la /
analyzed: ma rig pa med pa rnams la phung po lnga yod kyang tshor ba nyon mongs pa can med pas sred pa med la /
translated: For those without ignorance, even though the five aggregates exist, there is no craving because there is no afflicted feeling.

original: de med pas len pa la sogs pa rnams kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pas len pa la sogs pa rnams kyang med do //
translated: And because that does not exist, there is also no grasping, etc.

original: mdo'i don ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo'i don ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is exactly as it is taught.

original: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is not knowing the prior limit.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: ma rig pa la ltos nas phung po lnga po 'du byed rnams @372b kyi rgyur 'dod de /
analyzed: ma rig pa la ltos nas phung po lnga po 'du byed rnams @372b kyi rgyur 'dod de /
translated: The five aggregates are asserted to be the cause of karmic formation in dependence on ignorance.

original: de na ma rig pa med pa rnams la yod pa'i phung po lnga las 'du byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na ma rig pa med pa rnams la yod pa'i phung po lnga las 'du byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Karmic formation does not occur from the five aggregates that exist for those who are not ignorant.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te ma rig pa ldan pa ni de skya ba la nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te ma rig pa ldan pa ni de skya ba la nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the presence of ignorance is seen to have the power to produce them.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: mdo'i don ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo'i don ji skad bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is exactly as it is taught.

original: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: What is ignorance? It is the non-understanding of the prior limit and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don no //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is exactly as it is taught.

original: 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don te /
analyzed: 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don te /
translated: What is karmic formation? It is the prior limit and so on. The meaning of the sutra is exactly as it is taught.

original: de bzhin du yan lag thams cad la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag thams cad la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for all the other limbs.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don yin pa de'i phyir phung po gzhan dag yod kyang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa kho na mdo'i don yin pa de'i phyir phung po gzhan dag yod kyang 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Because the meaning of the sutra is exactly as we have explained it, therefore, even though other aggregates exist, they are not conditions of formations, etc.

original: de la yang chos ma 'ongs pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yang chos ma 'ongs pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, with regard to that, it continues:

original: chos ma 'ongs pa rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ma 'ongs pa rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: “Future factors are dependently arisen, but not presently arisen.”

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de lta na ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de lta na ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
translated: If you say this, then you contradict the sutra.

original: gzhan dag na re mdo dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that there is no contradiction with the sutra.

original: 'dus byas nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that they are conditioned.

original: de lta na 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir yan lag rnams cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir yan lag rnams cha gsum du dgod pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the presentation of the members as three time periods is undermined, because the past and future do not exist.

original: 'phags pas ston pa la sogs pa'i sde pa gzhan dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pas ston pa la sogs pa'i sde pa gzhan dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dus ma byas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Āryas, the Saṃmitīyas, etc., say that dependent origination is unconditioned.

original: de dag de ltar rtogs pa ga las she na /
analyzed: de dag de ltar rtogs pa ga las she na /
translated: How do they understand it in this way?

original: sangs rgyas kyis mdo las dge slong dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni bdag gis ma byas so ;🔽/ gzhan gyis kyang ma byas te 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis mdo las dge slong dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni bdag gis ma byas so ; / gzhan gyis kyang ma byas te 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: The Buddha said in a sūtra: “Monks, dependent origination is not made by itself,

original: ma byung yang rung chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung yang rung chos nyid 'di ni gnas pa kho na'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nor by others, but even though the tathāgatas arise or do not arise, this nature of things remains, this principle of phenomena remains, this fixed sequence of phenomena remains, this regularity of phenomena remains, this nondeceptive nature of phenomena remains.🔽”

original: dngos po gzhan rtag pa cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams las so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ltar rtogs pa zhig yod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtag pa cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams las so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ltar rtogs pa zhig yod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, they say that there is a real entity that is permanent, a little something that is other, just as nonanalytical cessation is understood to be other than ignorance, etc.

original: 'byung ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The following is stated: “These three are the characteristics of the conditioned. The conditioned is clearly seen to arise. . . . ”

original: dngos po gzhan rtag @373a * //🔽pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtag @373a * // pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: A permanent thing that is different from the conditioned is not a characteristic of the conditioned.

original: gang zhig gang med par mi 'byung ba de ni de'i mtshan nyid yin la 'byung ba ni rtag pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang dngos po snga nas med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa yin pa de dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par mi 'byung ba de ni de'i mtshan nyid yin la 'byung ba ni rtag pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang dngos po snga nas med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa yin pa de dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mi
translated: That which does not occur without something else is a characteristic of that thing. Arising is permanent, and nonexistence is not a characteristic of a thing, because it exists in the state of the nonexistence of a thing that did not exist previously and that exists after having been destroyed.

original: rung ngo // yang na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du dus su ma gtogs pa'i phyir na dus su gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: rung ngo // yang na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du dus su ma gtogs pa'i phyir na dus su gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Or, like space, etc., it is not a characteristic of that which is included in time, because it is not included in time.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa lta bu ste /
translated: Or, like something that exists in another form, it is not a characteristic of the conditioned, because it is not a characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir skye ba ni 'dus ma byas nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir skye ba ni 'dus ma byas nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Because it is the characteristic of conditioned states, it is not tenable that arising is unconditioned.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Origination” is arising.

original: de ni mdo sde pa'i tshul du ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: de ni mdo sde pa'i tshul du ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: This is the characteristic of that which did not exist previously coming to exist, according to the Sautrāntika system.

original: de la ni ji ltar 'gro ba po dang 'bras chan dang tshos pa ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang / byed pa po dang / bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni ji ltar 'gro ba po dang 'bras chan dang tshos pa ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang / byed pa po dang / bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, ignorance and so on are related to the agent and action, just as a goer and cooked rice are related.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa la sogs pa dag gi 'byung ba zhes 'brel par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa la sogs pa dag gi 'byung ba zhes 'brel par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if the origination of ignorance and so on is related in this way,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtag pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: then the sūtra would not state the following in terms of the permanence of dependent origination:

original: 'di ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang ci zhig 'brel zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang ci zhig 'brel zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod de /
translated: “What is the relationship of this ignorance and so on?”

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no relationship characterized by action and agent.

original: yang na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, since arising is called origination,

original: gang las de dag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las de dag gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur ba /
translated: from what would the dependent origination of these originate?

original: khyed cag gis yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba dus sum gtogs pa 'di ma rig pa la sogs ba dus su gtogs pa dag dang ci zhig 'brel /
analyzed: khyed cag gis yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba dus sum gtogs pa 'di ma rig pa la sogs ba dus su gtogs pa dag dang ci zhig 'brel /
translated: What connection could the arising you imagine, which is not included among the three times, have with ignorance, etc., which are included among the three times?

original: rtag pa zhes kyang bya la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes kyang bya la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term “permanent” is also used, etc.🔽The term “dependent origination” is used for that which originates in dependence on conditions.

original: rkyen dang phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni sgra bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni sgra bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the etymological explanation.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi don nus pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi don nus pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the term would be meaningless,

original: ji ltar na rkyen dang phrad de 'byung ba yang yin la rtag pa yang yin ;
analyzed: ji ltar na rkyen dang phrad de 'byung ba yang yin la rtag pa yang yin ;
translated: because how could something originate in dependence on conditions and also be permanent?

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa zhes kyang bya la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba smos te 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa zhes kyang bya la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba smos te 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The term ‘permanent’ is also used, etc.,” but this is contradictory.

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa'am /
translated: Moreover, do ignorance and so on arise from themselves or from something else?

original: de dag la brten nas yin grang na rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas yin grang na rnam pa thams cad du mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that ignorance and so on are different from the aggregates, or not different from the aggregates,🔽or that they are dependent on the aggregates.

original: @373b rang gi ngo bo nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dang / du ma nyid du mi rtag pa nyid kyis nye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @373b rang gi ngo bo nges par ma zin pa'i phyir dang / du ma nyid du mi rtag pa nyid kyis nye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their nature is not ascertained, and because they are seen to be multiple and impermanent.

original: mdo'i don sgra ji bzhin du brtag na ni /🔽dge slong dag ngas lam rnying pa shul rnying pa /🔽gshegs shul rnying pa /
analyzed: mdo'i don sgra ji bzhin du brtag na ni / dge slong dag ngas lam rnying pa shul rnying pa / gshegs shul rnying pa /
translated: If you interpret the meaning of the sutra literally,🔽then it would follow that the path is unconditioned,

original: sngon gyi drang srong dag gis gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa thugs su chud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir lam yang 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngon gyi drang srong dag gis gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa thugs su chud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir lam yang 'dus ma byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: because it is said, “Monks, I have realized the ancient path, the ancient route, the ancient trail, the ancient path of the sages that has been followed by the noble ones of the past.”

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa lam rnams ni 'dus ma byas nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa lam rnams ni 'dus ma byas nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not tenable that the path, such as right view and so on, is unconditioned.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i lam gzhan yang med do //
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i lam gzhan yang med do //
translated: And there is no path other than those.

original: rten cing 'brel pa ni phrad pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa ni phrad pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pratītya means “having met”

original: ain 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i byings kyis nye bar bsgyur ba ni phrad pa zhes bya ba'i don can no //🔽nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: ain 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i byings kyis nye bar bsgyur ba ni phrad pa zhes bya ba'i don can no // nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la //
translated: The verbal root iṇ means “to go.” The prefix prati means “having met.”🔽The meaning of the verbal root is changed by the prefix.

original: ai na'i skad kyis byings 'gro ba'i don yin yang 'gro ba'i don khyad du bsad nas da ltar byung ba'i don yongs su gzung bas skad kyi byings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ai na'i skad kyis byings 'gro ba'i don yin yang 'gro ba'i don khyad du bsad nas da ltar byung ba'i don yongs su gzung bas skad kyi byings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba yin te /
translated: The verbal root iṇ means “to go,” but the meaning of “going” is ignored and the meaning of “having met” is accepted.

original: de'i phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de'i phrad nas zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of “having met” is the meaning of “having depended” and “having relied.”

original: re zhig 'di ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni rten cing 'brel te zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the term pratītyasamutpāda.

original: da ni 'byung ba'i don bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'byung ba'i don bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of utpāda,

original: ba da ni yod pa'i don to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ba da ni yod pa'i don to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “ut means existence.”

original: pa da yod pa la'o zhes bya ba pa da'i byings ni yod pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: pa da yod pa la'o zhes bya ba pa da'i byings ni yod pa'i don yin no //
translated: The root pad means “to exist.”

original: sam dang auta gong na yod na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sam dang auta gong na yod na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is above sam or ut,

original: sam gong na yod pa dang auta gong na yod pa'i pa da ni 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: sam gong na yod pa dang auta gong na yod pa'i pa da ni 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: then pad means “to arise,”

original: nye bar bsgyur pa'i dbang gis skad kyi byings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur pa'i dbang gis skad kyi byings kyi don yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the verbal root is transformed by the influence of the prefix.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba ni rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba ni rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, “arising” is taught to mean “coming into existence.”

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What reason?

original: rkyen dang phrad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: “Having met with conditions,” as the text says.

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The elder Saṃghabhadra says:

original: byings dang nye bar bsgyur ba dag yod pa'i don du yongs su rtogs pa las ni /
analyzed: byings dang nye bar bsgyur ba dag yod pa'i don du yongs su rtogs pa las ni /
translated: The verbal root and the prefix are understood to mean “to exist.”

original: yod pa'i don gyis ci thob par byed ce na /
analyzed: yod pa'i don gyis ci thob par byed ce na /
translated: What is gained by the meaning “to exist”?

original: de ni nam yang yod pa ma yin zhing skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni nam yang yod pa ma yin zhing skye ba ma yin no //
translated: It never exists and is not produced.

original: ma yin yang 'ga' zhig 'byung ba dag ni yod pa las ches gzhan pas don ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin yang 'ga' zhig 'byung ba dag ni yod pa las ches gzhan pas don ma yin no //
translated: But some say: The elements are not different from their function.

original: skye ba'i sgras ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid @374a * //🔽thab par brjod la /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgras ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid @374a * // thab par brjod la /
translated: The word “arisen” means to exist, not to have existed previously.

original: yod pa'i sgras ni yod pa nyid tsam mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgras ni yod pa nyid tsam mo zhes zer ro //
translated: The word “exists” means to exist.

original: ci ltar khams dang nye bar bsgyur ba dag don khyad par med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar khams dang nye bar bsgyur ba dag don khyad par med par 'gyur /
translated: How can the elements and the secondary matter be undifferentiated?

original: byed pa po gcig gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase “by a single agent,”

original: gcig smos pa ni dper na lhas byin khrus byas nas mchod sbyin za'o zhes bya ba lta bu byed pa po tha dad pa dag gi dus snga ma la ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig smos pa ni dper na lhas byin khrus byas nas mchod sbyin za'o zhes bya ba lta bu byed pa po tha dad pa dag gi dus snga ma la ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the word “single” is used to indicate that the suffix ktvā is not used in the sense of a prior time when there is a difference of agent, as in the sentence “Devadatta, having bathed, eats.”

original: dus snga ma la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus snga ma la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the phrase “in the prior time,”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: dper na 'tshed do 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / de bzhin du khrus byas te /
analyzed: dper na 'tshed do 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / de bzhin du khrus byas te /
translated: For example, in the sentence “He cooks and goes,” and similarly, “Having bathed, he eats.”

original: bza'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir zos te khrus bya'o zhes bya bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ltar dus mtshungs pa'i bya ba dag dang phyi ma'i dus la ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: bza'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir zos te khrus bya'o zhes bya bar nam yang mi 'gyur ba ltar dus mtshungs pa'i bya ba dag dang phyi ma'i dus la ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: “It is eaten” is never “having eaten, he washes.”

original: 'dir ni 'byung ba'i snga rol na 'byung ba po med pas phrad pa dang 'byung ba dag byed pa po mtshungs pa mi srid pas ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'byung ba'i snga rol na 'byung ba po med pas phrad pa dang 'byung ba dag byed pa po mtshungs pa mi srid pas ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But here, since the agent of arising does not exist prior to the arising, it is impossible for the arising and the meeting to have the same agent. Therefore, it is untenable that the suffix -tvā is used to indicate the agent.

original: de'i phyir rkyen dang phrad nas 'byung bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen dang phrad nas 'byung bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'di mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, this meaning of the term dependent arising—that is, “arising due to meeting conditions”—is untenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sngar phrad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sngar phrad nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “If it is said that it arises having met,” and so on.

original: de ltar na re zhig byed pa po mtshungs pa nyid mi srid pas ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig byed pa po mtshungs pa nyid mi srid pas ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, since it is impossible for the arising and the meeting to have the same agent, it is untenable that the suffix -tvā is used to indicate the agent.

original: da ni dus snga ma'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni dus snga ma'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ktva'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: The same applies to sleeping with the mouth open.🔽One opens the mouth first and then sleeps.

original: ci ste kha gdangs par byed la phyis nyal lo zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste kha gdangs par byed la phyis nyal lo zhe na /
translated: One does not sleep first and then open the mouth.🔽But if one opens the mouth first and then sleeps,

original: gal te de lta na btsums pa la yang ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gal te de lta na btsums pa la yang ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: why does one not open the eyes as well?

original: gang gi tshe sngar gdangs nas phyis btsums te gnyid log pa de'i tshe kha gdangs nas nyal zhes ci ste ma brjod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngar gdangs nas phyis btsums te gnyid log pa de'i tshe kha gdangs nas nyal zhes ci ste ma brjod /
translated: When one opens the eyes first and then closes them and goes to sleep, why is it not said that one sleeps with the eyes open?

original: de'i phyir nyal ba dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i kha gdangs pa mngon par 'dod pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyal ba dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i kha gdangs pa mngon par 'dod pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the opening of the mouth is desired in conjunction with sleep.

original: dbyu gu khrol zer te ltung ngo zhes phyis kyi dus la yang ktva'i rkyen dmigs so //
analyzed: dbyu gu khrol zer te ltung ngo zhes phyis kyi dus la yang ktva'i rkyen dmigs so //
translated: The word “falling” is seen in the future tense in the expression “the stick will fall.”

original: cur khrol zer te phyis lhung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cur khrol zer te phyis lhung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The word “falling” is not seen in the past tense in the expression “the stick fell.”

original: sgra ni mngon par brdabs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni mngon par brdabs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sound is produced by the cause of striking.

original: byed pa po tha dad pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: byed pa po tha dad pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen that the agent is different.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: For example,

original: rgyal mtshan mthong bas shing rta dang mun pa zas kha dog bzang po 'bar ba bzhin dang dung gi sgra thos pa las g-yo ba dang rnga bo che brdungs pa las rjes su brtse ba bzhin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan mthong bas shing rta dang mun pa zas kha dog bzang po 'bar ba bzhin dang dung gi sgra thos pa las g-yo ba dang rnga bo che brdungs pa las rjes su brtse ba bzhin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is said, “By seeing the banner, the chariot moves. By eating darkness, the color becomes beautiful. By hearing the sound of the conch, it moves. By striking the drum, it is loved.”

original: de'i phyir byed pa po mtshungs pa'i dus snga ma la zhes bya ba 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po mtshungs pa'i dus snga ma la zhes bya ba 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement “at the same time as the agent” is not definite.

original: btsun pa pi linda'i bu na re /
analyzed: btsun pa pi linda'i bu na re /
translated: Bhadanta Pṛthivībandhu says:

original: med pa dang yod pa ma bzung bar sgra 'jug pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa dang yod pa ma bzung bar sgra 'jug pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that the word exists without taking the nonexistent and the existent.

original: yod pa tha snyad kyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa tha snyad kyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
translated: Because existence is a part of convention.

original: des na ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs la yang 'di las gang du de yod de dper na myu gu skye ba dang shing rta skye ba bzhin no zhes zer te 'di ni klan ka ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs la yang 'di las gang du de yod de dper na myu gu skye ba dang shing rta skye ba bzhin no zhes zer te 'di ni klan ka ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even in the future state, where would it exist? For example, like the arising of a sprout and the arising of a chariot. This is not a fault.🔽Others say:

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal lan no //🔽rten cing @376a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal lan no // rten cing @376a * //
translated: The master Śrīlāta.

original: 'brel pa ni bzlos pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /🔽bzlos pa ni khyab par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bzlos pa'i don to zhes bya ba la / bzlos pa ni khyab par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Dependent origination has the meaning of repetition.🔽Repetition is asserted to be pervasion.

original: sna tshogs la khyab par 'dod pa ni bzlos pa'i 'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs la khyab par 'dod pa ni bzlos pa'i 'o //
translated: The assertion of pervasion of variety is repetition.

original: rten brjod pa sna tshogs pa thams cad la bya ba dang yon tan dag gis cig car khyab par 'dod pa ni bzlos pa ste ;
analyzed: rten brjod pa sna tshogs pa thams cad la bya ba dang yon tan dag gis cig car khyab par 'dod pa ni bzlos pa ste ;
translated: The assertion of simultaneous pervasion of all the various expressions of dependence by actions and qualities is repetition.

original: dper na 'dis grong re re la skud pa byin no zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na 'dis grong re re la skud pa byin no zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “He gave thread to each village.”

original: grong re re zhing nyams dga'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽ai ti ni 'gro bar rung ste zhes bya ba ni chas par ro //
analyzed: grong re re zhing nyams dga'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o // ai ti ni 'gro bar rung ste zhes bya ba ni chas par ro //
translated: For example, Each village is delightful.🔽 Iti means it is suitable to go, that is, it is suitable to depart.

original: ai ti ni 'gro ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi sdod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ai ti ni 'gro ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi sdod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: To indicate that iti means going, it says not remaining, that is, disintegrating.

original: aud gong na yod pa'i pa da ni 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: aud gong na yod pa'i pa da ni 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pada, which has ud above it, means arising.

original: skad kyi byings 'gro ba'i don yin yang /
analyzed: skad kyi byings 'gro ba'i don yin yang /
translated: Although the verbal root means going,

original: nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i don du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur ba'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i don du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: by the influence of the prefix it also means arising.

original: tshogs pa de dang de na 'gro bar rung ba zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel pa bzlos pa'i don nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa de dang de na 'gro bar rung ba zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel pa bzlos pa'i don nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: By saying suitable to go in that and that assemblage, it clarifies that the meaning of pratītya is repetition.

original: 'dus nas skye ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus nas skye ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for arising in dependence,

original: gcig pu skye ba ni 'ga' yang med de lhan cig skye bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pu skye ba ni 'ga' yang med de lhan cig skye bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no arising of anything alone, because it is certain that it arises together.

original: re zhig gzugs can ni 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: re zhig gzugs can ni 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: First, the form aggregate is the eight substances, etc.,

original: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: as in the statement, “In the desire realm, the subtle atom is without faculties and without sound and is composed of eight substances.”

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni /
translated: The formless aggregate is

original: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: mind and mental factors, which are necessarily concomitant, and all conditioned characteristics, which arise simultaneously.

original: rtogs pa 'di ni kho na la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di ni kho na la zhes bya ba la /
translated: This interpretation is only for you.

original: rten cing 'brel par bzlos pa'i don du mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / 'dus nas skye pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dir ni brtag par rung na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par bzlos pa'i don du mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / 'dus nas skye pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dir ni brtag par rung na /
translated: Since the meaning of dependent origination is not contradictory to the meaning of dependent designation and since arising from a collection is not contradictory to dependent origination, it is suitable to analyze dependent origination here.

original: 'di la ni rtogs pa 'di ji ltar btub ste /🔽mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rtogs pa 'di ji ltar btub ste / mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
translated: But how can this interpretation be suitable here?

original: zhes rten cing 'brel par bzlos pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'dus te skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes rten cing 'brel par bzlos pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'dus te skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to dependently designate the statement “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form” and because it is impossible for it to arise from a collection.

original: 'di la ni mig dang gzugs phrad nas zhes bya bar rtogs kyi bzlos pa'i don ni ma yin no //🔽'gro bar rung ba rnams 'dus nas skye'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni mig dang gzugs phrad nas zhes bya bar rtogs kyi bzlos pa'i don ni ma yin no // 'gro bar rung ba rnams 'dus nas skye'o //
translated: Here, the meaning is understood as “having contacted eye and form,” not as a repetition.

original: zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not understood as “having come together, they are born.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is the eye consciousness itself.

original: de'i phyir de'i gnas skabs kho na la rgol ba @376b yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnas skabs kho na la rgol ba @376b yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent is only arguing about that state.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba skye ba'i snga rol tu yod pa nyid la rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba skye ba'i snga rol tu yod pa nyid la rung ste /
translated: It is suitable to say that “another” exists prior to birth.

original: gal te lhan cig ktva'i rkyen ma grub pa de snga ma'i dus la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig ktva'i rkyen ma grub pa de snga ma'i dus la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the condition of simultaneity is not established, it is established in the prior state.

original: nges par gzung ba'i don te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i don te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “definite” is

original: gang yang rung ba zhig brjod na ni nges par ma gzung bar 'gyur la /🔽nges par ma gzung na yang 'du byed la sogs pa rnams /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig brjod na ni nges par ma gzung bar 'gyur la / nges par ma gzung na yang 'du byed la sogs pa rnams /
translated: if any one is stated, it would not be definite.🔽If it is not definite, it would not refute that formations and so on

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen can nyid yin pa ma bkag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen can nyid yin pa ma bkag par 'gyur te /
translated: are conditions of ignorance and so on that are other.

original: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na mig yod na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, when it is said, “If the eye exists, the eye consciousness arises,”

original: zhes nges par ma gzung bas gzugs yod na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes nges par ma gzung bas gzugs yod na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: it is understood that “if form exists, it arises,” because the meaning is not ascertained.

original: de'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i don du /🔽gang yod na gang 'byung ba de nyid skyes pas de skye'i gzhan skyes pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par gzung ba'i don du / gang yod na gang 'byung ba de nyid skyes pas de skye'i gzhan skyes pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, in order to ascertain the meaning,🔽it is said that the two modes are: if something exists, then that which arises arises due to the arising of that, not due to the arising of something else.

original: gang skyes pas gang skye ba de nyid yod na de 'byung gi gzhan yod na yang ni ma yin no zhes rnam grangs gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gang skyes pas gang skye ba de nyid yod na de 'byung gi gzhan yod na yang ni ma yin no zhes rnam grangs gnyis brjod do //
translated: And if something arises, then that which arises occurs due to the arising of that, not due to the existence of something else.

original: mdo gzhan gyis rnam grangs gnyis nges par gzung ba'i don nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dper na gzhan las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan gyis rnam grangs gnyis nges par gzung ba'i don nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dper na gzhan las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning of the two modes is ascertained by another sutra, he says, “For example, it is said in another sutra:

original: ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If ignorance exists, then this occurs.

original: de ltar bshad na ma rig pa skyes pas 'du byed rnams skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na ma rig pa skyes pas 'du byed rnams skye'o //
translated: If ignorance arises, then formations arise.

original: ma rig pa kho na yod na de dag 'byung gi gzhan yod na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa kho na yod na de dag 'byung gi gzhan yod na yang ma yin no //
translated: If only ignorance exists, then they occur, not if something else exists.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other members.

original: yang na yan lag 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang na yan lag 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Or else, if this member exists, that member arises, etc.

original: ma rig pa yod na 'du byed dag 'byung la /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod na 'du byed dag 'byung la /
translated: If ignorance exists, the formative forces arise.

original: 'du byed dag skyes pas yang rnam par shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dag skyes pas yang rnam par shes pa skye'o //
translated: And because the formative forces are produced, consciousness is produced.

original: zhes de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis brgyud par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis brgyud par bstan to //
translated: In this way, the twelve members are taught as a continuum.

original: yang na sngon gyi mtha' yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sngon gyi mtha' yod na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Or else, if the prior limit exists, etc.

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi mtha' 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba gsungs la /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi mtha' 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba gsungs la /
translated: In order to teach that the present limit arises from the prior limit, it is said: “If this exists, that arises.”

original: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'di skyes pas 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach that the future limit arises from the present limit, it is said: “Because this is produced, that is produced.”

original: yang na res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Or else, sometimes, etc.

original: de la re zhig dngos su bstan na gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su 'du byed nyon mongs pa can skye ba na'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos su bstan na gang gi tshe ma rig pa'i mjug thogs su 'du byed nyon mongs pa can skye ba na'o //
translated: The indirect cause is the cause that is not the direct antecedent condition of the effect.

original: brgyud pas ni gang gi tshe bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba skye ba na ste /
analyzed: brgyud pas ni gang gi tshe bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba skye ba na ste /
translated: For example, merit and the unmoving are the indirect cause of consciousness, because they are not the direct antecedent condition of the latter.

original: de la ni ma rig pa dngos su rgyu'i ngo bo ma yin @377a * //🔽no ; / gzhan dag na re las rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni dngos su yin la /
analyzed: de la ni ma rig pa dngos su rgyu'i ngo bo ma yin @377a * // no ; / gzhan dag na re las rang gi ngo bos gnas pa ni dngos su yin la /
translated: In this context, ignorance is not the direct cause of the formative forces, because it is not the direct antecedent condition of the latter.

original: bag chags kyi gnas ni brgyud pas yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi gnas ni brgyud pas yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the direct cause is the cause that is the intrinsic nature of the effect, and the indirect cause is the cause that is the basis of the residual impression.🔽In this context, ignorance is the direct cause of the formative forces, because it is the direct antecedent condition of the latter.

original: 'di la ma rig pas 'du byed dag la ni dngos su nus la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag la ni brgyud pas so zhes rnam par 'chad pa ni bshad pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: 'di la ma rig pas 'du byed dag la ni dngos su nus la rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag la ni brgyud pas so zhes rnam par 'chad pa ni bshad pa dang 'gal te /
translated: Consciousness, etc. are the indirect cause of the formative forces, because they are not the direct antecedent condition of the latter.

original: 'du byed rnams kho na la gnyis ga bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kho na la gnyis ga bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This explanation contradicts the explanation in the Abhidharma, because both are taught in relation to the formative forces alone.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba ba bkag ste /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba ba bkag ste /
translated: The statement, “when this exists, that comes to be,” refutes the theory of causelessness,

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no effect without a cause.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di sa ni rgyu rtag ba bkag ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di sa ni rgyu rtag ba bkag ste /
translated: This is the refutation of a permanent cause.

original: skyes pa kho na rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa kho na rgyu yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Since only that which has arisen is a cause, that which has not arisen is not a cause.

original: rtog pa 'di la ni yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di don med do //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di la ni yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba 'di don med do //
translated: In this conception, the statement “when this exists, that comes to be” is meaningless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di kho nas smras pa gnyis ka bsal te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di kho nas smras pa gnyis ka bsal te /
translated: Why? Because the statement “this having arisen, that arises” itself refutes both of these.

original: rgyu mi rtag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi rtag pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it implies that the cause is impermanent.

original: sun 'byin pa 'di slar lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa 'di slar lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to this refutation, the following is stated:

original: 'o na ni gang la la dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang la la dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: “But some say that the statement ‘when this exists, that comes to be’ is made in order to refute the two extremes.”

original: 'du byed la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sa ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sa ni rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “such things as the formative forces” includes consciousness, name-and-form, and so on.

original: rtog pa de bsal bar zhes bya ba ni dgag par ro //
analyzed: rtog pa de bsal bar zhes bya ba ni dgag par ro //
translated: The phrase “in order to refute that conception” means in order to refute that idea.

original: gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa skyes pas 'du byed rnams skye'o //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes pas gang skye ba ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa skyes pas 'du byed rnams skye'o //
translated: “That which arises due to the arising of this” means that formations arise due to the arising of ignorance.

original: de nyid yod pas 'di 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nyid yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung gi bdag la sogs pa rten du gyur pa gzhan yod na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yod pas 'di 'byung gi zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa nyid yod pas 'du byed rnams 'byung gi bdag la sogs pa rten du gyur pa gzhan yod na ni ma yin no //
translated: “Due to the existence of this, that comes to be” means that formations come to be due to the existence of ignorance, not due to the existence of another support such as a self.

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs snga ma don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the former enumeration is not meaningless.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: ji srid bden pa 'ga' zhig nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji srid bden pa 'ga' zhig nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “As long as any of the truths exists” and so on.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis la mya ngan la sogs pa yan lag tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis la mya ngan la sogs pa yan lag tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: In the twelvefold dependent origination, there are no separate links such as old age and death.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rga shi dang 'brel pas de nyid du 'dus so //
analyzed: rga shi dang 'brel pas de nyid du 'dus so //
translated: They are included in old age and death.

original: 'di ltar de dag sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa'i yul la yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa'i yul la yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, they are the transformation of the object that is taught as sentient beings and non-sentient beings, and the transformation of the self.

original: 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bya ba mtha' gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bya ba mtha' gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “arise” is used because the activity is ascertained as one.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di dag yan lag bcu gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di dag yan lag bcu gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that they are not included among the twelve members.

original: ma spangs @377b pa las ma spangs pa dang skye bar shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis smos so zhes slob dpon snga ma dag zer ro //
analyzed: ma spangs @377b pa las ma spangs pa dang skye bar shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs gnyis smos so zhes slob dpon snga ma dag zer ro //
translated: The former masters say that two enumerations are mentioned in order to show that they are not abandoned and are produced.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ma spangs na zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa ma spangs na zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, “If ignorance is not abandoned,” and so on.

original: lta ba ma spangs pa la mang 'jig pa'i sgra rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba ma spangs pa la mang 'jig pa'i sgra rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: The word “many” is applied to the view that is not abandoned.

original: kinta santa me b'a ham k'a me shu k'a m'a tstsha nanna pra ti sambe da y'a myu d'a santa ma ti /
analyzed: kinta santa me b'a ham k'a me shu k'a m'a tstsha nanna pra ti sambe da y'a myu d'a santa ma ti /
translated: “I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire, I have not abandoned desire

original: gnas pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slob dpon dpal len na re go rims bzhin du gnas pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la slob dpon dpal len na re go rims bzhin du gnas pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang skye ba yang dag par bstan pa'i rnam grangs gnyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: With regard to such things as endurance and arising, the master Shrılabdha says: The two phrases “as long as” and “for as long as it endures” are stated respectively in order to correctly teach endurance and to correctly teach two synonyms for arising.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i (ngon kyang yod pa nyid bdag 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa so sor myang bar mi bya'o//) phyir rgyu'i rgyun ji srid pa de srid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i (ngon kyang yod pa nyid bdag 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa so sor myang bar mi bya'o//) phyir rgyu'i rgyun ji srid pa de srid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, “As long as the continuum of causes exists,” and so on.

original: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na zhes bya ba la 'dir ni dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya'o zhes rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te der gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dbang du mdzad pa yin na zhes bya ba la 'dir ni dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan par bya'o zhes rgyas par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te der gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir
translated: If it is taken to refer to arising, then here the Buddha says, “Monks, I will teach you dependent origination,” and so on, extensively. This is taken to refer to dependent origination because it refers to endurance.

original: gnas pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gnas pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the consequence of taking it to refer to endurance?

original: gnas pa yang skye ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa yang skye ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that endurance is just arising,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te 'jig pa bzhin du skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te 'jig pa bzhin du skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because like destruction, arising is a different characteristic of the produced.

original: skye ba gnyis la yang rnam grangs gzhan gyi khyad par bshad do //
analyzed: skye ba gnyis la yang rnam grangs gzhan gyi khyad par bshad do //
translated: And two arisings are explained as a different category.

original: ci ste dang por skyed pas skye ba dang rgyun bskyed pas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa rnam grangs kyis brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir rim pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
analyzed: ci ste dang por skyed pas skye ba dang rgyun bskyed pas gnas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa rnam grangs kyis brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir rim pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
translated: But if you say that arising is called arising because it generates at the beginning, and endurance is called endurance because it generates continuity, then the difference is merely a different category.

original: gnas pa ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Endurance is preceded by arising,

original: de'i phyir sngar ni 'di skyes bas 'di skye zhes skye ba kho na brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar ni 'di skyes bas 'di skye zhes skye ba kho na brjod par bya ba la /
translated: so first you should say that this arises because that arises.

original: phyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pas brjod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: phyis ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pas brjod par bya ba 'am /
translated: Later you should say that this occurs because that exists.

original: go rims las brgal na yang dgos pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims las brgal na yang dgos pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: If you reverse the order, you must state the purpose.

original: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang smras pa zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan de nyid kyis so //
translated: Again, he says means the elder himself.

original: gal te mdo'i don yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i don yin par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If it were the meaning of the sutra, then it would say,

original: 'di yod pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pas so //🔽'di zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di yod pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pas so // 'di zhes bya ba ni rgyu ste /
translated: “Because this exists, that arises,”🔽and “this” would refer to the cause.

original: the tshom med pa'i phyir mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But it does not say that,

original: zhes bya ba de skad du bka' stsal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de skad du bka' stsal par 'gyur te /
translated: so how could it be the meaning of the sutra?

original: bcom ldan 'das the tshoms za gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das the tshoms za gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bhagavān would not say, “Because of doubt, it does not arise.”

original: 'bras bu yod na phyis rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis cig @378a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na phyis rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin te / rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis cig @378a * //
translated: If the effect exists, the cause would not subsequently disintegrate,

original: car du ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: car du ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the cause and effect do not exist simultaneously.

original: de lta na go rims legs pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'jig pa skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na go rims legs pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'jig pa skye ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the order is good, because disintegration is preceded by arising, and that is taught first.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar 'jig pa bstan la phyis skye ba bstan na ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar 'jig pa bstan la phyis skye ba bstan na ste /
translated: Otherwise, if disintegration were taught first and arising were taught later,

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na zhes dri ba mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang zhe na zhes dri ba mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, since the question is asked, “What is dependent origination?”

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya bar gang las 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig bar 'gyur ro zhes de skad 'chad par 'gyur ba 'jig pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya bar gang las 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig bar 'gyur ro zhes de skad 'chad par 'gyur ba 'jig pa'i tshig tu thal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: and the answer is given, “When this exists, that comes to be,” how can it be said that the word “comes to be” implies the destruction of the effect?

original: byis pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: byis pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The word “childish” in the verse is explained in the commentary as follows:

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
translated: “Childish” means “those who have not seen the truth.”

original: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba tsam gyi sgra ni 'di na 'du byed pa po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam zhes bya ba tsam gyi sgra ni 'di na 'du byed pa po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “mere” in the phrase “mere conditioning” is used to show that there is no agent of conditioning.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya bas ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ston to //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya bas ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ston to //
translated: The word “ignorance” shows that it is unmixed ignorance.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag la rab tu gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen cing zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag la rab tu gnas shing zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The phrase “they are attached to the view of a real self and the pride that thinks ‘I am’” means that they are firmly attached to the view of a real self and the pride that thinks “I am.”

original: 'dis ni bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //
translated: This passage shows that ignorance is associated with the view of a real self and the pride that thinks “I am.”

original: lus la sogs pa dag gis las rnam pa gsum brtsam ste zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dag gis las rnam pa gsum brtsam ste zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The text continues: “They undertake the three kinds of actions through their bodies, speech, and minds.”

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gang du 'di bdag go snyam du lta ba dang / gang gis rlom pa de'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni gang du 'di bdag go snyam du lta ba dang / gang gis rlom pa de'o //
translated: The phrase “their own” refers to the self that is the object of the view of a real self and the pride that thinks “I am.”

original: bde ba'i don tam /
analyzed: bde ba'i don tam /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of pleasure” means🔽for the sake of happiness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi don tam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don tam /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of pain” means🔽for the sake of suffering.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽lus la sogs pa'i gsum dag gis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / lus la sogs pa'i gsum dag gis zhes bya ste /
translated: The text continues:🔽“They undertake the three kinds of actions through their bodies, speech, and minds.”

original: lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag dang yid kyi yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag dang yid kyi yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three kinds of actions are the three kinds of actions of body, the three kinds of actions of speech, and the three kinds of actions of mind.

original: tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du bde ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du bde ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of happiness in a future life means for the sake of happiness in another world.

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa ste /
translated: Merit refers to the realm of desire.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pha rol tu bde ba 'dod pa rnams ni spyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams la 'jug go /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pha rol tu bde ba 'dod pa rnams ni spyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa rnams la 'jug go /
translated: Thus, those who desire happiness in another world engage in generosity, morality, etc.

original: de dag ni phal che ba'i sgo nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni phal che ba'i sgo nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught from the point of view of the majority.

original: lta ba log pas bslus pa 'ga' zhig ni phyi ma la bde ba'i don du bsod nams ma yin pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: lta ba log pas bslus pa 'ga' zhig ni phyi ma la bde ba'i don du bsod nams ma yin pa brtsam mo //
translated: Some, deceived by false views, undertake demerit for the sake of happiness in a future life.

original: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of neither pleasure nor suffering means for the sake of the immovable.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med @378b pa na spyod pa ste /🔽bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don dang / de'i gong du bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med @378b pa na spyod pa ste / bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du tshe phyi ma la bde ba'i don dang / de'i gong du bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: This refers to the realms of form and the formless.🔽Up to the third meditative absorption, it is for the sake of happiness in a future life.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i don du'o //
translated: Above that, it is for the sake of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams ma yin pa brtsam ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba'i don du ni bsod nams ma yin pa brtsam ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of happiness in this life” is to be supplied.

original: lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / dag gis brdzun smra ba la sogs pa dang / yid kyis brnab sems la sogs pa dag go /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / dag gis brdzun smra ba la sogs pa dang / yid kyis brnab sems la sogs pa dag go /
translated: One engages in nonmeritorious action through body, speech, and mind, such as killing, lying, and covetousness, respectively.

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: “By the power of the projection of karma” means

original: ji skad bstan pa'i las dag gis 'phangs pa ni las kyi 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i las dag gis 'phangs pa ni las kyi 'phen pa'o //
translated: that the projection of karma is the projection by the previously explained karma.

original: de'i dbang gis na de'i rgyu mtshan gyis te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis na de'i rgyu mtshan gyis te /
translated: By the power of that, by the reason of that,

original: rgyu des rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel bas thag shin tu ring yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu des rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel bas thag shin tu ring yang 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the continuum of consciousness goes to that and that destination, even though it is far away, because it is connected with the intermediate existence.

original: srid pa bar ma yang rnam par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir de ltar bshad na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yang rnam par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i phyir de ltar bshad na /
translated: Since the intermediate existence is also endowed with the six consciousnesses, it is explained in this way.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is consciousness?”

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bshad pa de 'thad pa yin no zhes smos so //
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽gal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las kyis yongs su bsgos pa thams cad srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / gal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las kyis yongs su bsgos pa thams cad srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas bzung ste /
translated: How so?

original: skye ba'i skad cig gi bar du 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig gi bar du 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If the consciousness stream fully imbued by karma were the consciousness that is the condition for formation from the moment of linking with the intermediate existence until the moment of birth,🔽then it would be known as the sixfold collection of consciousness that is taught to be a classification of consciousness.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba rig par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba rig par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not known as that in any other context.

original: gal te nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen can zhes bya ba na ni de lta na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa kho na 'du byed kyi rkyen can zhes bya ba na ni de lta na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes rnam par shes pa rnam par dbye ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the consciousness that links with the womb were the consciousness that is the condition for formation, then it would contradict the statement that it is the sixfold collection of consciousness.

original: gnas skabs der yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tsam zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs der yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tsam zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that context, it would be just the mental consciousness alone.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nying mtshams sbyor bas gzhan dag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nying mtshams sbyor bas gzhan dag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the mental consciousness alone that links with the next existence, and the other consciousnesses do not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it should be said:

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur gyi ;
translated: It is the mental consciousness.🔽It should not be said:

original: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The six collections of consciousness.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kho na de'i tshe 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kho na de'i tshe 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the stream of consciousness itself is the link of consciousness conditioned by karmic formations at that time,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rgyun gang yin pa der gyur pa ni ma yin no //🔽de lta ma yin na gnas skabs pa kho na bshad @379a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rgyun gang yin pa der gyur pa ni ma yin no // de lta ma yin na gnas skabs pa kho na bshad @379a * //
translated: but it is not the stream of the aggregates of form, etc.

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be explained as a momentary state.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa kho na 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa kho na 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The ignorance that is concomitant with the view of self and the pride of “I am” is the cause of karmic formations.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par smra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par smra ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the view of self or the pride thinking “I am.”

original: 'dir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa dag ni 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa dag ni 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Here, because they are the effect of the simultaneous cause, the view of self and the pride thinking “I am,” which are associated with ignorance, are the cause of the formations.🔽In the same way, form and so on will arise.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig de la rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes kha cig de la rgol bar byed do //
translated: Some argue in this way.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag ma rig pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa'i stobs kyis 'du byed skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ma rig pa nyid 'dir rkyen du brjod de chos gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag ma rig pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa'i stobs kyis 'du byed skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ma rig pa nyid 'dir rkyen du brjod de chos gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But because the view of self and the pride thinking “I am” are themselves ignorance, they are the cause of the arising of the formations through the power of ignorance. Therefore, ignorance itself is stated here as the condition, and not some other phenomenon.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni 'brel pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni 'brel pa nyid de /
translated: Form and so on are not related to the arising of the formations.

original: 'du byed bskyed pa la byed pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'du byed bskyed pa la byed pa ci yang med do //
translated: They have no function in the generation of the formations.

original: ming dang gzugs phung po lnga po der skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs phung po lnga po der skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Name and form arise as the five aggregates.

original: 'dir ming dang gzugs ni ma shi bar du yan lag tu rig par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir ming dang gzugs ni ma shi bar du yan lag tu rig par bya'i /
translated: Here name and form should be understood as limbs until death.

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar /
translated: It is not as the Vaibhasikas say,

original: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad skye mched drug po tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni de phan chad skye mched drug po tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: that name and form are from conception until the six bases have developed.

original: yang ming dang gzugs phung po lnga pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ming dang gzugs phung po lnga pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that name and form are the five aggregates?

original: de'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa las de skad bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, it says because it is taught in the treatise Distinguishing the middle from extremes.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las /
translated: The sutra Distinguishing Name and Form states:

original: ming gang zhe na gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: ming gang zhe na gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
translated: What is name? It is the four nonmaterial aggregates.

original: tshor ba'i phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar ro //
translated: They are the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of discernment, the aggregate of formation and the aggregate of consciousness.

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever is form is the four great elements and whatever is derived from the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa de thams cad de /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa de thams cad de /
translated: All that is derived from the four great elements and the four great elements themselves.

original: gzugs dang sngar gyi ming 'di gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang sngar gyi ming 'di gnyis ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: These two, name and form, are reckoned as name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / mkhrang 'gyur la sogs pa'i ngo bos dbang po bskyed par bya ba la ches dang / shin tu ches nye ba'i ngo bo'i rim pas so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang / mkhrang 'gyur la sogs pa'i ngo bos dbang po bskyed par bya ba la ches dang / shin tu ches nye ba'i ngo bo'i rim pas so //
translated: The maturation of name-and-form is the generation of the faculties through the stages of kalala, arbuda, peśin, ghana, and so on, which are the essences that are increasingly and very close to the faculties.

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for the desire realm is craving for the desire realm.

original: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni @379b gzugs kyi sred pa'o zhes bya ba la /
