analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni @379b gzugs kyi sred pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Craving for pleasure and for neither pleasure nor suffering is craving for the form realm.

original: bsam gtan gsum na ni tshor ba bde ba la gzugs kyi sred pa gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum na ni tshor ba bde ba la gzugs kyi sred pa gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: In the three meditative concentrations, craving for the feeling of pleasure is craving for the form realm.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bde pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gzugs kyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni bde pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gzugs kyi sred pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is the craving for the realm of form that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gzhan med pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gzugs med pa'i srid pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gzhan med pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la gzugs med pa'i srid pa ste /
translated: In the formless realm, there is no other sensation than that of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant. Thus, the craving for the formless realm is the craving for the realm of neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: thams cad la sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “afflicted” should be supplied after each of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len to zhes bya ba la /🔽'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams nye bar len to //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len to zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba rnams nye bar len to //
translated: The Sūtra says that one appropriates the desire realm, etc.🔽One appropriates the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dag go zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang reg bya rnams so //
translated: The desire realm is the five sense-objects, i.e., form, sound, smell, taste, and the tangible.

original: 'dod par bya zhing don du nye bar bya bas na 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod par bya zhing don du nye bar bya bas na 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: They are called sense-objects because they are desired and pursued.

original: de nyid kun tu rtogs pa'i 'dod pas byang pas na yon tan te /
analyzed: de nyid kun tu rtogs pa'i 'dod pas byang pas na yon tan te /
translated: They are called qualities because they are desired by the imagination.

original: goms zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “practice” is “habitual practice.”

original: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i spras ni ri dags kyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i spras ni ri dags kyi brtul zhugs la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: “Ascetic practices” are the practices of dogs, cows, and so on. The term “and so on” includes the practices of deer, and so on.

original: ji skad du gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji skad du gcer bu pa la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: As it is said, “The naked ones and so on.”

original: 'di yang brtul zhugs yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang brtul zhugs yin no //
translated: This is also an ascetic practice.

original: bram ze'i brtul zhugs ni dbyu gu dang g-yang gzhi yang dag par len pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i brtul zhugs ni dbyu gu dang g-yang gzhi yang dag par len pa'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of the brahmins is the practice of the sacred thread and the skin of an antelope.

original: phyugs bdag pa'i ni ril ba dang thal ba'o //
analyzed: phyugs bdag pa'i ni ril ba dang thal ba'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of the cow herders is the practice of the water pot and ashes.

original: kun tu rgyu'i ni dbyu gu gsum pa dang spre'o yang dag par len pa'o //🔽bdag tu smra ba ni lus la ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di la bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun tu rgyu'i ni dbyu gu gsum pa dang spre'o yang dag par len pa'o // bdag tu smra ba ni lus la ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di la bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The ascetic practice of the wandering mendicants is the practice of the triple staff and the monkey.🔽The ascetic practice of the self-styled ascetics is the body.

original: de la bdag tu smra ba yod pas na bdag tu smra ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la bdag tu smra ba yod pas na bdag tu smra ba'o zhes smos te /
translated: The term “self-styled ascetics” is a bahuvrīhi compound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ngam bram ze gang su yang rung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ngam bram ze gang su yang rung ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, brahmins, and so on,

original: bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su lta bas yang dag par rjes su lta ba de thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su lta bas yang dag par rjes su lta ba de thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “One who views the self” views the five appropriated aggregates, as it is said.

original: gal te lus bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus bdag yin na /
translated: If the body were the self,

original: de lta na bdag nye bar len pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na bdag nye bar len pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: then the self would be called “appropriation.”

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽bdag yod na ni bdag nye bar @380a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bdag yod na ni bdag nye bar @380a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because the self does not exist.”

original: len pa zhes brjod na de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: len pa zhes brjod na de ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If the self existed, it would be called “appropriation.” But it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de med par zhes bya ba'i phyir bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de med par zhes bya ba'i phyir bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist, the proponent of the self is said to “appropriate.”

original: byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa dang / lung dang rtogs pa las skyes pa'i shes rab rnams med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba go rims bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa dang / lung dang rtogs pa las skyes pa'i shes rab rnams med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “The foolish, the untrained, the ordinary person” are so called because they lack the wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation, respectively.

original: gang zhig sngon goms pa'i bag chags las byung ba skye bas thob pa'i shes rab med pa de ni byis pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngon goms pa'i bag chags las byung ba skye bas thob pa'i shes rab med pa de ni byis pa'o //
translated: The child is the one who does not have the wisdom acquired through birth, which arises from the habitual tendencies of previous practice.

original: gang zhig lung las byung ba med pa de ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig lung las byung ba med pa de ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who does not have the wisdom born from the scriptures is the one who is not learned.

original: gang zhig rtogs pa las byung ba bden pa mngon par rtogs pa las skyes pa med pa de ni so so skye bo'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs pa las byung ba bden pa mngon par rtogs pa las skyes pa med pa de ni so so skye bo'o //
translated: The one who does not have the wisdom born from realization, which arises from the realization of the truths, is the ordinary person.

original: bdag tu lta ba dag la ste de la 'dod pa la sogs pa ma thob pa dag la ni 'dun pa ste don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dag la ste de la 'dod pa la sogs pa ma thob pa dag la ni 'dun pa ste don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: In regard to the view of self, desire and so on for those not yet attained is will, that is, striving.

original: thob pa dag la ni 'dod chags te mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa dag la ni 'dod chags te mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: For those already attained it is attachment, that is, strong desire.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams la ste de la 'dod pa la sogs pa ma thob pa dag la ni 'dun pa ste don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams la ste de la 'dod pa la sogs pa ma thob pa dag la ni 'dun pa ste don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: In regard to the proponents of self, desire and so on for those not yet attained is will, that is, striving.

original: thob pa dag la ni 'dod chags te mngon par zhen pa'o //🔽yul ma thob pa rnams la ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa dag la ni 'dod chags te mngon par zhen pa'o // yul ma thob pa rnams la ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: For those already attained it is attachment, that is, strong desire.

original: don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: Desire and so on for objects not yet attained is will, that is, striving.

original: thob pa rnams la ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: thob pa rnams la ni 'dod chags te /
translated: For those already attained it is attachment, that is, strong desire.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa de rnams la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa de rnams la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin gyi /
translated: The craving for those objects of desire, etc. is the appropriation of those objects.

original: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //
analyzed: ji skad bshad nyid ma rig bcas //
translated: The view is associated with ignorance, as explained above.

original: nyer len bcas te lta rnam gnyis //
analyzed: nyer len bcas te lta rnam gnyis //
translated: The view is twofold, because it is divided into two types.

original: bye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The other defilements are not appropriative aggregates, because they are not mentioned.

original: yang srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i 'bras bu can yin no //🔽de ni 'dir srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa'i 'bras bu can yin no // de ni 'dir srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of future existence is the cause of the result of future existence.🔽This is existence here.

original: 'di ni 'dir srid pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir srid pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is existence here.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'di 'dir srid pa'i tshig bla dags sam mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dir srid pa'i tshig bla dags sam mtshan nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the designation or characteristic of existence here.

original: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te zhes sngar ji skad🔽bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun srid pa bar ma dang 'brel ba'i phyir me 'bar ba 'gro ba'i tshul du 'gro ba de dang der 'gro bar 'gyur te zhes sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase in the way consciousness enters refers to the way consciousness goes to that or that destination, like a blazing fire, because the continuum of consciousness is connected to the intermediate existence through the power of karma, as explained earlier.

original: mdo de las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo de las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase as explained in the sutras refers to the following.

original: rga ba gang zhe na spyir cer dang mgo skya dang gnyer ma mang ba dang rnyings pa dang rgur pa dang 'khyogs pa dang / go b'a na s'a gyol po dang dbugs kyi sgra ngar ngar po @380b 'byung ba dang / lus mdun du dgu bas lus 'khar ba la brten pa dang lus sme ba nag pos khyab pa dang /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhe na spyir cer dang mgo skya dang gnyer ma mang ba dang rnyings pa dang rgur pa dang 'khyogs pa dang / go b'a na s'a gyol po dang dbugs kyi sgra ngar ngar po @380b 'byung ba dang / lus mdun du dgu bas lus 'khar ba la brten pa dang lus sme ba nag pos khyab pa dang /
translated: What is aging? In general, it is the state of being wrinkled, gray-haired, and full of wrinkles, the state of being bent, crooked, and stooped, the state of being lame and having a wheezing sound in the breath, the state of being bent forward, the state of leaning on a cane, and the state of being covered with black moles.

original: dha nu dhva manda tvam nyams pa dang dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su smin pa dang yongs su bye ba dang 'du byed rnams rnyings bar gyur pa dang 'khyogs par gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni rga ba zhes bya 'o //
analyzed: dha nu dhva manda tvam nyams pa dang dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang yongs su smin pa dang yongs su bye ba dang 'du byed rnams rnyings bar gyur pa dang 'khyogs par gyur pa gang yin pa 'di ni rga ba zhes bya 'o //
translated: The aging of dhanus, dhava, and mandara trees, the deterioration of faculties, the ripening of fruits, the withering of flowers, the aging of compounded phenomena, and their becoming crooked is called aging.

original: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is death?

original: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de nas 'chi zhing 'pho ba nyid do tshe dang drod nyams shing phung po rnams 'dor la srog gi dbang po 'gags ba 'chi ba'i dus byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'chi ba🔽zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de nas 'chi zhing 'pho ba nyid do tshe dang drod nyams shing phung po rnams 'dor la srog gi dbang po 'gags ba 'chi ba'i dus byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'chi ba zhes bya ste ;
translated: The passing away, the perishing, the dying, the termination, the disappearance, the separation, the overthrow, the loss, the change, the breaking up of the aggregates, the throwing off of the body, the cessation of life force, the completion of one’s time, and the arrival of the end of a sentient being in any of the various classes of sentient beings is called death.

original: 'chi ba 'di dang sngar gyi dga' ba 'di gnyis ni rga shi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba 'di dang sngar gyi dga' ba 'di gnyis ni rga shi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These two, death and the previous joy, are called old age and death.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ni sngar bshad ba gang yin pa de kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga pa'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag bcu gnyis dag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ni sngar bshad ba gang yin pa de kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phung po lnga pa'i gnas skabs kyi yan lag bcu gnyis dag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣika system is just as it was explained earlier.

original: yi ge ma'i don du ma nyid yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: yi ge ma'i don du ma nyid yin par mthong ste /
translated: The meaning of the term “mā” is “non-existence.”

original: 'dri ba ni ma rig pa'i don gang yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba ni ma rig pa'i don gang yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The question is, “What is the meaning of ignorance?”

original: chos ma yin pa dang don ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang don ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Non-Dharma, non-purpose” means

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma rig pa dang tha snyad ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma rig pa dang tha snyad ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: the words “and so on” include “non-knowledge,” “non-convention,” “non-human,” and so on.

original: chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i mi mthun par zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Opposed to Dharma and so on” means

original: chos dang don dang rig pa dang / tha snyad dang mi la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos dang don dang rig pa dang / tha snyad dang mi la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: it is opposed to Dharma, purpose, knowledge, convention, human, and so on.

original: chos la sogs pa med pa tsam ma yin la /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa med pa tsam ma yin la /
translated: It is not merely the absence of Dharma and so on.

original: chos la sogs pa dag las gzhan yang ma yin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa dag las gzhan yang ma yin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: Just as ignorance is not something other than the dharmas, such as form, and is not just their absence,

original: rig pa las gzhan pa ma yin zhing med pa tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa las gzhan pa ma yin zhing med pa tsam ma yin no //
translated: so too it is not something other than knowledge and is not just the absence of knowledge.

original: rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is taught to be a condition of things.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi dngos por bstan na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyi dngos por bstan na /
translated: Since it is taught that formations have ignorance as their condition,

original: med pa ni brjod du med pa'i phyir rkyen gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa ni brjod du med pa'i phyir rkyen gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: ignorance is not a non-thing, because a non-thing cannot be a condition.

original: mig la sogs pa dag kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Nor are the eyes, etc., the condition of formations,

original: dgra bcom pa la yang 'du byed 'phel bar byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang 'du byed 'phel bar byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the arhat’s formations would increase.

original: kun sbyor sogs tshig phyir zhes bya ba la /🔽kun tu sbyor ba dag tu ni ma rig pa'i kun tu @381a * //
analyzed: kun sbyor sogs tshig phyir zhes bya ba la / kun tu sbyor ba dag tu ni ma rig pa'i kun tu @381a * //
translated: Because of the words “fetter” and so on.

original: sbyor ba zhes bshad la /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bshad la /
translated: In the section on the fetters, it is said that the fetter of ignorance🔽is the cause of the other fetters.

original: zag pa dag tu ni ma rig pa'i zag pa 'ching ba dag tu ni gti mug gi 'ching ba phra rgyas dag tu ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyas /
analyzed: zag pa dag tu ni ma rig pa'i zag pa 'ching ba dag tu ni gti mug gi 'ching ba phra rgyas dag tu ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyas /
translated: The contaminants are the contaminant of ignorance. The bonds are the bond of delusion. The proclivities are the proclivity of ignorance.

original: chu bo dag tu ni ma rig pa'i chu bo //
analyzed: chu bo dag tu ni ma rig pa'i chu bo //
translated: The floods are the flood of ignorance.

original: sbyor ba dag tu ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya na /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag tu ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya na /
translated: The yokes are the yoke of ignorance.

original: med pa tsam ni de ltar 'gyur bar mi 'os la /
analyzed: med pa tsam ni de ltar 'gyur bar mi 'os la /
translated: But it is not proper that mere non-existence be that.

original: mig la sogs pa dag kyang kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag kyang kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the eye, etc. would not be the fetters, bonds, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang ma grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang ma grol bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the arhats would not be liberated.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan kho na ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan kho na ma rig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, ignorance is a separate dharma that is the opposite of knowledge.

original: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang lta ba'i rang bzhin yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that is of the nature of view.

original: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ni nyon mongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: Inferior wisdom is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not non-afflicted, which is virtuous or neutral.

original: de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba rnams pa lnga yin na /
analyzed: de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba rnams pa lnga yin na /
translated: If the five types of views such as the afflicted view of the self are ignorance,

original: lta ba ni ma rig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni ma rig par mi rung ste /
translated: then view cannot be ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du logs shig tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du logs shig tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proclivity of ignorance is stated separately as the proclivity of view, just as attachment and so on are.

original: 'o na ni gang nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab lta ba ma yin pa de ma rig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab lta ba ma yin pa de ma rig par 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then any afflicted wisdom that is not view would be ignorance.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it would be concomitant with the afflictions such as attachment, anger and pride.

original: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba de dang mtshungs ldan phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is concomitant with that view means because it is concomitant with ignorance.

original: gti mug nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bar nges pas lta ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan la ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gti mug nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bar nges pas lta ba ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan la ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa yin gyi /
translated: Since delusion is ascertained to be a universal mental affliction, view is concomitant with ignorance. Its nature is subsumed by its nature.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant.

original: gang zag gcig la sems gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gcig la sems gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Two minds do not exist in one person.

original: dus mtshungs pa zhes chos mngon par bshad de /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa zhes chos mngon par bshad de /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa explains that they are similar in time.

original: ji ltar sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams dang rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams dang rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mind itself is concomitant with mental factors, a support, an object, an aspect, time, and substance.

original: des na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir na ma rig pa shes rab nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir na ma rig pa shes rab nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, since two substances of wisdom are not concomitant, it is certain that ignorance is not wisdom itself.

original: shes rab nye nyon mongs ston phyir zhes bya ba 'di las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes rab nye nyon mongs ston phyir zhes bya ba 'di las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is taught that wisdom is a branch of the mental afflictions.

original: ji ltar sems kyi nye ba'i @381b nyon mongs pa sems las byung ba 'dod chags gzhan nyid yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi nye ba'i @381b nyon mongs pa sems las byung ba 'dod chags gzhan nyid yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: Just as it is said that attachment is a mental factor that is a branch of the mental afflictions of the mind,

original: sems ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is not the mind itself.

original: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma rig pa chos gzhan yin par rigs kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang de dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma rig pa chos gzhan yin par rigs kyi /
translated: The same is true of the secondary mental afflictions of wisdom.🔽It is reasonable that ignorance is a separate phenomenon,

original: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa shes rab nyid ni ma yin te mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa shes rab nyid ni ma yin te mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the secondary mental afflictions of wisdom are not wisdom itself, because they are not associated with it.

original: de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa yin nam ci zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It should be asked whether it is definitely a fetter of desire.

original: bag chags te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag chags te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin du ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “habitual tendencies” is the habitual tendencies of the unruliness of desire and so on.🔽Similarly, it should be asked whether it is definitely a fetter of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'dir ma rig pa'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ma rig pa'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the word “ignorance” should be understood to refer only to afflicted wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir thal ma thag tu yang ci'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thal ma thag tu yang ci'i phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has just been said, “Why is it that afflicted wisdom is not ignorance?”

original: ma rig pas nye bar bcom pa yang de bzhin du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar bcom pa yang de bzhin du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the same is true of the statement, “afflicted by ignorance.”

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that ignorance is concomitant with wisdom.

original: des na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis cig car yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis cig car yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, two substances of wisdom do not exist simultaneously.

original: dz'atyanta ra me b'a bi dy'a warn'a yam tya n'a ga mi ka pa ri kalpa sya /🔽gang yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len te de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin no //
analyzed: dz'atyanta ra me b'a bi dy'a warn'a yam tya n'a ga mi ka pa ri kalpa sya / gang yang zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal len te de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin no //
translated: Jātyantaramevābhividyāvarṇāyamatyā nāgamikaparikल्पस्य

original: snyam du sems so //
analyzed: snyam du sems so //
translated: The master Śrīlāta thinks that the word “also” means that all afflictions are ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che des rab tu mi shes shing rab tu mi shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che des rab tu mi shes shing rab tu mi shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i phyir ro /
translated: Why? Because the sutra says, “Venerable Mahākauṣṭhila, not knowing, not knowing is called ignorance.”

original: (/ skye ba gzhan kho na /
analyzed: (/ skye ba gzhan kho na /
translated: in another life

original: ma rig pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa /
translated: ignorance

original: bsngags par byed /
analyzed: bsngags par byed /
translated: praise

original: phyir mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba /
translated: nonreturner

original: yongs su brtag pa'i/) des zhes bya ba ni gang yod na rig pa med pa de ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa'i/) des zhes bya ba ni gang yod na rig pa med pa de ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: “That” refers to the nonexistence of knowledge, which is ignorance.

original: rgyu med na nam 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu med na nam 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If there is no cause, it does not exist at any time.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad yod na yang rig pa med pa yin no //🔽kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin pas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad yod na yang rig pa med pa yin no // kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa yin pas te /
translated: And if all the defilements exist, there is no knowledge.

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i nang du ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba logs shig tu bshad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “It would not be mentioned separately among the fetters, etc.” means that if all the defilements are ignorance, the fetter of ignorance would not be mentioned separately among the fetters of attachment, etc.

original: kun tu sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du 'ching ba dag gi nang du gti mug gi 'ching ba zhes bya @382a * //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du 'ching ba dag gi nang du gti mug gi 'ching ba zhes bya @382a * //
translated: because it would not be different from the remaining fetters.

original: par logs shig tu bshad par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: par logs shig tu bshad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, the fetter of delusion would not be mentioned separately among the fetters,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different from the fetters of attachment and hostility.

original: phra rgyas dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya bar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phra rgyas dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya bar yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not called the negative tendency of ignorance among the negative tendencies.

original: phra rgyas lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not distinct from the remaining negative tendencies.

original: chu bo dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / sbyor ba dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya bar logs shig tu yang bshad par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu bo dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / sbyor ba dag gi nang du ma rig pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya bar logs shig tu yang bshad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be explained separately as the flood of ignorance among the floods and the fetter of ignorance among the fetters.

original: chu bo dang sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu bo dang sbyor ba lhag ma dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not distinct from the remaining floods and fetters.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la sogs pa rnams la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir lta ba'am /🔽nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la sogs pa rnams la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir lta ba'am / nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ste /
translated: Because it is the nature of all affliction and because it does not possess itself or others, such as view and so on, it would not possess other afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not possess other afflictions such as attachment and so on.

original: 'di ltar lta ba ni lta ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ba ni lta ba'am /
translated: Because it is like this: view does not possess view.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be concomitant with attachment or aversion.🔽Similarly, attachment would not be concomitant with attachment or any other affliction.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang 'dod chags sam nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //🔽sems kyang zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang 'dod chags sam nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o // sems kyang zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ste /
translated: The same should be said for all the afflictions.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma rig pa yin na /
translated: If ignorance is the nature of all the afflictions,

original: 'dod chags kyang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: then since attachment is the nature of an affliction,🔽it would not be attachment because it is ignorance alone.

original: ma rig pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i sems ni rnam par mi grol lo zhes bshad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa kho na yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba'i sems ni rnam par mi grol lo zhes bshad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be said that a mind that is afflicted by attachment is not liberated.

original: 'o na ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: How then should it be explained?

original: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: ma rig pas nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bya bar ro //
translated: It should be explained as “a mind that is afflicted by ignorance.”

original: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, if it is said that it is in order to make a distinction,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa che ge mos nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba mi grol lo zhes bya bar rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma rig pa bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa che ge mos nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba mi grol lo zhes bya bar rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma rig pa bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir
translated: Because all afflictions have the nature of ignorance, it would not be understood that one is not liberated due to being afflicted by a specific ignorance.

original: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, in order to specify ignorance, it is said that one is afflicted by attachment.

original: dper na skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: dper na skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang /
translated: For example, although the twelve sense bases are not distinguished in terms of their nature being form,

original: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched dang sgra'i skye mched ces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched dang sgra'i skye mched ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: in order to specify them, they are explained as the sense base of form and the sense base of sound.

original: shes @382b rab la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes @382b rab la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Also with regard to wisdom...

original: 'o na ni shes rab la yang zhe sdang gis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa dang / nga rgyal gyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba dag las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni shes rab la yang zhe sdang gis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa dang / nga rgyal gyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba dag las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ma rig pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
translated: But then, in order to distinguish between wisdom that is defiled by hatred and wisdom that is defiled by pride, you would have to distinguish between different types of ignorance.

original: de lta ma yin na ma rig pa gang gis nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur ba mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ma rig pa gang gis nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur ba mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not do that, you will not understand by what ignorance the mind is defiled.

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag ste /
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i shes rab ni rnam par mi 'dag ste /
translated: But if you say that wisdom that is defiled by any of the afflictions is not purified,

original: de'i phyir 'dir bye brag nye bar mi len no zhe na ma yin te sems la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar 'dod chags kho nas yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bye brag nye bar mi len no zhe na ma yin te sems la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'dod chags kho nas yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: then you should not make a distinction here, because the same is true of the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems kyang rnam par mi grol bas 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sems kyang rnam par mi grol bas 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: For the mind that is defiled by any of the afflictions is not liberated.

original: mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not clear.

original: gsal ba ni rab tu shes pa yin la //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rab tu shes pa yin la //
translated: Clear means knowledge.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not clear means not knowledge.

original: ma rig pa la ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pa la ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fault is just as in the case of nescience.

original: gal te gang gsal ba ma yin pa yin na ni mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang gsal ba ma yin pa yin na ni mig la sogs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not clear, then it follows that the eye, etc. are also not clear.

original: 'o na ni gsal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal ba med pa yin no //
translated: But it is not clear.

original: de ltan ni ci yang ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltan ni ci yang ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that is so, then it is nothing at all.

original: de yang rig pa ma yin te /🔽rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa de lta bu'i phyir la /
analyzed: de yang rig pa ma yin te / rkyen gyi dngos por bstan pa de lta bu'i phyir la /
translated: And that is not knowledge.

original: kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba la sogs pa'i dngos por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to be a condition, and because it is taught to be a fetter, etc.

original: ji ltar 'di ci zhig ces ma rig pa mi shes pa de bzhin mi gsal ba yang yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ci zhig ces ma rig pa mi shes pa de bzhin mi gsal ba yang yin no zhes ston te /
translated: Just as one does not know what it is, so it is not clear.

original: ma grub pa ni ma grub pa shes par byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ma grub pa shes par byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And an unestablished thing cannot cause the knowledge of another unestablished thing.

original: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos rnams bstan pa de lta bu yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The teaching of the dharmas is like that.

original: de lta bu ni rigs de lta bu dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu ni rigs de lta bu dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of “that kind of lineage.”

original: chos rnams gtan gdon mi za bar rang bzhin gyis phye ba kho nar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: chos rnams gtan gdon mi za bar rang bzhin gyis phye ba kho nar ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only are the dharmas definitely distinguished by their intrinsic natures,

original: las kyis rab tu phye ba yang yin pas /
analyzed: las kyis rab tu phye ba yang yin pas /
translated: but they are also distinguished by their actions.

original: 'dir rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi las kyis ma rig pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi las kyis ma rig pa bstan te /
translated: Here, ignorance is taught as the action that is the opposite of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa la chags pa dang bral te rig pa skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa la chags pa dang bral te rig pa skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said, “When one is free from attachment to ignorance, knowledge arises.”

original: de'i phyir don 'ga' zhig rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don 'ga' zhig rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is the opposite of knowledge does not exist as some object.

original: de nyid la dpe bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la dpe bshad pa ni /
translated: An example is explained for that:

original: @383a * // dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @383a * // dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, etc.

original: der ni las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis mig nges par byed kyi /
analyzed: der ni las mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis mig nges par byed kyi /
translated: There, action determines the eye by the condition of being the basis of visual consciousness,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by its intrinsic nature.

original: gal te gzugs dang bzhes rang bzhin gyis rab tu phye ba kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang bzhes rang bzhin gyis rab tu phye ba kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it said that the eye sense faculty is the basis of eye consciousness only in the sense that it is the substantial cause of eye consciousness?

original: gzugs dang ba de ni rang gi ngo bos nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba de ni rang gi ngo bos nges par mi nus te /
translated: That eye sense faculty is not definitely determined by its own nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it is said, “It is the basis of eye consciousness.”

original: btsun pa chos skyob na re nga'o snyam du sems can la 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la des 'gro ba thams cad du 'jug pas na 'jug pa ste 'gro zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: btsun pa chos skyob na re nga'o snyam du sems can la 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la des 'gro ba thams cad du 'jug pas na 'jug pa ste 'gro zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: Bhadanta Dharmatrāta says, “The mind engages sentient beings, thinking ‘I am.’ ” Since it engages all reincarnating beings, it engages, which means it goes.

original: de'i dngos po ni 'jug pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'jug pa nyid yin na /
translated: The state of that is engagement itself.

original: 'di ni nges par ma byas pa zhig ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par ma byas pa zhig ste /
translated: This is not a definite statement.

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan des kyang de'i brjod par bya ba ni dmigs ma phyed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan des kyang de'i brjod par bya ba ni dmigs ma phyed do //
translated: In this way, that elder did not distinguish the referent of that statement.

original: nga'o snyam du zhes bya bas ngar 'dzin pa yang yongs su bzung la /
analyzed: nga'o snyam du zhes bya bas ngar 'dzin pa yang yongs su bzung la /
translated: “Thinking ‘I am’” includes the apprehension of “I.”

original: 'di yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi bya ba yin pas 'dri ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i 'jug pa gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi bya ba yin pas 'dri ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i 'jug pa gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since this is the activity of the pride that thinks “I am,” the question is, “What is the activity that is different from the pride that thinks ‘I am’?”

original: gang gi phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa'i phra rgyas dag las logs shig tu 'jug pa gsungs pa de'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal nyid 'jug pa ma yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen pa'i phra rgyas dag las logs shig tu 'jug pa gsungs pa de'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal nyid 'jug pa ma yin par rtogs so //
translated: Since the activity is stated to be different from the negative tendencies that are fixated on the pride that thinks “I am,” it is understood that the pride that thinks “I am” is not the activity.

original: sred pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad las logs shig tu gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: sred pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad las logs shig tu gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Since it is stated separately from all the aspects of attachment and so on, it is understood that the afflictions of attachment and so on are not the other aspects.

original: ma rig pa ni ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i sgras ni ma rig pa gsungs so zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i sgras ni ma rig pa gsungs so zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Since ignorance is not stated, it is understood that the word activity refers to ignorance.

original: nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di las ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kho na rang gi sgras gsungs kyi /
analyzed: nga rgyal gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di las ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kho na rang gi sgras gsungs kyi /
translated: Is there not another pride?🔽This sutra mentions only the pride thinking I, but not another pride.

original: nga rgyal gzhan ma yin pas 'jug pa'i sgras nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gzhan ma yin pas 'jug pa'i sgras nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal las gzhan pa'i nga rgyal bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the word other in the statement, “from the pride thinking I, there is another pride” must refer to another pride other than the pride thinking I.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: don de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: don de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not the meaning.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bstan pas nga rgyal lhag ma yang gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bstan pas nga rgyal lhag ma yang gzung ba yin te /
translated: The remaining pride is also included by teaching the pride thinking I,

original: mad po'i tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mad po'i tshig gis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is taught by the word also.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa gtso bo smos @383b pas mtshon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa gtso bo smos @383b pas mtshon pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, the root afflictions are mentioned and the rest are illustrated.

original: lta ba rnams las bdag dang bdag gi bdag tha dad du bstan te /
analyzed: lta ba rnams las bdag dang bdag gi bdag tha dad du bstan te /
translated: The views are taught to be different from the self and mine.

original: de dag ni lta ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtso bo dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni lta ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba ma yin pa'i phyir gtso bo dag go //
translated: They are the principal ones because they are not the root of all views.

original: tha dad du bstan pa dag ni phra rgyas brjod pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad du bstan pa dag ni phra rgyas brjod pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: The distinction is also made in order to mention the proclivities.

original: khong khro ba dang the tshom gyi phra rgyas dag kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba dang the tshom gyi phra rgyas dag kyang gzung ngo //
translated: The proclivities of repugnance and of scepticism are also to be included.

original: da ni ma rig pa kho na 'dir gtso bo ste /
analyzed: da ni ma rig pa kho na 'dir gtso bo ste /
translated: Now, ignorance is the principal element here.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las khyad par du'o //🔽de tha dad du bstan pa med pa aa na t'a pra sa ga sy'a di ti /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las khyad par du'o // de tha dad du bstan pa med pa aa na t'a pra sa ga sy'a di ti /
translated: It is distinguished from the other defilements.🔽It is not mentioned separately, because it is always associated with the other defilements.

original: de nyid 'dir 'jug pa nyid du ma brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir 'jug pa nyid du ma brjod do //
translated: It is not mentioned separately, because it is always associated with the other defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.

original: kun nas 'gro zhing thams cad du 'gro bas na 'jug pa ste /🔽'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //🔽de'i dngos po ni 'jug pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽'dir thams cad kyi zhes bya ba so so la mang po'i tshig 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun nas 'gro zhing thams cad du 'gro bas na 'jug pa ste / 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i don to // de'i dngos po ni 'jug pa nyid ces bya'o // 'dir thams cad kyi zhes bya ba so so la mang po'i tshig 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of all defilements.

original: bdag dang bdag gi bdag re re la mang po'i tshig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi bdag re re la mang po'i tshig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is the universal cause of all defilements.

original: sred pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is the universal cause of all defilements.🔽It is the universal cause of

original: rnam pa med pa de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa thams cad la mang po'i tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa thams cad la mang po'i tshig sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the plural particle is applied to all, such as self and that which belongs to self.

original: nga rgyal gyi sgra yis nga rgyal gyi khyad par re re gzung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi sgra yis nga rgyal gyi khyad par re re gzung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The word “pride” does not refer to each of the different types of pride.

original: nga rgyal smos pa de la khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa smos par yang lta ba ma lus pa smos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal smos pa de la khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa smos par yang lta ba ma lus pa smos pa ma yin no //
translated: Since pride is not a different type, the word “pride” is not used in the same way as the word “view.”

original: phra rgyas kyi sgra yis kyang khong khro dang the tshom dag kho na gzung ngo //
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi sgra yis kyang khong khro dang the tshom dag kho na gzung ngo //
translated: The word “proclivity” refers only to anger and doubt,

original: lta ba la sogs pa bzhin dngos su ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa bzhin dngos su ma yin no //
translated: not to the others such as view, because they are not proclivities.

original: rgyu yod pa de'i phyir phra rgyas kyi sgra ni mngon par zhen pa bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro zhes shes so //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa de'i phyir phra rgyas kyi sgra ni mngon par zhen pa bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar ro zhes shes so //
translated: Since there is a reason for this, the word “proclivity” is applied to clinging to self and so on in the same way that it is applied to clinging.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ma rig pa kho na khyad par du ma byas te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ma rig pa kho na khyad par du ma byas te ;
translated: Therefore, ignorance alone is not specified here.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang ngo //
translated: It is the other afflictions.

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'jug pa'i sgra yis ci ma rig pa bshad dam 'on te nyon mongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'jug pa'i sgra yis ci ma rig pa bshad dam 'on te nyon mongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is not known whether the word “here” refers to ignorance or to another affliction.

original: 'dir yang rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par dpyad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, too, the word “analysis”

original: ci nga rgyal gzhan nam ste ma rig pa yod pa las zhes rnam par dpyad na brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung bas rnam par dpyad pa'i zhar las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gzhag go //
analyzed: ci nga rgyal gzhan nam ste ma rig pa yod pa las zhes rnam par dpyad na brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung bas rnam par dpyad pa'i zhar las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gzhag go //
translated: means “what is it? Is it another kind of pride or is it ignorance?” Since there would be a lot to say in an analysis, this is set aside because it is a digression from the topic.

original: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: gzugs ni rgya cher bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
translated: Form has been explained extensively.🔽Form is the five sense faculties,

original: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //🔽ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas @384a * //
analyzed: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid // ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas @384a * //
translated: the five objects, and nonindicative form.

original: rgyas par bshad zin to //🔽ming dang gzugs can ming phung po zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad zin to // ming dang gzugs can ming phung po zhes bya ba /
translated: It has been explained extensively in such passages as this.🔽Name and form

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason for the use of the term name is asked about in the question, “Why?”

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi la ming zhes brjod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi la ming zhes brjod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The four non-material aggregates are called name.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir ming dang dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to show the reason for the use of the term name, he says: because of the influence of name, faculty, and object.

original: ming dang dbang po dang don dang gsum gyi dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la gzhol bas ming ste /
analyzed: ming dang dbang po dang don dang gsum gyi dbang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la gzhol bas ming ste /
translated: The meaning of form, etc. is called name because it is directed toward form, etc. by the influence of the three: name, faculty, and object.

original: dmigs par 'dzin pa 'dud pa la brten nas brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs par 'dzin pa 'dud pa la brten nas brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it is expressed in dependence on the bending of the apprehension of the object.

original: de la ming gi dbang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de la ming gi dbang gis ni gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dag la'o //
translated: Therein, by the influence of name, it is in regard to form, etc. that are either directly perceived or not directly perceived.

original: dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis ni mngon sum bdag la gzhol lo //
analyzed: dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis ni mngon sum bdag la gzhol lo //
translated: By the influence of faculty and object, it is in regard to what is directly perceived.

original: ming gang gis zhes bya ba ni gsung rab las bung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam 'bod ming gi mtshan nyid can la ming du grags pa de'i phyir the tshom za'o //
analyzed: ming gang gis zhes bya ba ni gsung rab las bung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid dam 'bod ming gi mtshan nyid can la ming du grags pa de'i phyir the tshom za'o //
translated: By what name? In the scriptures, the four aggregates are characterized as name, or the name is characterized as the collection of names. Therefore, there is doubt.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The term “in the world” is supplied.

original: 'dir 'bod ming gi mtshan nyid gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'bod ming gi mtshan nyid gzung ste /
translated: Here, the name is taken as the characteristic of the name-base.

original: phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhi'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The name-base is not known in the world as having the characteristic of the four aggregates.

original: de la ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba ni gong bu go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba ni gong bu go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, the terms “ox” and “horse” are the name-base that causes understanding of a collection.

original: gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba ni don gcig go bar byed pa yin te rdzas go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro zhes bya ba ni don gcig go bar byed pa yin te rdzas go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms “form” and “taste” are the name-base that causes understanding of a single object, because they cause understanding of a substance.

original: de lta na ni 'o na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa rnams la ming nyid mi srid do zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa rnams la ming nyid mi srid do zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the name itself is impossible for the non-associated formative forces, because they have no object.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kho na la dmigs pa la gzhol ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kho na ming yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kho na la dmigs pa la gzhol ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kho na ming yin no //
translated: That is not so, because it is impossible for the non-associated formative forces to be directed towards an object, the name is only for the non-formative forces.

original: de med pas ldan pa ma yin pa rnams la ming ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: de med pas ldan pa ma yin pa rnams la ming ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te gzugs bzhin no //
translated: And because they do not exist, the non-associated formative forces are not without name, just like form.

original: dper na gzhig cing gzhom du rung bas gzugs yin zhing /
analyzed: dper na gzhig cing gzhom du rung bas gzugs yin zhing /
translated: For example, form is that which can be destroyed and overcome,

original: thogs pa med pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; rdul phra rab rnams la gzugs su rung ba yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: thogs pa med pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; rdul phra rab rnams la gzugs su rung ba yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: but the past, future, noninformative form, and subtle atoms do not exist as form because they are not impeded.

original: de dag gzugs ma yin pa nyid kyis ma yin zhing 'di gzugs kho na la yod pas gzugs kyi nges tshig ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gzugs ma yin pa nyid kyis ma yin zhing 'di gzugs kho na la yod pas gzugs kyi nges tshig ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: But it is not that they are not form because they are not form alone, nor is it that the definition of form does not apply to them.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten na grags pa ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten na grags pa ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is renowned in the world as an ox or a horse is called that.

original: @384b ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis ming nyid yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @384b ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis ming nyid yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it called name?

original: ming de dang de zhes bya ba la ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de ming nyid yin te phung po bzhir bshad de //
analyzed: ming de dang de zhes bya ba la ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de ming nyid yin te phung po bzhir bshad de //
translated: Name is the nonassociated compositional factor that is called this or that, and it is explained as the four aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus bor nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir lus bor nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Others say: Here, having cast aside the body,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: shi shing dus byas pa de'i lus rul ba de nye du rnams kyis mes bsreg pa'am /🔽chur bsgyur ba'am /
analyzed: shi shing dus byas pa de'i lus rul ba de nye du rnams kyis mes bsreg pa'am / chur bsgyur ba'am /
translated: plowed by the plow of the dead,

original: sa'i 'og tu 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sa'i 'og tu 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: or buried in the ground by relatives.

original: rlung dang nyi ma dag gis skam pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma dag gis skam pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur te /
translated: It will be dried up and completely exhausted and destroyed by wind and sun.

original: sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dad pas yongs su bsgos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la gong du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba dang / yid ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dad pas yongs su bsgos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la gong du 'gro ba dang /
translated: But that which is called mind, thought, and consciousness, which is imbued with faith, imbued with morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom, will go forth to a better destination.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba dang / mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It will go to a higher realm.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhol ba ni mar me 'pho ba'i tshul du yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhol ba ni mar me 'pho ba'i tshul du yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The descent of consciousness should be understood in the manner of the transference of a flame.

original: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
analyzed: skye mched drug bshad zin to //
translated: The six sense bases have been explained.

original: gang du bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang du bshad ce na /
translated: Where were they explained?

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten /
translated: The consciousness that is the support of those.

original: mig la sogs gzugs zhes bya ba der mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs zhes bya ba der mig la sogs pa'i skye mched lnga po rnams so //
translated: The five sense faculties, eye, etc., are called form.

original: rnam shes so so rnam rig pa zhes bya ba der yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam shes so so rnam rig pa zhes bya ba der yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: Consciousness is the individual awareness of each object.

original: reg drug ces bya bas rten gyi dbyibs reg pa'i dbye ba tsam zhig bshad la /
analyzed: reg drug ces bya bas rten gyi dbyibs reg pa'i dbye ba tsam zhig bshad la /
translated: The six contacts are the six divisions of contact based on the six sense faculties.

original: 'dus te byung ba yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang rgyu bshad kyi ngo bo ni ma yin te /🔽'dus pa ni lan cig 'byung ba'o snyam du bsams nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus te byung ba yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang rgyu bshad kyi ngo bo ni ma yin te / 'dus pa ni lan cig 'byung ba'o snyam du bsams nas smras pa ni /
translated: The word “arising” in the phrase “arising from the union” indicates the cause, not the essence.

original: re zhig lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The word “arising” is used because the union occurs only once.🔽The opponent’s position is stated in the following:

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba mi srid do snyam zhing yid kyi dbang po 'gags pa go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba mi srid do snyam zhing yid kyi dbang po 'gags pa go zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Since the mental faculty, mental objects, and mental consciousness arise simultaneously, it is impossible for them to be sequential.

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The opponent’s position is stated in the following:🔽The mental faculty and mental objects are the conditions for the arising of mental consciousness.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do zhes bya bas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do zhes bya bas yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir 'gags pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is past because it has ceased.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba rnams ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos yid kyi rnam par shes pas dmigs par bya ba rnams ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of form, etc., which are the objects of the mental consciousness, are future because they have not yet arisen.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba da ltar ba rnams kho nas dmigs pa @385a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba da ltar ba rnams kho nas dmigs pa @385a * //
translated: The present mind and mental factors are the objects of the mental faculty.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are objects.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni da ltar gyi'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni da ltar gyi'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is present.

original: ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba ni 'du ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus zhes bya ba ni 'du ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid de /
translated: How can they be assembled?

original: dus tha dad bar gtogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa zhes bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad bar gtogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa zhes bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: They are not assembled because they belong to different times.🔽That which is the relation of cause and effect, the mental faculty and the phenomena are the cause.

original: yid kyi dbang po dang chos rnams ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang chos rnams ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is the effect.

original: rig pa bskyed par bya ba la mthun pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni reg pa bskyed par bya ba'i ched du phan tshun rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa bskyed par bya ba la mthun pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni reg pa bskyed par bya ba'i ched du phan tshun rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: They are similar to each other in that they are for the purpose of producing contact.

original: reg pa bskyed pa la thams cad kyang rjes su mthun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg pa bskyed pa la thams cad kyang rjes su mthun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all are similar in producing contact.🔽The meaning of having the same effect.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa'i don no zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po rnam par shes pa rnams 'bras bu gcig nyid la 'du ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa'i don no zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po rnam par shes pa rnams 'bras bu gcig nyid la 'du ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The object, faculty, and consciousness are said to be combined in having the same effect.

original: 'di reg pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di reg pa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is called the group of contact.

original: gal te yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa tsam rig pa yin na ni de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa rnams 'dus pa tsam rig pa yin na ni de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: If the mere assembly of the object, faculty, and consciousness is contact, then it is not something different from those three.

original: de lta yin na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa drug tshan las logs shig tu gsung par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa drug tshan las logs shig tu gsung par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would not be stated separately from the six groups of object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: gang dag yang reg pa smos pas bstan par byas so zhes rtog pa de dag las tha dad pa'i dus yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag yang reg pa smos pas bstan par byas so zhes rtog pa de dag las tha dad pa'i dus yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not separate from those, like craving, etc.

original: de'i phyir sred pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag las logs shig tu bstan pas de dag 'dus pa tsam ni reg pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa la sogs pa bzhin du de dag las logs shig tu bstan pas de dag 'dus pa tsam ni reg pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, since they are taught separately from those, like craving, etc., it is understood that their mere assembly is not contact.

original: yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan pas reg pa de dag las logs shig tu yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan pas reg pa de dag las logs shig tu yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since they are taught separately from the object, faculty, and consciousness, contact does not exist separately from them.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /🔽tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na / tshor ba dang sred pa dag kyang chos kyi skye mched las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Why not?🔽Because feeling and craving are also taught as being separate from the sense bases of mental objects, etc.

original: gal te logs shig tu bstan pas sred pa la sogs pa ltar logs su yod na //
analyzed: gal te logs shig tu bstan pas sred pa la sogs pa ltar logs su yod na //
translated: If they existed separately, like craving, etc.,

original: de lta na chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug pa 'di nyid las tshor ba dang sred pa dag chos kyi skye mched las logs shig tu bshad pas chos kyi skye mched las logs shig tu yod par thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na chos kyi rnam grangs drug tshan drug pa 'di nyid las tshor ba dang sred pa dag chos kyi skye mched las logs shig tu bshad pas chos kyi skye mched las logs shig tu yod par thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then since feeling and craving are explained as being separate from the phenomena base in this very sixfold enumeration of six sets of six bases, it would follow that they would exist separately from the phenomena base.

original: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir logs shig tu gsungs pa ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin te 'khrul pa'i @385b phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir logs shig tu gsungs pa ni gzhan nyid kyi rgyu ma yin te 'khrul pa'i @385b phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, being mentioned separately is not a reason for being different because that is mistaken.

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phenomena base that is not included in those two is also called the phenomena base.

original: gang zhig tshor ba dang sred pa dang gnyis bsal nas chos kyi skye mched ces bstan pa /
analyzed: gang zhig tshor ba dang sred pa dang gnyis bsal nas chos kyi skye mched ces bstan pa /
translated: The phenomena base is taught after excluding both feeling and craving.

original: tshor ba dang sred pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched 'dus ma byas dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; 'du shes dang sems la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang yod de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang sred pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched 'dus ma byas dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang ; 'du shes dang sems la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang yod de /
translated: The phenomena base that is not included in feeling and craving is the unconditioned phenomena base, nonindicative form, and the characteristics of discernment, mind, and so on.
