original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang las logs shig tu bstan pa de ni de las tha dad pa kho na yin pas logs su bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang las logs shig tu bstan pa de ni de las tha dad pa kho na yin pas logs su bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that which is taught separately from something is only different from it. There is no error in teaching it separately.

original: de lta bur ni 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bur ni 'dir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: “ In this way, here” is an elaboration.

original: de lta bur gang zhig mdo 'dir nang dang phyi'i skye mched smos pa dang / rnam par shes pa smos pas smos su rung ba /
analyzed: de lta bur gang zhig mdo 'dir nang dang phyi'i skye mched smos pa dang / rnam par shes pa smos pas smos su rung ba /
translated: In this way, that which is suitable to be mentioned in this sūtra by mentioning the internal and external bases,

original: reg pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum las gzhan gsum reg par ma gyur pa gang yin pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum las gzhan gsum reg par ma gyur pa gang yin pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and by mentioning consciousness, is not something other than the three: the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness, which are the cause and effect called contact.

original: de'i phyir reg pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams las gzhan kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams las gzhan kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, contact is only something other than the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught separately.

original: ci ste de dang mtshungs pa'i yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa phan tshun bltos pa med pa rnams kyi nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa drug po dag logs shig tu bstan la /
analyzed: ci ste de dang mtshungs pa'i yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa phan tshun bltos pa med pa rnams kyi nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa drug po dag logs shig tu bstan la /
translated: But if you think that the internal and external bases and the six consciousnesses are taught separately, since the object, faculty, and consciousness that are similar to it are not mutually dependent,

original: rten pa mtshungs pa phan tshun bltos pa rnams ni reg pa'i tshogs smos pas smos pa'i phyir na de don gzhan gyi dngos po ma yin yang /🔽yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan par mi 'gal lo snyam na gal te rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rten pa mtshungs pa phan tshun bltos pa rnams ni reg pa'i tshogs smos pas smos pa'i phyir na de don gzhan gyi dngos po ma yin yang / yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag las logs shig tu bstan par mi 'gal lo snyam na gal te rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: and since those that are mutually dependent and have a similar support are mentioned by the expression “group of contacts,” then it is not contradictory to teach them separately, even though they are not different entities.

original: don dang dbang po dag ni de dang mtshungs pa yin pas rnam par shes pa la mi ltos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: don dang dbang po dag ni de dang mtshungs pa yin pas rnam par shes pa la mi ltos par 'gyur na /
translated: If you think that the object and faculty are similar to it, then consciousness would not depend on them.

original: rnam par shes pa ni don dang dbang po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni don dang dbang po med pa ma yin te /
translated: But consciousness is not without an object and a faculty,

original: de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has them as its cause.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu med par yang yod na 'bras bu ni rgyu med par ma yin te de la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu med par yang yod na 'bras bu ni rgyu med par ma yin te de la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If a cause exists without an effect, an effect does not exist without a cause, because it arises in dependence on that cause.

original: de'i phyir gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces logs shig tu bstan par bya ba don dang dbang po ltar reg par ma gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa don dang dbang po la bltos pa med pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ces logs shig tu bstan par bya ba don dang dbang po ltar reg par ma gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa don dang dbang po la bltos pa med pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest consciousness that does not contact its object, like the object and sense faculty, that is, a consciousness that does not depend on the object and sense faculty, since it is taught separately as the group of six consciousnesses.

original: de lta bas na gsum bstan zin pas zhes bya bas ni yul dang @386a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsum bstan zin pas zhes bya bas ni yul dang @386a * //
translated: Thus, since the three are taught,

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag go //
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa dag go //
translated: the object, sense faculty, and consciousness are taught.

original: reg pa smos pa ni don med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg pa smos pa ni don med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement “The mention of contact is meaningless” is as follows.

original: dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa de dag kho na reg pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa de dag kho na reg pa yin la /
translated: Those sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses are contact.

original: de dag kyang bstan pas yang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bstan pa don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag kyang bstan pas yang reg pa'i tshogs drug ces bstan pa don med par 'gyur na /
translated: Since they are taught, the statement “The group of six contacts” is meaningless.

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: des na reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya bar khas blang par bya'o //
analyzed: des na reg pa ni 'dus pa las gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya bar khas blang par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be accepted that contact is something other than the assembly.

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that are the entities of cause and effect

original: ming dang gzugs sngar skyes pa dag dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa phyis skyes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas de dag kho na reg pa'i dngos por bzhag la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs sngar skyes pa dag dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa phyis skyes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pas de dag kho na reg pa'i dngos por bzhag la /
translated: Since earlier arising name-and-form and later arising eye consciousness are the entities of cause and effect, they alone are posited as the entity of contact.

original: mig la sogs pa gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de dag ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nyid du bstan te /🔽de dag kyang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / phan tshun chod pa snga phyir skyes pas so zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal  yin  te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de dag ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nyid du bstan te /🔽de dag kyang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / phan tshun chod pa snga phyir skyes pas so zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dpal  yin  te /
translated: Those that are cause and effect are taught to be the internal and external bases and the collections of consciousness.🔽The master Shrī states that those that are cause and effect are the simultaneous arising of the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses and those that are not simultaneous are earlier and later arising.

original: 'di la yang lan ni gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i dbang po dang don dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang lan ni gal te rnam par shes pa med pa'i dbang po dang don dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba de nyid yin no //
translated: The answer to this is the same as the one given above: “If the sense faculty and the object exist without consciousness. . . ”

original: de skad du mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni dang por mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de skad du mi 'don to zhes bya ba ni dang por mi byed kyi /
translated: “This is not the way it is read” means that it is not read in the first way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: “Well then, how is it read?”

original: chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel pa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshogs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o zhes lnga par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag 'brel pa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshogs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o zhes lnga par byed pa'o //
translated: “The coming together, meeting, and convergence of these three factors is contact.”

original: yang na ni 'di rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na ni 'di rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Or else, it is said that contact is the cause of the three.”

original: reg pa'i rgyu gsum 'dus pa ni reg par smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg pa'i rgyu gsum 'dus pa ni reg par smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the coming together of the three causes of contact is contact.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la mig la sogs pa dag ni rang gi yul du gzugs can gzhan skye ba la gegs byed pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la mig la sogs pa dag ni rang gi yul du gzugs can gzhan skye ba la gegs byed pas thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Because it is based on a sense faculty that is capable of contact” means that the eye and the other sense faculties are capable of contact because they obstruct the arising of other material entities in their own places.

original: gzhan dag na re thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu thogs pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu thogs pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Because it is supported by obstructed sense faculties and because it has obstructed objects that are exclusively physical objects.

original: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba ni lhas byin mchod sbyin zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming yin no zhes bya ba ni lhas byin mchod sbyin zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de /
translated: The term “name” is a designation for the name base.

original: de ni drug pa kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni drug pa kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the object of the sixth consciousness alone, not of others.

original: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pa'i @386b zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de lhag par 'di'i dmigs pa yin pa'i @386b zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To clearly demonstrate this, the root text states, “It is the object of the mental faculty alone.”

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni sgra las ma gtogs pa'i ming med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni sgra las ma gtogs pa'i ming med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “only” indicates that there is no name apart from sound.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par shes so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas ni sngon po rnam par shes kyi zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par shes so //
translated: The root text states, “Visual consciousness cognizes blue, but it does not cognize ‘This is blue.’”

original: sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ming gi sgo nas rnam par mi shes pa ste //
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba ni ming gi sgo nas rnam par mi shes pa ste //
translated: It is not known by the name blue, for it is not known by way of name.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because eye consciousness is non-conceptual.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi ngo bo dang ming gnyis ka'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi ngo bo dang ming gnyis ka'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Mental consciousness knows both its own nature and the name,

original: de'i ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is able to apprehend the connection between the name and the one who has the name.

original: / gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thogs pa'i reg pa ste /
analyzed: / gcig ni rten gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni thogs pa'i reg pa ste /
translated: One is distinguished by its basis,

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, impeded contact, because it is based on the sense faculty that is impeded.

original: gzhan dag na re rten dang dmigs pa rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro //🔽gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rten dang dmigs pa rab tu phye ba yin no zhes zer ro // gnyis pa ni dmigs pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig bla dags kyi reg pa ste /
translated: Others say it is distinguished by its basis and object.🔽The second is distinguished by its object,

original: lhag par tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par tshig bla dags kyi dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, contact that is a designation, because it has a special designation as its object.

original: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the verse, “from the point of view of words,”

original: tshig gi sgo nas tshig nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: tshig gi sgo nas tshig nges par gzung ste /
translated: words are grasped as words.

original: rnam par rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams ni ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'jug gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams ni ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptual thought engages the objects of form, etc., by means of the mental consciousness, but not by means of the five collections of consciousness, because they are devoid of conceptual thought.

original: yang na tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pas ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba la byang ba nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshig gi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pas ming dang ming can gyi 'brel ba la byang ba nyid kyis rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas bum pa dang snam bu zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Or, from the point of view of words, one understands by means of consciousness that a name is related to its bearer, because one is skilled in the relation between a name and its bearer through instruction.

original: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tshig bla dags so //
translated: Therefore, only the mental consciousness is the referent of the word.

original: gzhan dag na re kun nas slong ba'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tshig bla dags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun nas slong ba'i tshig gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na tshig bla dags so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that only the mental consciousness is the referent of the word because it engages from the point of view of the words that motivate it.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba la tshig bla dags ni yid yin la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rig pa ni tshig bla dags kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu phye ba yin no zhes bya ba la tshig bla dags ni yid yin la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rig pa ni tshig bla dags kyi rig pa'o //
translated: The term “mental faculty” is a designation for the mind. The consciousness that is associated with that is the consciousness of the mental faculty.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa dag mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pas de khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'o //🔽tshor ba dang bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / @387a * //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa dag mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pas de khyad par gyi khyad par du byas pa'o // tshor ba dang bde ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba bde ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / @387a * //
translated: Since neither consciousness nor ignorance are associated with the mental faculty, the term “mental faculty” is used to distinguish them.🔽Because it is compatible with pleasure.

original: tshor ba bde ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: This means that it is compatible with the feeling of pleasure, and it generates the feeling of pleasure.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: ji ltar de bya ba'am bya ba nus par bya par 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du de myang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar de bya ba'am bya ba nus par bya par 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du de myang bar bya ba'am /
translated: Just as it is said that the mental faculty is able to perform its function, in the same way, it is said that it is able to experience.

original: myang bar nus pa'i phyir myang bar 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: myang bar nus pa'i phyir myang bar 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: Because it is able to experience, it is called “experience.”

original: / de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug dang / thogs pa dang tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gnyis dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan gyi rig pa gsum dang /
analyzed: / de dag ni reg pa bcu drug yin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa drug dang / thogs pa dang tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gnyis dang / rig pa dang ma rig pa dang gzhan gyi rig pa gsum dang /
translated: The two types of contact are contact that is impeded and contact that is unimpeded.🔽The three types of contact are contact that is accompanied by knowledge, contact that is accompanied by ignorance, and contact that is accompanied by a state that is neither knowledge nor ignorance.🔽The two types of contact are contact that is accompanied by malice and contact that is accompanied by attachment.

original: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa gnyis dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnod sems dang rjes su chags pa'i reg pa gnyis dang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: The three types of contact are contact that is conducive to pleasure, contact that is conducive to displeasure, and contact that is conducive to neither pleasure nor displeasure.

original: de ltar de dag thams cad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag thams cad ni bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are sixteen types of contact in all.

original: reg pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to //🔽tshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la /🔽tshor ba myong ba zhes sngar tshor ba bshad zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to // tshor ba brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la / tshor ba myong ba zhes sngar tshor ba bshad zin pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The explanation of contact, together with its analysis, is now finished.🔽The Explanation of Feeling🔽Didn’t I already explain feeling in the above section on the essential nature of the heaps?

original: bshad pa bden mod kyi der ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yin gyi rab tu dbye bas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa bden mod kyi der ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas yin gyi rab tu dbye bas ni ma yin la /
translated: I did indeed, but that explanation was given in terms of the essential nature of feeling, not in terms of its analysis.

original: 'dir ni rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med de /
analyzed: 'dir ni rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir zlos pa'i skyon med de /
translated: But here, since it is the intention to teach by way of a classification, there is no fault of repetition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de las byung ba tshor ba drug ces smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de las byung ba tshor ba drug ces smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The six feelings arise from that.”

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na tshor ba gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na tshor ba gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: And those are, in brief, two feelings:

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: bodily and mental.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de dag las lnga ni lus kyi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag las lnga ni lus kyi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, “Five of those are bodily.”

original: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ste /
translated: Although mental, they are called bodily because they are based on material faculties.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir na lus kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir na lus kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa dag la 'jug go //
translated: The word “bodily” is used for the eye, etc., because they are a collection of atoms and because they are based on the body.

original: sems tsam brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni de las lhag pa'i rten bcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni de las lhag pa'i rten bcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on mind alone, it is called mental. The word “alone” is used to exclude any basis other than that.

original: lus kyi yang sems la brten pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: lus kyi yang sems la brten pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although bodily feeling is also based on mind,

original: sems tsam la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems tsam la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on mind alone,

original: de'i rten ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are also its basis.

original: yang ji ltar tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: yang ji ltar tshor ba reg pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: How is it that feeling arises subsequent to contact?

original: gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal bar mthong ba'i dri ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang 'gal bar mthong ba'i dri ba'o //
translated: This is a question that is seen to be contradictory in both ways.

original: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni kha cig na re skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pas ma 'ongs pa'i don du @387b yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni kha cig na re skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pas ma 'ongs pa'i don du @387b yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the future is so called because it is beyond the state of generating an effect.

original: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni reg pa dang dus mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshor ba ni reg pa dang dus mnyam pa yin te /
translated: Feeling is simultaneous with contact, because they are mutual coemergent causes,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: like other mental factors.

original: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por grub ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por grub ces bya ba la /
translated: How is it established that two coemergent factors are the generator and the generated?

original: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: The state of being a generator is the state of being a generator.

original: 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to generate an effect.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
translated: The entity that is to be produced is the entity that is to be produced.

original: bdag nyid du ma reg pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid du ma reg pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not yet in existence.

original: de lta yin dang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni skyes pa dang ma skyes ba dag la grub kyi skyes zin pa dag kho na la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po ni skyes pa dang ma skyes ba dag la grub kyi skyes zin pa dag kho na la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then the entity that is the producer and the entity that is the produced are established as arisen and not yet arisen, but not as just arisen.🔽The opponent thinks that the entity that is the producer and the entity that is the produced are not seen to be contradictory in the case of two things that occur simultaneously.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po mi 'gal bar mthong ste 'dri ba ni ji ltar mi 'grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po mi 'gal bar mthong ste 'dri ba ni ji ltar mi 'grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: The question is, “How is it not established?”

original: mthu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is powerless.

original: skyes zin pa bdag nyid thob pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: skyes zin pa bdag nyid thob pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus te /
translated: That which has already arisen and has attained its own nature is not able to be produced again.

original: de'i phyir de la bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not have the power to produce it.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir chos skyes zin pa la ni chos kyi nus pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says, “There is no power of a dharma in a dharma that has already arisen.”

original: dam bcas pa dang / bye brag med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gang zhig dam bcas pas nye bar gzung ba de nyid gtan tshigs kyi tshig gis kyang gzung bas dam bcas pa dang bye brag med do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang / bye brag med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don gang zhig dam bcas pas nye bar gzung ba de nyid gtan tshigs kyi tshig gis kyang gzung bas dam bcas pa dang bye brag med do //
translated: The statement “there is no difference between the thesis and the reason” means that the reason’s words also grasp the very object that is held by the thesis.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis zhes rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis zhes rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “Two co-occurring things . . .”

original: phan tshun bsgrub bya sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba dang khyad par med de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun bsgrub bya sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba dang khyad par med de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is no difference between the thesis and the reason because they are mutually established.

original: gal te dam bca' ba dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba dang bye brag med pa'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If, because there is no difference between the thesis and the reason, this is not a proof,

original: 'o na ni phan tshun skyed par byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /🔽gang las 'dir gcig kho na skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni phan tshun skyed par byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te / gang las 'dir gcig kho na skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: then it follows that they are mutually productive.🔽Because, from this, it follows that one is the producer and the other is not.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni 'ga' yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni 'ga' yang 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no cause for this distinction whatsoever.

original: de lta yin na reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis phan tshun skyed byed nyid du thal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin na reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis phan tshun skyed byed nyid du thal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal lo //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that contact and feeling would be mutually generative, and that contradicts dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig tu 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por mi rigs so //🔽gnas skabs pa nyid kyi phyir rten cing @388a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig tu 'byung ba gnyis skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba'i dngos por mi rigs so // gnas skabs pa nyid kyi phyir rten cing @388a * //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that two things that occur simultaneously are a generator and generated.

original: 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal bar blta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal bar blta ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they are momentary, they are seen to contradict dependent origination.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes smos so //🔽mdo las mi bzhed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de zhes smos so // mdo las mi bzhed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since we assert that, there is no fault.🔽The sūtras do not state that they are mutually generative.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba'i gnas skabs dag kho na phan tshun skyed par byed pa nyid du mdo las mi bzhed pa 'di 'ba' zhig ston par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba'i gnas skabs dag kho na phan tshun skyed par byed pa nyid du mdo las mi bzhed pa 'di 'ba' zhig ston par ma zad kyi /
translated: The sūtras do not state that the two states of contact and feeling are mutually generative.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what do they state?

original: mu khya yor mi reg pa dang tshor ba dag phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du yang mi bzhed pa ste /
analyzed: mu khya yor mi reg pa dang tshor ba dag phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du yang mi bzhed pa ste /
translated: The sūtras do not state that contact and feeling are results of each other.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes rgya cher mdo las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa zhes rgya cher mdo las 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra says: “The contact of the eye” and so on.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Saṃghabhadra says:

original: reg pa rnam pa gnyis te /🔽btags par yod pa dang / rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa rnam pa gnyis te / btags par yod pa dang / rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of contact:🔽nominal and substantial.

original: de la btags par yod pa ni /
analyzed: de la btags par yod pa ni /
translated: Nominal contact is

original: ji skad bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa ste /
translated: as explained above.

original: gang 'di chos gsum rnams 'grogs pa dang 'dus pa dang tshogs pa las 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di chos gsum rnams 'grogs pa dang 'dus pa dang tshogs pa las 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: It is the contact that arises from the coming together, meeting, and convergence of three things.

original: rdzas su yod pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga phyi rol dang bcas pa'i ming dang gzugs te /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga phyi rol dang bcas pa'i ming dang gzugs te /
translated: Substantial contact is the five collections of consciousness together with their external bases, that is, name-and-form.

original: 'di gnyis dang gnyis la nges par brten nas reg pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang gnyis la nges par brten nas reg pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen te /
translated: Contact is the condition of these two, that is, name-and-form.

original: de bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, contact is the condition of the six sense bases.

original: de la gang 'di btags bar yod pa ni tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de la gang 'di btags bar yod pa ni tshor ba dang bcas pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod do //
translated: Nominal contact is not accepted as a condition for feeling.

original: tshor ba ni de'i rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba ni de'i rkyen nyid do //
translated: Feeling is the condition for craving.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa tshogs pa rnams tshor ba la brten nas skye ba med do //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa tshogs pa rnams tshor ba la brten nas skye ba med do //
translated: The collection of eye, form, and eye consciousness does not arise in dependence on feeling.

original: de lta mod kyi shes pa skye bas mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid mig gi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi shes pa skye bas mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid mig gi 'dus te reg pa ma yin no //
translated: However, since consciousness arises, the eye consciousness itself is not the contact of the eye.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni sems las byung ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag kyang tshor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni sems las byung ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig dang gzugs dag kyang tshor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo ste /
translated: In that regard, since consciousness is the basis of mental factors, the eye and form are the primary causes of feeling.

original: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis brjod do //
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis brjod do //
translated: They are described as the causes of the arising of feeling.

original: btags par yod pa'i tshor ba ni mdo las phan tshun bskyed bya dang skyed byed kyi ngo bo bkag pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i tshor ba ni mdo las phan tshun bskyed bya dang skyed byed kyi ngo bo bkag pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: The feeling that exists as a designation does not contradict the sutra, because the sutra refutes the essence of that which is mutually generated and that which generates.

original: rdzas su yod pa ni sems las byung ba'i reg pa yang dag par myong ba las tshor ba dang lhan cig phan tshun rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni sems las byung ba'i reg pa yang dag par myong ba las tshor ba dang lhan cig phan tshun rkyen yin no //
translated: That which exists substantially is the contact of mental factors. It is the condition of each other simultaneously with feeling.

original: reg pa ni sems las byung ba ste de'i 'bras bur gyur pa las tshor ba dang lhan cig pa'i dngos por mi rigs te /
analyzed: reg pa ni sems las byung ba ste de'i 'bras bur gyur pa las tshor ba dang lhan cig pa'i dngos por mi rigs te /
translated: Contact is a mental factor, and it is not logical that its result would be a thing that is simultaneous with it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be beyond being a phenomenon that produces.

original: skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis cig car ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang bskyed par bya ba gnyis cig car ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not established that that which produces and that which is produced are simultaneous,

original: sa bon dang myu gu @388b bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu @388b bzhin no //
translated: like a seed and a sprout.

original: snga phyi'i dngos po yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las byung ba rnams kyis skyed par byed pa yin no //🔽dgag pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni 'di la rig pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: snga phyi'i dngos po yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las byung ba rnams kyis skyed par byed pa yin no // dgag pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni 'di la rig pa yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Not only is there no simultaneity, but also form and so on are produced by the primary elements.🔽What is the refutation?

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yod mod /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lung yod mod /
translated: There is no knowledge of this, and there is no scripture that states, “It is not like that.”

original: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag dang / mar me dang 'od dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni myu gu dang grib ma dag dang / mar me dang 'od dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba la /
translated: Well then, it is like the relationship between a sprout and its shade, or a lamp and its light.

original: gal te skad cig ma dang po la grib ma med pa dang 'od med par 'gyur na ni de ltar lnga phyi'i dngos por rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma dang po la grib ma med pa dang 'od med par 'gyur na ni de ltar lnga phyi'i dngos por rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the first moment of the sprout were without shade and without light, then it would be an external thing.

original: 'gyur pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: 'gyur pa yang ma yin te //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir myu gu dang mar me ni grib ma dang 'od lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu dang mar me ni grib ma dang 'od lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the sprout and the lamp are the causes of the shade and the light, respectively, which occur simultaneously with them.

original: 'dir yang rgyu'i tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho nar mar me 'od dang bcas pa dang / myu gu grib ma dang bcas pa'i rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu'i tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho nar mar me 'od dang bcas pa dang / myu gu grib ma dang bcas pa'i rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the mere prior assemblage of causes is the cause of the lamp with its light and of the sprout with its shade?

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang / rnam par 'gyur pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa dag kyang de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang / rnam par 'gyur pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / yod pa dang med pa dag kyang de dag gi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, because it conforms to the movement and the stillness of the sprout, and because its existence and nonexistence are dependent on the existence and nonexistence of the sprout,🔽the shade is the effect of the sprout.

original: myu gu dang mar me dang grib ma dang 'od gnyis kyis skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: myu gu dang mar me dang grib ma dang 'od gnyis kyis skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The light is the effect of the lamp,🔽because it conforms to the movement and the stillness of the lamp, and because its existence and nonexistence are dependent on the existence and nonexistence of the lamp.

original: 'od mar me'i yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'od mar me'i yin pa'am /
translated: The light is the cause of the lamp,🔽because it conforms to the movement and the stillness of the lamp, and because its existence and nonexistence are dependent on the existence and nonexistence of the lamp.

original: grib ma myu gu'i yin no zhes bya bar ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grib ma myu gu'i yin no zhes bya bar ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to prove that the shadow belongs to the sprout.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung bar des na ni /🔽gang gis na reg pa'i rkyen kho nas tshor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag lhan cig 'byung bar des na ni / gang gis na reg pa'i rkyen kho nas tshor ba yin gyi /
translated: Since contact and feeling occur simultaneously,🔽there is no such cause that would allow one to understand that feeling is conditioned by contact alone,

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba rgyu de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba rgyu de 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: but contact is not conditioned by feeling.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an inappropriate example.

original: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste zhes zer ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba 'byung ste zhes zer ba ni slob dpon dpal len te /
translated: Others say that feeling occurs after contact.

original: de ltar na 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dus pa ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the opinion of the master Haribhadra, who says that the assembly of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness is a causal relationship, but not a simultaneous relationship,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause and effect occur at different times.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyis ni de dag gi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa bas snga la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyis ni de dag gi 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa bas snga la /
translated: Because cause and effect are not simultaneous, the two sense faculties and their objects are earlier than the consciousness that is their effect.

original: de'i mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su skad cig ma gnyis pa la ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The second moment is the consciousness that arises immediately after that.
